campaign.story:
If you're wondering what's the difference between the last version and the final design, take a look at the eyebrows. When Kay and everyone at Oni saw the last version, we all shouted perfect (almost)! We sent the design back with one subtle but important change: Chamomile needs to be a lot grumpier. We need him to look like we accidentally woke him up from a really good nap and he is not happy about it at all. Once that change was made, we found our perfect Mountain Chamomile. 
The Mountain Chamomile plushie and woven blanket shown are prototypes and the final versions may be slightly different. The final blanket will be 50" x 60". 
If you're looking for add-ons, don't worry! We've got you covered.  If you back at any level (even the $1.00 pledge), you'll be able to add individual plushies to your pledge through Backerkit once the campaign ends, as well as the blanket, game, and books.
PLAY

One of the greatest things about being in the comics and games industry is that throughout the year, we get the opportunity to interact directly with the fans at conventions all across the world. These events give us an outlet to create specialty items that we think fans will treasure, but that are prohibitive to make for retail. This year, we didn't have that opportunity, so many of the projects, like Mountain Chamomile, had to be postponed.

With Kickstarter, we have the ability to reach our fans directly and bring our creative projects to life. Literally every backer makes a difference and with enough backers, we can continue to connect with fans, share our process, and offer a variety of fun rewards.
Kay O'Neill is an Eisner and Harvey Award-winning illustrator and graphic novelist from New Zealand. They are the author of Princess Princess Ever After, Aquicorn Cove, The Tea Dragon Society, The Tea Dragon Festival, and Dewdrop, all from Oni Press. They mostly make gentle fantasy stories for younger readers, and are very interested in tea, creatures, things that grow, and the magic of everyday life.
Oni Press / Lion Forge Publishing Group is a premier comic book, graphic novel, and games publisher located in Portland, Oregon. Established in 1997, Oni Press’s curated line includes a variety of award-winning original and licensed comic books and graphic novels, including: Adult Swim’s Rick and Morty™, Nickelodeon’s Invader ZIM, Scott Pilgrim, Queen & Country, Courtney Crumrin, Wasteland, The Sixth Gun, Stumptown, Wet Moon, Letter 44, The Bunker, The Tea Dragon Society, The Coldest City, and Kaijumax.
Please note that shipping is not included in the prices. Shipping will be charged in the pledge manager based on where you live and on which rewards and add-ons you purchase. We've included a chart for estimated shipping costs with our reward levels and different shipping regions. Whenever possible, we'll bundle items together to save you shipping costs. 

Please note that taxes are also not included in the prices. We are required to collect and pay taxes in specific states and countries. If ordering from California or Missouri, taxes will be added in the pledge manager. If ordering from Canada, VAT will be added to your overall purchase in the pledge manager.  
What is Backerkit?
Backerkit is a crowdfunding software tool that helps us make sure you get exactly what you want and are charged correctly.

When will this happen?
You will get an email survey 2-3 weeks after the campaign is over providing a link to a Backerkit survey. In the survey, you’ll add your shipping info and reward preferences and grab any add-ons to see the overall shipping and tax costs.

How much will I pay?
The total cost will be the value of all the items in your BackeKit cart, plus shipping and applicable taxes, minus what you were already charged in Kickstarter through your pledge.

How Much Do I Pledge Now?
Take a gander at the banners on the right side of page and click on your preferred reward level. Looking for add-ons? No worries! As soon as you receive your email from Backerkit, you'll be able to add as many plushies, books, and blankets as your heart desires.
 Music: Bensound.com
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
For the Alpine plushie, we've been working closely with Kay O'Neill and the manufacturer to perfect the grumpiest face ever. 

The two main risks for this Kickstarter are unexpected delays in manufacturing or shipping. With a project of this size, customs can sometimes also cause delays in shipping. If the project is highly successful, materials could also take longer for our manufacturer to obtain, although larger orders usually mean faster production. Overseas holidays can also cause a delay in either shipping or manufacturing. We're working with an established manufacturer, one we've been partnered with for three adorable plushies so far. We will always keep everyone updated with all stages of production and shipping, and if there are any delays, you'll be the first to know.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Clear communication is important to me as a business owner, so I want to be as transparent as possible with all the relevant updates and issues. 

I have worked with this manufacturer before and have open and clear communication with them, so I am hoping and anticipating we should not have any issues. But if I do, I will be sure to update you all. 
All backers will receive at least a standard grade - that is, with minor scratches or imperfections, if any, that should not be noticeable upon general examination. 

Please also note that the colors shown in the pictured designs may vary depending on your monitor’s calibration, and the actual size and color may differ slightly in person. It's possible that there may be minor detail changes if certain aspects don't translate well to the physical product! 

Due to the pandemic, shipping services may still be delayed and the rewards may take some more time to arrive to you, especially international backers. I also may not be able to ship to your country if borders are not open. Please check with your local post office to see if your country accepts mail from Germany. 

We are also not responsible for any taxes, claims, or additional fees that your country may have. 

Thank you again for stopping by and supporting this campaign! Please share this around if you believe in it, and feel free to message me with any questions, comments, and concerns.

Hi! My name is Amber Stone. I'm a watercolor artist who loves all things cute and creepy!  
This is my 2nd Enamel Pin Kickstarter and it's going to be a short and sweet Kickstarter to try and bring my "I'm Vaccinated " Pin to life.
My goal is to keep costs low so that people can get multiples and share them with family members, co-workers and friends! Because of that, there will be very few freebies but we might work in some unlockables!
This list of Pins has gotten LONG! So here's a quick pic to show you what is already Unlocked! 
The pins in the "Unlocked Pins" section are available as choices for any Tier. 
The Pins in the "Unlocked Add-ons" section can be added on the Add-On Screen. They will not be part of the Tier choices and can only be Added.  
Everything is Unlocked! Please refer to the specific sections to see which pins are Add-On Only and which can be part of your pledge. ^_^
Everyone who orders any Pins through the Kickstarter will receive the Zeke Creepy But Cute Sticker as my Thank You!

UK Backers: Please Pledge at the $1 UK Level to reserve Kickstarter pricing/guarantee any Freebies we may unlock.  Once the Kickstarter has completed, you will be asked to place a pre-order through Etsy so that VAT taxes can be remitted. 
EU Backers: You may back as normal!
Pins will be UNLOCKED as we hit each goal. Even if a pin you want is Locked, pledging will help us unlock the next one! You can alter your pledge any time before the campaign ends. 
All tiers can pick from any UNLOCKED pins (even the variants) through backer surveys at the end of the Kickstarter.
As the Campaign goes on, we may Unlock Special Add-On Only Pins that will be available through Add-Ons or Special Tiers. These Pins will be clearly marked as Add-Ons so that there is no confusion.
Extra pins and stickers can be added from the add-ons screen once you've pledged.
You can also add on any of the pins, stickers or washi tape from my previous campaign as well as the Patreon unlocks and 2 new werewolves, Ginger and Ghost. 
Note: Not all items below are to scale with one another. If you have size questions, please ask or refer to my website or previous Kickstarter. Both will have sizes listed for the Add-On Items. ^_^

campaign.story:
A Note for UK Backers:
Due to VAT restrictions, if you are in the UK and wish to back the project, you can do so on Etsy. If the Kickstarter goal is not met, you will be refunded!
Hello and welcome! I am Ulala Lili, known as The Lily Mage on Instagram. This is my second time producing enamel pins and my first project on Kickstarter. This magical set features three Victorian-inspired mages— the Chronomancer, the Necromancer, and the Astromancer. Each design features gold metal, raised backstamp, and glitter embellishments. 

By backing this project on Kickstarter, you are funding the manufacture of these items as well as receiving them at a discounted price. Pledging is risk-free— you will only be charged if the goal is reached. 

Unlock all the designs to bring your favorite Sorceress home! All pledges with rewards will receive a free mini sticker of one of the Sorceress designs as a bonus item. If all three pin designs are unlocked, additional stretch goals will be added!



Stretch Goals are additional rewards that are unlocked after the initial goals are met. Once the goal amount has been reached, the Stretch Goal items can be added to any reward tier.

Please note that Stretch Goals are not automatically included in "The Sorceress Collection" reward tier. To add an item, please edit your reward amount. 

Add extra items to your rewards at any time by editing your pledge! 
3 inch Holographic Die-Cut Sticker (Add $3.00)
Choose from either the Chronomancer, the Necromancer, the Astromancer, or the Cryomancer! All designs unlock when initial goal is met.

"Martha" Enamel Pin Special Discount! (Add $11.00)
Just for Kickstarter backers, you can add the "Martha" pin (standard grade) from The Lily Mage Store and save $3!


Timeline
Enamel Pin Production: manufacturing the pins will take approximately 3 to 6 weeks, allowing extra time for possible shipping delays due to the pandemic
Sticker Printing: stickers will take approximately 1 to 3 weeks to print and ship
Shipping out Rewards: once all reward items arrive, pins will be graded and all items shipped within 1-3 weeks
Delays can always happen due to issues with manufacturing, shipping, or processing. I will do whatever I can to keep the timeline on schedule in order to deliver high-quality items to you in a timely manner. My goal is quality items, and I will prioritize getting them done right rather than getting them done quickly. I will keep all backers up to date on the process!

Thank you!
Without your support, this project would not be possible. I appreciate you, you are magical!

There may be delays to shipping due to the pandemic, but I am happy to work with you to resolve delivery issues that you may experience.

campaign.story:
Available in multiple languages (Spanish, French, Chinese, AND GERMAN)! See the Licensing section for details!
Engage the Nazi occupation of France in la petite guerre to throw off the yoke of the oppressors and free your homeland!
Maquis is a solitaire worker-placement game with variable goals and a play time of approximately twenty minutes. The player places their resistance agents on spaces around town to achieve their goals - blowing up trains, publishing underground newspapers - but at the same time Milice collaborators and Wehrmacht soldiers patrol the area. Agents who can't make it back to the safe house at the end of the day are arrested, and never seen again.
With this new edition, we've added some new components to include some more difficult 3-star missions, some new spare rooms and resources, and made some tweaks to the rules & original components to improve clarity and gameplay.
For previous backers/customers who got the 1st edition, we have the option on this campaign to order the new components to add to your original game (Backer Level "Maquis - New Content"). They'll be fully compatible and will fit into the original box (with some maneuvering 😊), or you can keep them in the nice tuck box they'll ship in.
NOTE:  We only plan on printing what we need of the "Maquis - New Content" level so there is no guarantee that folks who don't back the Kickstarter will receive the new content separately. Don't miss out!



To begin, the player will set up the board, organize the game tokens and  randomly choose two mission cards that must be completed in the allotted number of turns.

The player will then shuffle the patrol deck and place it next to the side of the board. This deck represents where the Milice patrols will occur during each day.

The player will choose a location to send their first worker and assign one of their pawns there. They then draw a patrol card, and place a Milice pawn if able. This continues until all of the available worker pawns and Milice pawns are placed. If the Milice find your worker during patrol, they will be arrested!
Your diligent workers are then free to perform their duties, working toward your two goals. Gather resources, recruit fellow patriots to the cause, and undermine the enemy plans to throw off the yoke of oppression and free your homeland!

For our EU backers, all pledges will be fulfilled from the EU. We are closely monitoring what's happening with the trade deal with the UK and EU resulting from Brexit and we'll make sure that effective, customs friendly shipping will be available for everyone.
For backers in the rest of the world (including the US), pledges will be shipped from China either directly to you or through a local partner. This allows us to offer affordable shipping to everyone across the globe.

updates.update_userinfo: The inside track on the turn track
updates.update_content: Hi - game designer here. Let's be clear to the people worrying that a "fix" isn't happening to the 2nd printing board because of complaints: there was no "fix" in the first place, really. And to the people worrying that SRG are caving in to complaints - well, kind of, but the complaints came from me. This isn't just a reactionary response to a few people moaning in the comments, this is the game designer stepping in and saying that this isn't really as good change to make as it first seemed. What follows is a probably-overly-long explanation from me, just in case anyone wants to be reassured as to what this change is (and isn't), how this came about, and how it's mostly my fault anyway. ;-)

Hey everyone! We wanted to follow up yesterday's update and the subsequent comments. Due to an internal miscommunication and as a result of extended discussion, we've decided to keep the Day track for 2nd edition the same as it was in the 1st edition. The main goal of this is to maintain consistency between editions.
While there is some confusion on the Day track, we're confident that we can clarify the intended mechanics in the updated rules. This achieves 2 goals:
 1) Everyone will be on the same page when it comes to rules questions.
 2) If/when we release content in the future, there won't be any backwards compatibility issues.

updates.update_userinfo: Changes to 2nd Edition & Foreign Version Shipping Info
updates.update_content:
Hey everyone! Coming into the last few days of the campaign and we've blown past our previous records for number of backers & funds raised! We can't thank everyone enough for the amazing support. It'll be interesting to see where we end up at!
We wanted to let everyone know that we will be making a minor change that will effect the board, and a few cards. We feel the second edition is the perfect opportunity to make these adjustments that we overlooked during the lead up to the first Kickstarter. After a lot of deliberation between Jake (the designer) and the rest of the SRG team, we've decided to adjust the day tracker on the main board. As the game morphed from Jake's original print & play (PnP) design to the first edition, the day tracker became a little confusing. In the PnP and first editions, the day track marks "completed days". This wasn't an issue for any of the original PnP missions, but some of the newer ones require you to complete objectives on or before certain days. This leads to some counter-intuitive situations where, for example, your marker is on day 6 for that turn but you're actually in the middle of day 7.

Hey everyone! Again, just wow!!! We slammed through our previous best on number of backers and I think we'll cruise past our previous best in funding level. Can't thank everyone enough for all of the support - we truly appreciate it!

campaign.story:
Hello! I am Dinojar, and this is my fourth Kickstarter Campaign!
I'm super excited to run this Kickstarter and I hope you will enjoy them as well! By supporting me through this campaign, not only you will see these designs be brought to life, but you will also get huge discount! Any leftover products will retail in my shop at higher price.
How does Kickstarter work?
 Pledge NOW and Pay LATER at the end of the campaign! You can always change your pledge anytime during the campaign. You'll only be charged if the funding goal is met.
 If we succeed, Kickstarter will process your payment once the campaign is over on Feb, 4th. Surveys will be sent at the end of the campaign to choose your rewards.
Click the 'Back this project' button and choose the tier you would like. You can select your add-ons after you have chosen the main rewards.
Total of 12 Designs for you to choose from! You will get the FREE mini pin if you pledge 5 or more pins!
You can also get additional mini pin by selecting it from the rewards and add-ons!
Pin Specifications
Gold Plated Hard Enamel Pins
2 Rubber Clutches (1 for mini pin)
Standard Pins: ~ 1.25 to 1.4 inches height 
Mini Pin: ~1 inch height 
Mounted to beautifully designed Backing Card
Acrylic Charm Specifications
Golden "Star" keychain clasp
Double Sided
Height ~ 1.5 inches  
 What are Hard Enamel Pins & Acrylic Charms?
Hard enamel pins (lapel pins/brooch) are decorative art that can be worn or otherwise displayed. They have raised metal lines forming the 'line art' and the recessed sections between the lines are filled with colourful hard enamel. The piece is then polished smoothly so it can be at the same level as the metal lines.
Acrylic charms are made with a solid, clear acrylic material that can be printed in full color and cut to any shape.
Past Campaign Pins
Past Campaign Acrylic Charms
 Due to popular demand, you can add past campaigns' pins and stickers as add-ons.
How do we know which design you would like?
At the end of the campaign period, we will send you a survey form for you to indicate the design you would like. You will be able to indicate which pins, charms, stickers or add-ons you desire.
 22 Jan - Kickstarter campaign starts and runs for 14 days.
 04 Feb - Campaign ends. Backer surveys are sent out afterward to your email (to indicate your choice of pins, charms, stickers, and add-ons).
 18 Feb - We receive the fund pledge from Kickstarter. (2 weeks after the campaign ends). Production begins.
 Mar/Apr - Pins, charms, and stickers expected to reach me - I will proceed with quality checks and grading.
 Apr/May - Pins, charms, and stickers will be shipped to backers.
I really thank all of you for making this dream come through! This project could never become a reality without your support! I would be honored if you share the project with your family and friends!
~ Love, Dinojar | Instagram
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
REWARDS
The final pins may vary slightly from the designs shown here. Every single pin is handmade, there is expected to be minor defects or flaws. Standard grade pins will be used to fulfill pledges and these pins may have minor defects that are only visible under extremely close inspection. Pins with more noticeable flaws are lower grade and will NOT be used to fulfill pledges. The actual color or size of the pins may differ a little from the descriptions, but I'm confident that any differences will be minimal. I am working closely with an established manufacturer, to ensure smooth fulfillment of all the orders.

TIMELINE
Delays in shipping and production of pins may occur when creating enamel pins. This may happen because of production errors and manufacturing defects. If there are any delays, all backers will be immediately updated!

FULFILLMENT
I will update here on Kickstarter and Instagram so that backers have an idea when their rewards will be shipped out (you can change the shipping details if needed up until then). Please double check your address to reduce the chance of a package being lost! Once a package is mailed, it is out of my control but I will do my best to assist and accommodate for any lost packages for TRACKED shipment. We always encourage you to upgrade by adding TRACKING to the shipping with a small fee for peace of mind.

ADDITIONAL FEES
Backers outside of the SG are responsible for any and all customs fees, import taxes, VAT, GST, or other additional costs associated with importing goods into their country, and those costs are NOT included in their pledge or shipping cost.

REFUNDS & CANCELLATIONS
Once the campaign is complete, refunds or cancellations will not be issued for any reason. Please fully read over the campaign, and only pledge if you understand & accept the above-estimated timeline and risks!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

My name is Jess of JellyJessBeans and you can find me on Instagram for more designs and art I make. I have experience making an enamel pin previously so I know what to expect from my manufacturer and have trust in their quality. if you would like to see my previous pin you can find it on my Etsy store.  You can also check out my design process and information about the Zodiacs on my TikTok. I have been drawing most of my life, and have decided I wanted to pursue my passion, so here I am! Thank you so much for taking a moment of your time to look at my campaign!
This project aims to fund the manufacturing of the below pins. The pins are all hard enamel, gold plated, at approx. 2 inches tall. They will have two pin posts and come with rubber clutches and will be sent with backer cards that are custom designed for each of the mermaids.
 In the line-up below you can see the pin artwork of each of the mermaids that will be sent to the manufacturers. Below them are each of the backer cards for each of the pins. The cards will be roughly 3 inches tall and will be white, with gold foil to give them that extra special touch! If you would like to see the illustrations of each of the mermaids, please head over to my Instagram to view them all!

I am also offering freebies for certain pledge tiers!
If you order 6 or more pins, you will receive a 5x5 inch print of the illustration of each of the pins you want!
The initial funding target for the pins is $1300 which allows me to fund the manufacturing, shipping and fees on the first three of the zodiac sign pins! If this goal is exceeded we can start working towards unlocking the next nine pins! For those of you who are curious about how the costs get broken down or where the money goes here is a rough breakdown:
Pin Production: ~70%
Fulfilment and Shipping: ~20%
Kickstarter/Transaction Fees: 10%

Thank you for looking over my campaign! If you can't back the project right now, sharing this Kickstarter on social media is a great help! I'll be posting updates here and on Instagram!
All pins have been unlocked! Whether you pledge before or after they are unlocked doesn't matter, but you may miss out on the Early Bird specials if you wait too long! At the end of the campaign, regardless of when you pledged, you will be able to choose between any of the pins that we have unlocked. You will also be entitled to any additional freebies we have unlocked by the end of the campaign! This includes the Kickstarter exclusive 1.5 inch mermaid pin for free!
I have even partnered with two Etsy shops to make custom designed pin boards for the project! They come in 13 inch and 18 inch variants which you can check out below the mermaids. campaign.story:
I love cube rails games. There's something about weird, interesting, emergent gameplay, shared incentives, and cubes stretching across a hex map that brings me joy.
Unsure what a cube rails game is? That's okay. Some of the most popular titles are Chicago Express, Paris Connection, Irish Gauge, Ride the Rails, and more. These are 30-60 minute games of route-building, share-purchasing, & railroad-investing.
While games in the genre can sound similar, cube rails titles have a long history of doing all sorts of weird stuff: 8 to 16-hour games of logistics in Union vs Central, the meta-think of Northern Pacific's player order, and the entirely wild random share ride of Erie Railroad.
I wanted to do something different as well.
Card Rails is a 3-5 player, 20-30 minute cube rails game played on a deck of cards. Instead of giving you a predesignated map, players together create the landscape of the game they are playing, blocking others and bettering their own positions, all while making the tough decision to keep a card for future financial gain or to garner an immediate reward.
 CARDS INSTEAD OF A BOARD? 
Based on player count, you will have a specific number of cards in hand. Each card is different and has lots of information on it. Cards are comprised of hexes, and there are different types of hexes:
Basic green hexes
Purple hexes that add value to the Railroad Company
Red hexes that let you swap out cards in your hand
Blue Lake hexes that block where you can go
Special hexes with Railroad Symbols that majorly increase the value of a Railroad Company
A Share of the Brown Company with a Red Swap Hex and an impassable Lake Hex in the middle
A White share conveniently located in the middle of the card with a Purple +2 Value Hex just below it. But those two 1/2 Lake Hexes could be tricky to build around.
ON YOUR TURN: Take a Share or Build Track.
Take a Share. This is how you get points. Without shares, you don't score anything!
Discard a card from your hand.
Take an available share of a company. That's it.
However, you can only have 3 shares in total.
Oh, and cards remaining in your hand at the end of the game also count as shares of companies, so discard wisely.

Build Track. This is how you increase the value of companies. Without high values, you won't score enough points to win!
Discard* a card from your hand.
Take 1 or 2 cubes from any available Railroads and place them on the map, expanding their lines.
*Are you building into a 1/2 hex (like the purple above)? Then play the card you were going to discard onto the map where you're building into. The hex on the card you play has to match, but nothing else does. Rotate the card to block your opponents.
Build into a Purple hex or a hex with that Railroad's matching symbol? That company's value increases at the end of the game.
Build into a Red Swap hex? Exchange a card from your hand for any discarded card.
HOW TO WIN
The game continues until all players have a certain number of cards left in hand, dependent on player count. Then players:
Total up the value of each Railroad
Reveal the cards in their hands
Multiply the Railroads' values with the number of shares they have (both as cubes taken earlier and the symbols of the cards in their hands).
The player with the highest total wins!
Rules Translations

Spanish
French
Portuguese 
Card Rails is a 54-card cube rails game that comes with 60 8mm wooden cubes. It will come in a tuckbox that holds all of the cubes, too.

 Do you own a ton of cube rails titles? This is perfect for you because you can provide your own cubes.

 THE PHYSICAL CARD RAILS: $20 
You receive the physical game: 54 bridge-sized cards and 60 8mm wooden cubes shipped to your mailbox.
Shipping is covered.
Unfortunately, there is no international shipping on this project.
You receive the PDF Print & Play file delivered to your inbox.
Prototype Copy
Fair Warning: This section might upset some people.
This is a Make 100 project. I am only making 100 copies of Card Rails. If you missed out, I'm so sorry. If this does well, it shows me there is a desire for these small box games. More than likely, I will open up preorders for a summer release, you know, when I'm not in the middle of being a public educator in America during a pandemic.
Due to the volatile nature of the USPS right now, and because this is a short, small project, it's only shipping to the US. Are you international? It'd be cheaper to grab the Print & Play anyways. 
You can only get one copy of the game. Not two or three or all 100. So, no add-ons.
No Stretch Goals either. This campaign is only going for 5 days.

campaign.story:
ShadowCast is the simplest way to play console games on your computer. TVs aren’t always convenient so we made a way to take console gaming with you wherever you are without the need of an internet connection.       



As lifelong console gamers, we know there may be some PC master race gamers who gawk at the idea of playing Mario on their powerful gaming computer.  But we say the more games we can play, on even more platforms, the better! 
Seamless console docking to your laptop. It's that simple!
Laptops are Really Versatile Screens
The biggest benefit of course is to take advantage of the screen you’re always carrying already.  Not one of those additional portable monitors but a laptop that we use daily for like… school, work, shopping and creative stuff. 
ShadowCast completely hides in the shadows of the original Switch dock!
Let's imagine a time before 2020... and you were waiting at an airport for a flight to board and you wanted to get a couple rounds of Smash Bros in with a friend… or two… or three. Tabletop mode is nice… but let’s just say it’s not the most ergonomic. With ShadowCast you can easily plug your Nintendo Switch to your laptop and play on a screen over 4x the size.
Not quite as easy as adjusting the viewing angle of a laptop, is it?
You Could Always use Another TV
There's also many situations where there just isn’t a HDMI display available - many of us are happy with our laptops and integrated desktop computers. I think back to the times when I lived in a dorm room or even living abroad for brief periods where having my laptop, a PS5, and a ShadowCast would’ve been amazing. 
Works with current-gen and next-gen with up to 4K input
And then there’s always competing for the living room television - whether it’s someone in your household streaming a whole season of the latest Netflix series or just having another gamer in the household. Oh and it also makes having a second television for multiplayer that much more convenient to set up. 
PS5 on an iMac - when a TV just simply isn't available
Our App Makes the Difference
Accompanying the ShadowCast is our new Genki Arcade app. We literally have made it easier than reaching for the TV remote and hitting the "input" button. We've designed Genki Arcade from the ground up to minimize computing resources and prioritize latency for gaming performance. Just open the app, and it'll auto detect ShadowCast and you'll be playing immediately without any settings to fiddle with.
TV vs. ShadowCast - HDMI splitter shows a 0-0.02s difference in Smash Bros.
Genki Arcade (left) is 50ms faster than OBS (right) and uses less than 1/3 of the CPU
We've developed a native Mac OS app that's optimized for both Apple Silicon and Intel processors as well as a dedicated app for Windows. Additionally, we're in the process of making a web browser version that allows you to play on shared/public computers and other systems without installing any software (compatibility will vary, for example iPadOS currently doesn’t detect external video devices but we’re confident it will someday!).
Windows or Mac, we got your Animal Crossing addiction covered
 The beauty of being able to connect your gaming console to your computer means you can actually record, edit, and stream your gameplay. While it may not be at the same level as a professional grade capture card that costs 5-10x more, it’s more than capable for most gameplay capturing needs while being much more flexible and easy to use across multiple platforms. 
We're making last year's best capture cards feel a bit outdated.
Record To Your Heart’s Content
Sure you can use the built-in video recording feature on the Nintendo Switch but that’s limited to 30 seconds - that mean you'll have to rush that epic boss fight or finish that speed-run extra fast.  It's is also a pain to export and you’re limited by an already small internal storage and expensive memory cards. With ShadowCast you don't have to worry about recording length and can rewatch your whole session of Among Us, add your commentary, and refine your strategy.
With a 30 second limit everyone is sus!
We’ve actually created what we believe is the most simple to use, not just for playing but also to record gameplay videos.  Here’s a sample of a recording of us playing on various consoles with the ShadowCast: 
These videos are screen recordings of gameplay played off an early build of our dedicated Genki Arcade app.
Plays Nice with Others 
We made the Genki Arcade app to be truly simple to use, but for those that need more complexity you’ll be happy to know that ShadowCast is compatible with popular professional capture card applications such as Open Broadcaster Software (OBS), Streamlabs OBS, XSplit, and much more. This will allow you to capture video with detailed customizations and even overlay various webcam feeds, graphics, and animations.
It's pretty much compatible with everything you throw at it

Begin Your Career as an Influencer
Ultimately the main reason for anyone to capture video is so that they can share it with the world. ShadowCast can easily upload your previously recorded or edited videos and even stream live to your favorite platform - whether your team Twitch, YouTube, or FaceBook, we got you covered.  
To maximize compatibility across as many platforms as possible, we’ve disguised ShadowCast as a webcam so that it can do a few more party tricks. This means it can actually be selected as a webcam under many typical apps popular today thanks to all the remote working, including Zoom, Google Meet, Microsoft Teams, and FaceTime - and further even supports video players like QuickTime and VLC if you don’t have our app installed.
Video Chat Your Gameplay
This allows you to not only share your gameplay live with anyone, but you can actually play with your friends and see them on split screen just as if you were playing in couch co-op mode in-person.
You can play any of your favorite games in split-screen even without being on a couch
Don’t Settle for a Weak Webcam
As an additional benefit, ShadowCast works with all HDMI output devices beyond gaming consoles, including better cameras.  This means you can upgrade your video conference by swapping out your poor built-in webcam for most digital cameras, including DSLRs, camcorders, and action cameras - as long as it supports HDMI out (some cameras require a HDMI-mini/micro converter).  No more grainy, low resolution videos with poor lighting. 
Kickstarter compresses these images, but hopefully you get the idea!
The Perfect Stay-at-Home Camera Assistant
It’s also quite useful for situations where you just need to see what you're photographing or recording on a bigger laptop screen - no need for expensive wireless monitors! 
A better view of your DSLR in real-time so you can skip the expensive screen monitor
We actually had the idea of ShadowCast back in 2019 and started to collaborate with  manufacturers of the top video streaming and capture card brands. The timing was a bit too early as the components needed were overly expensive and had originally intended to make a Super Dock. Since then, we've refined the idea, dived into software and made something that we're quite excited to share here.
Might as well make it as small as possible right?
Here's also a video showcasing the latency between a TV and ShadowCast. We setup a powered HDMI splitter to show the screens simultaneously with the same baseline:
PLAY

Setup ShadowCast in 3 simple steps!
If you need a more visual adventure we've prepared a short video showing the 3 simple steps in real-time to setup ShadowCast.
PLAY

This is really, really small
Dimensions are 25 x 52 x 9mm or 0.98" x 2.1" x 0.35"
Weighs just 10 grams (latest prototype)
HDMI 2.0 input brings in 4K video from the latest game consoles, including the Nintendo Switch, Playstation 4/5, and XBox Series S/X
USB-C output transfers to computer up to 1920x1080 @ 60fps
Genki Arcade app requires macOS 10.12+ or Windows 7+
Includes USB-C 2.0 Cable 1.8m long cable

Eddie, Chris, and Andrew miss the good old days of gaming accessories that truly improved the console experience such as the Game Genie, GameBoy Light Magnifier, and Guncon.  But we didn't do this alone, and there's a lot of people to thank for bringing this project to life:

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We launched the most funded gaming hardware project on Kickstarter of 2018 and 2019 so we've been through this rodeo. By now the risks are less of us being able to make the product but more likely if we deliver on time. One of the biggest chunks of time is always the pre-production phase which includes tooling/mold production, test molds, and securing components. This time, we’ve actually gotten a lot of the work done before launching the project which means greater financial risk for us but a lot less timeline uncertainty for our backers. We're happy to say we're even better equipped to face these challenges but no matter how much we plan there’s always a chance that things can go wrong. Whether its production, logistics, or completely random events, we promise to always share with you full transparency on our hiccups and resolve them in a way that keeps our backers happy and proud to keep supporting Genki.

Note: there are some shipping risks now to certain countries dealing with uncertainty such as the UK (Brexit) and new India import tariffs. Regional lockdowns also impact postal services but we'll do our best to get ShadowCast to you wherever you are.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Our product physically uses the least material resources through a minimized design - nearly 10x smaller and less build material than similar consumer hardware. It's designed to last across console generations for as long as HDMI is the standard.

campaign.story:
Standing Stones is the first in a new series of monthly Print and Play (PNP) roll and write games called the Roll and Write Revolution. Thanks to the unexpected, stupendous support, PNP backers will receive Würfel Pie, too! Thanks to a helpful friend, the rules for both games will also be available in French. "Roll and write" means that your game components and setup are minimal. "PNP" means that you will receive the PDF files for this game immediately after the campaign ends so you can start playing right away!
 The Picts, an ancient Scottish culture, were among several groups to have a hand in thwarting the Roman Empire’s expansion, including the building of Hadrian’s Wall. They were accomplished sailors, traders, and even pirates.

Standing Stones is a blind bidding domino placement game by Benny Sperling. Yep, you read that correctly! Players will use one half of a domino to bid on an action card and the other half to complete a numbered action. The action cards will award resources, change how you use your domino, or allow you to do specific actions better. Players can even send a diplomat to visit another player’s land and utilize one of their actions. Not only are you using diplomacy to do something you might be unable to do on your own, but you are also effectively blocking that action from their use that turn!
 The dominos are surprisingly tactical and wonderfully tactile. They really capture the theme for me when I stand them up on edge, looking every bit like the standing stones described in history and carved by the Picts. The stones represent your power and offer you more goods to feed into your resource converting engine.
Check out the rules, HERE, or watch a demonstration video below:
 If you're like me, a major reason you love roll and write games is because they usually have solitaire modes of play. We have a special second sheet which drives an AI opponent designed to make your solo experience an engaging challenge. Princess Eithne will draft dominoes against you and send her emissary to try and slow you down every turn. 
Bellow, Derik shows how to setup and play the solitaire version:
  No problem!
The PDF files will include dominoes you can print with the rest of the game
We will have thematic domino cards available for purchase through The Game Crafter very soon
Sophia makes and sells incredible hand-cast resin dominoes. 
 We met her on Twitter (@thesophia_509) and were absolutely floored by the gorgeous colors and textures she gets from her resin crafts. Her amazing dominoes made this Boston based artist an easy pick for our first community spotlight. Check out her store at PHIAART.
 Because support has gone so far and above expectations, we've rearranged our publication schedule to add Mr. Sperling's first (and my favorite) roll and write game to this project FOR FREE!

Würfel means "dice" in German. In this game, players are pushing their luck and trying to find the exact right combination of fillings in their pie and serving it up. Dice drafting finds the players hoping for just the right roll without their opponents snatching them away! Tricks and thoughtful play abound in this dice chucker. Is it easy as pie? Time will soon tell as you dig in for that first scrumptious piece!
Check out the rules, HERE, or watch a multiplayer demonstration below:
 Or, watch this one for the solitaire version:
 Würfel Pie features art and graphic design by the incomparable Jason Washburn (Talon Strikes Studio). Be sure to put eyes on his latest releases as they are also looking and playing great!
 Benny and I have a passion for gaming and would love to publish these games in a format that is both fulfilling and inexpensive. As such, we realized that offering the files for players to Print and Play (PNP) at home was a perfect way to go! In fact, you don't even need a home printer. Since you'll have the PDFs, you can print at work, at a local print shop, or (like I often do) play straight on your iPad, Surface, or other tablet device.
 This unusual format (PNP) allows us:
    To offer a low entry point into fun games produced on a regular, frequent basis with no extra shipping costs or delays.
     The freedom to design wild, wacky, and wonderful ideas regardless of typical commercial viability.
     The opportunity to connect creative creators and makers with a passionate community united by similar interests.
 Honest and responsive communication.
Delivery immediately following the close of the campaign. 
A referral to at least one indie-maker in our community.
More projects just like this every month.
And we’d love to work with you designers out there! If you have a roll and write style game and want to talk about joining the program, please send us an email at rollandwriterevolution@gmail.com

updates.update_userinfo: Thank you again and welcome to the new project!
updates.update_content:
Hello again you wonderful people!
I am happy to report that the rules have been gone over 3 more times, updated, and gone over several more times again. I am very happy with their final state and am still overjoyed by the tremendous support you've shown. 

Now that the final rules have been updated and added to the shared folder for all of you to access, I am comfortable calling this project officially complete :D

Thank you again for your patience. Been a pretty wild month.
Dropping by real quick because I know several of you have anxiously awaited the availability of the long coming domino cards. I am excited to tell you they are finally live for purchase!

Hey everybody,
I have good news: the French version of Standing Stones is now LIVE!!!! As mentioned in a previous update, my friend and fellow designer/publisher Jon Vallerand at Subsurface Games was kind enough to translate the rules, sheets, and cards for us, and Knowby and I were able to redo the sheets and cards.

Hey there!
Sorry about bothering you yet again today but we've received several questions about the dominoes. Initially, I accidentally gave you the wrong set of rules - rules without the printable dominoes. That has now been corrected. The same link I already sent to you will take you to rules which include a page of dominoes that you can print at home with the rest of the game. They are not my favorite option, but they work well enough for Super-Wonderful-Collaborator Odin Phong:

Thank you so much for this stupendous support! 
I never imagined TWO-HUNDRED-EIGHTY PEOPLE would be willing to print their own copies of our games. This is really just incredible. Thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you!

As promised, emails with links to your files will be going out shortly. Unfortunately, we are running slightly behind on finishing up the French translation for Standing Stones (translating and updating the cards and sheets is a bigger ordeal than expected). I am going to send out the English files for Standing Stones and the English and French files for Wurfel Pie today. As soon as we finish the French fix for Standing Stones, you'll receive another message with those files.

My word, I cannot believe how very far we've come in a short time. I never imagined we would find such tremendous support for a print and play game. For the many of you recently joining the project: WELCOME! And to everyone else: thank you so much for sticking it out with us :-)

In case you didn't see the new banner, I have great news. Thanks to the generous help of my friend and fellow designer/publisher Jon Vallerand at Subsurface Games, we will be shipping the final version of both games with FRENCH RULES! It makes me so happy to be improving our accessibility even more. Things are getting *real*, everybody! I've had a good time this week putting the finishing touches on rules, preparing the PnP PDFs for going out, and getting the domino cards ready for The Game Crafter. I am so very very excited to get these two wonderful games into your hands.

I sure hope you all had a merry Christmas, happy Hanukkah, joyful Kwanza, or whatever else you may celebrate!

I am absolutely floored by the support you've given (how the heck are we at $566?!?!?!?!?). In fact, Mr. Sperling and I were so grateful for the unbelievable turn-out that we knew we had to do something. So, we rearranged our planned publication schedule and added his very first roll and write game (and my favorite) to this project for FREE!!!!

Hi! I'm Felice Regina (@iamlunasol on Instagram) but everyone just calls me Luna! I'm an independent illustrator and pin designer! I've run many successful Kickstarter campaigns for enamel pins over the past few years. This campaign will help put several new hard enamel pin designs into production.

You will only be charged when the Kickstarter campaigns ends, provided we reach the initial $400 base goal. If we don't reach this base goal by the end of the the campaign date you will not be charged.
Please note that you cannot change your pledge amount or add items after the campaign ends. Please pledge for all the items you may want during the funding period to get the special Kickstarter pricing.
Pledging actively helps unlock designs! Just because a stretch goal is locked, doesn't mean you can't pledge for it. Pledge for all items you want, regardless of unlock status to ensure that stretch goals get unlocked.

Add $10 per pin to the current pledge amount.
(Example: Early bird 2 pins + 2 additional pins would be $20 + $20 (2 x $10) + $4 shipping = $44)

Delivery time is generally 3-7 business days.
For international backers:

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Every campaign comes with its own challenges. We are confident that you will get a game that you’ll be proud to play AND will proudly display on your game shelf.

The art and mechanics for Creature Comforts are nearly complete. Once this campaign ends we will tie up loose ends and submit print files.

It is always possible that delays occur while a game is coming to fruition. This can happen for various reasons such as manufacturing issues, freight delays, and even importing the games to the various regions of the world, as we have recently experienced during this global pandemic. Although we have budgeted 11 months to bring this game to your doorstep, please know that these delays can change our timeline at various stages. Therefore our timeline is only an estimate. We are working to meet our goal to fulfill the game by the end of December 2021.

We will be using fulfillment partners from around the world so that we can ensure a fast and smooth operation. We have worked with all of these partners many times before, so we are optimistic that everything will go as planned. We have full faith that your games will be delivered to you safe and in a timely fashion.

A note on our track record:

 • Successful and timely fulfillment of 6 projects over 5 years (between KTBG and Burnt Island Games, our sibling company), including the following games: Foodfighters, Problem Picnic, Haunt the House, Endeavor: Age of Sail, Wreck Raiders, and In the Hall of the Mountain King. Unfortunately the Endeavor: Age of Expansion campaign and Fossilis were both briefly delayed due to Covid-19. We found ourselves just entering into our fulfillment phase when the world shut down. Although the fulfillment didn't go exactly as planned, we have been open and honest about the process, updating backers often.

We want you to know that:
 • we have received wide praise for production quality and gameplay development, as quality products is of the utmost importance to us. 
• our designer and artists come to Creature Comforts with many years of experience.
• customer service is key to creating a positive backer experience. We are here for you!

OUR REFUND POLICY

We will refund your pledge within 7 days of the campaign’s end, including all fees associated with the campaign. After that period, we will refund your pledge, no questions asked, minus all of the fees associated with the Kickstarter, payment processing, and our pledge manager. These fees cannot be recovered from Kickstarter/our pledge manager after two weeks of the campaign ending. This project is in CAD, therefore, refunds will be processed in CAD.

We want you to be happy! We promise to keep you in the loop every step of the way. If you have any questions, send us a direct message, email us at service@kidstablebg.com or simply comment on the campaign. We will get back to you as soon as we can.

TERMS AND CONDITIONS

Your pledge must be confirmed within 8 weeks of our pledge manager email to you. If you do not confirm your pledge at this time, you agree that KTBG has fulfilled its obligation to you, and your pledge will become a donation. After the 8-week window, it might still be possible to get your game shipped, based on availability. It is so difficult for us to confirm shipping to different regions of the world when our numbers are in constant flux.

It is the backer's responsibility to provide us with the correct shipping address and to ensure it is deliverable by typical methods of shipping. Unfortunately we do not ship to PO Boxes. Backers who have provided an expired address, or incorrect addresses will be charged shipping a second time to get their game to them. There is always the possibility of a refund, although the Kickstarter and pledge manager fees are non-refundable.

We reserve the right to sell our games, for the purpose of keeping our company going, at any point through the production and fulfilment process. We always endeavour to get our games to you on time and before they go to retail.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
We produce high quality products that have been proven to last. Your game will stay intact for years to come.
Reusability and recyclability
Because our games are made with incredibly high quality materials, they will last a very long time. We expect our games to be reused over and over. But at times, game shelves need to evolve. Please hand this game down to a friend, sell it on the secondary market, or donate it to a cause that is near and dear to your heart.
Sustainable materials
We choose to use fulfillment partners from all over the world. Rest assured that your game will come from the closest region to you. The less fuel we use to get your game there, the better we feel about sending it to you.
Something else
KTBG has made a commitment to create the smallest possible carbon footprint we can. We are committed to making the most of this by using a factory that promotes efficiency when printing, only producing materials that are necessary for this game, fulfilling games from your region, and replacing only parts that are absolutely necessary for a complete and flawless game. We don't include rules in multiple languages, instead we ask you to use our digital downloads. We ask that if you need replacement parts, you consider whether or not that part is necessity to make your game play experience a good one.

campaign.story:
Do you want to be a Hero or a Villain? Choose your side, grab your dice, and get ready to roll!
KAPOW! uses buildable dice, allowing you to add and remove dice faces during the course of battle. This makes for a super-strategic dice-battling experience. With each roll, you decide how to attack, defend, and power up your character by choosing where to place your dice. 
The battles get more explosive with each roll and as you gain more dice and dice faces. KAPOW! is simple to learn (roll and place), but has layers of strategy as you customize your dice pool and leverage the unique powers of the KAPOW! universe’s heroes and villains!
Check out this gameplay video:
 And here is a video showing the Solo Play mode we've unlocked:
KAPOW! Volume 1 & KAPOW! Volume 2 are each complete two-player games. 
Just pick the one with the characters you like best, or get both by selecting the TEAM-UP Tier to be able to play 2, 3, or 4 player games!
Porcupine Mega-Hero Unlocked for the TEAM-UP Tier!
This is your chance to get Kickstarter Exclusives from previous White Wizard Games Kickstarters you may have missed!
To order an add-on, just increase your pledge by the appropriate amount. You will be able to specify exactly which add-ons you are getting using the pledge manager after this Kickstarter campaign ends.
Note: If you ONLY want add-ons (like the Star Realms High Alert First Strike pack) but don't want any KAPOW!, back the "Pledge Manager Tier"
This Conversion Kit is for ONLY backers who currently own the first edition of KAPOW! It contains stickers to update your Player and Super Boards, plus the Kickstarter Exclusive Hero: Halfmoon and the Kickstarter Exclusive Mega-Villain: Sawmill Jackson. When purchased along with the KAPOW! Volume 2 Tier, your Stretch Goals will be upgraded to the TEAM UP Tier Stretch Goals.
Kickstarter Exclusive add-ons from the Star Realms game line.
Kickstarter Exclusive add-ons from the Hero Realms game line.
Kickstarter Exclusive add-ons from the Epic Card Game line.
Kickstarter Exclusive add-ons from the Sorcerer game line.
At the start of the game you will choose a hero or villain to play. Each comes with their own "Super Board" showing their unique powers, starting dice pool and health. 

Each round, players simultaneously roll their dice and secretly place them on their Player Board and/or their Super Board to attack, defend, or power up (gaining more dice and add faces to their buildable Action dice). 
 All players then simultaneously remove their player screens revealing their boards.
Player Board with dice.
Players deal damage equal to their attack minus their target's defense. Reduce your opponent's health to zero to knock them out and win the game!



Each set of KAPOW! comes with two high quality score dials!
This is the 2nd edition of KAPOW!. 
The first edition of KAPOW! was designed and published by 2 Ton Porcupine in 2019. We met the game designers at the Boston Festival of Indie Games and were intrigued by this game. It felt super fast and thrilling with every play.
We fell in love with KAPOW!, and brought it into the White Wizard Games portfolio. We took the 1st edition to PAX Unplugged and PAX East,  where we ran tons of demos, and sold through the entire print run. 
The White Wizard Games and 2 Ton Porcupine teams then combined forces to improve the game play, visuals and components of this already awesome game. In this Kickstarter you can get the new-and-improved second edition of  KAPOW! Volume 1 , and the ALL-NEW KAPOW! Volume 2. 
If you already have the first edition of KAPOW! Volume 1, it is compatible with KAPOW! Volume 2. In the future, we will post a small second edition rules conversion supplement on our website.
PLAY

 Shipping
We will be shipping to backers directly from fulfillment centers in The US, UK,  EU, Canada, Australia, and Asia.
Our goal is to get product to our backers as soon as possible. When product arrives at one of our fulfillment centers, we will begin the process of shipping to backers in that region without waiting for product to arrive at other hubs. This means that backers in some regions may receive product before backers in others.
IMPORTANT - For this Kickstarter you will be charged shipping separately after this Kickstarter concludes. This will be done via the pledge manager. What you are charged for shipping will be based on our actual cost to get your rewards to you from your region's fulfillment center plus taxes/fees we were charged to get your reward into your region.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We are veteran publishers with a lot of experience and great products under our belt, but we are also perfectionists. We will have the printer make samples, improve on those, make more samples, round and round as many times as it takes for things to be awesome. This means we may be late with delivery.

The estimated delivery date for this Kickstarter is December 2021, but please keep in mind this is just an estimate. We will work hard to ship your game on time, but our number one concern is that this product turns out great. If we have to delay delivery to improve the product, we will.

Also note COVID-19 has thrown off our production and delivery timelines a bit. Hopefully this won't be an issue when this Kickstarter is ready to ship, but it may slow things down a bit.

We are pretty active on the comments while the Kickstarter campaign is live, so we can get your feedback and input. Once the Kickstarter campaign ends we put our noses to the grindstone working on games, so we aren't on the comments nearly as much.

Once the Kickstarter campaign ends, you can expect an update about once a month letting you know our progress. If you need to contact us during that time, don't use the comments, instead email Support@WhiteWizardGames.com.

REFUND POLICY

Within 60 days of the end of the campaign we offer full refunds (no questions asked).

From 61 days after the campaign ends up until we begin packing shipments we offer refunds MINUS the Kickstarter and other fees (we can’t get those back).

Once we begin packing shipments we no longer offer refunds.

If, for any reason, we are unable to fulfill any part of your order, we will give you a FULL refund on what we weren’t able to fulfill.

Refunds will be processed using the method of our choosing (usually Paypal).
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Fast and portable action in your pocket! Pocket Paragons is a quick yet deceptively deep game of powerful spells and big reads. Choose a character, add their cards to your hand, and take actions simultaneously to defeat the enemy player. Duels are tense and tactical, and a perfect way to get that competitive fix when short on time. For a more involved and strategic game, play tournament mode where each player brings their own custom team of characters. When one of your paragons is defeated, pass on one its unique ability cards to your team’s next fighter to modify its set of abilities, allowing for all new card combinations and forcing your opponent to adapt.

Pocket Paragons is a cross-over battle system. Characters from various game worlds come together to see who the true Paragon is.  Pocket Paragons features a total of 4 game series on launch each with their own gameplay features all cross-compatible with one another. Can you form the perfect team?
A box of Pocket Paragons contains:
6 unique characters
2 punchboard  Dials (one for each player, each tracking HP and Energy.)
48 total Poker cards
Rulebook
Dividers for each character
A theme sticker sheet
Solo Mode! (A.I. Deck, Every characters A.I. card, Gauntlet Mode for each box)
There are a total of 4 unique Pocket Paragons boxes. As a special Kickstarter add-on, all backers will get 2 free unique characters from AEGIS and 2 free unique characters from Rivals of Aether. 4 more characters can be unlocked with our social stretch goals. That's a possible 8 FREE characters during this Kickstarter campaign!
 Pocket Paragons is very quick and easy to play. Check out the video for the summary!
 You can play the game right now! Check out the rulebook, digital tabletop simulator build, or physical print and play links below. This preview build of the game includes 4 characters to try out.
 Here are the Pledge Level for this Kickstarter! You can add an additional Box of Pocket Paragons to any pledge level by pledging +$20 per box. 

 If you would like to get an add-on, simply pledge the desired amount over your Pledge Level selection. You will be able to specify which items you would like in the post-campaign survey. 
Get the official Pocket Paragons Playmat! Perfect for a duel.  The Playmat is 14'' x 24'', has an embroidered edge, and features graphics for tracking HP and Energy during the game.

T-shirts are available in Men's and Women's cuts in S /M / L / XL / 2XL / 3XL / 4XL. You will be able to specify size and cut during the post-campaign survey.  Choose between 'Rest' and 'Weapon'.

A Flavorful Game
      Everyone has a green thumb when playing Herbaceous. Relax while enjoying this elegant game of picking and potting herbs. Pot the best collection of herbs in your different containers, but don’t wait too long or your friend might grab them first.       
A Tiny Edition for Travel
Herbaceous Pocket is the same great game in an even smaller package. Herbaceous is a simple to learn, push your luck, set collection game. 
 Smooth, streamlined rounds make Herbaceous a fast-moving, engaging game of picking and sharing herbs.
 The Pocket Edition is complete with all cards, dividers, and rules included. Visual adjustments were made to maximize clarity of the smaller size cards.  
Steve Finn (Dr. Finn's Games) - renowned designer of Biblios and The Butterfly Garden - has created a wonderful compliment to Beth Sobel's stunning herb art. Eduardo Baraf is at the helm of Herbaceous Pocket to ensure it delivers Herbaceous' perfect balance of simple play, interesting moments, and wonderful art in a fantastic, tiny, package.   
 Keith Matejka (Thunderworks Games) - designer of Bullfrogs, Roll Player, and Skulk Hollow - created the additional rules for solo play, loved for its easy, rapid play.  
Herbaceous is Zee Garcia's #1 relaxing game (and Mike Disilio's #4). The new, great way to experience Herbaceous with a cup of tea.  


The pocket edition of the Flavor Pack Mini-Expansion includes Cinnamon, Star Anise, and Peppercorn and adds a little extra spice to Herbaceous' flavorful play. 
All Kickstarter backers who pledge for Herbaceous Pocket Edition will also receive the Flavor Pack Mini-Expansion for Free. This expansion will be available for sale typically for $5 separately on BGG, at Conventions, the PFG Store, etc. It will not be packaged within the base game.     
My Mother Gives an Overview of How to Play the original Herbaceous - she has the prototype from our first KS.
Rodney Smith from Watch It Played teaches Herbaceous . This is the 1st print edition of the original game.
Rules in Additional Languages: Many of these are fan made, please note the contributor when you download the translation: French, German, Spanish, Italian, Polish 
Board Game Closet I've never really seen it done like this before...it plays just as good, probably even better...it's just really neat how they did it.   
Tantrum House: It's so cute and tiny!...It's a relaxing game. 
Click for Full Article
Boardgame Corner: Herbaceous is a perfect after dinner game! 
Rahdo Runs Through: Herbaceous is Lovely. It is an absolutely delightful and very fast playing game that you can really do with just about anyone. This is the perfect game for high tea. 
Bower's Game Corner: Herbaceous is a rock solid filler game - great family game, great game night game, great gateway game! 
Herbaceous: Pocket Edition is a Stretch Goal free campaign. We set out to make a perfect, pocket, edition of the classic game. Aside from size, card and component quality is in line with the original game.



PFG worked with various partners to find a cost effective way to ship a single copy of Herbaceous: Pocket Edition internationally. Unfortunately, in a padded envelope, it is just a smidge too thick for international letter shipping. Therefore it is basically the same cost of shipping a small game (and there are a lot of additional shipping fees these days). 
However, since it is so small / light, it doesn't cost more to ship 2 or 3 copies in the same box. If you are outside of the US, I highly recommend buying the double or triple pack to split with a friend or give it as a gift. It is an easy, gateway game for almost anyone.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Every campaign comes with its own challenges. We are confident that you will get a game that you’ll be proud to play AND proudly display on your game shelf.

The art and mechanics for In Too Deep are nearly complete. Once this campaign ends we will tie up loose ends and submit print files.

It is always possible that delays occur while a game is coming to fruition. This can happen for various reasons such as manufacturing issues, freight delays, and even importing the games to the various regions of the world, as we have recently experienced during this global pandemic. Although we have budgeted 11 months to bring this game to your doorstep, please know that these delays can change our timeline at various stages. Therefore our timeline is only an estimate. We are working to meet our goal to fulfill the game by the end of September 2021.

We will be using fulfillment partners from around the world so that we can ensure a fast and smooth operation. We have worked with all of these partners many times before, so we are optimistic that everything will go as planned. We have full faith that your games will be delivered to you safe and in a timely fashion.

A note on our track record:

 • Successful and timely fulfillment of 6 projects over 5 years (between Burnt Island Games and our sibling company Kids Table Board Gaming), including the following games: Foodfighters, Problem Picnic, Haunt the House, Endeavor: Age of Sail, Wreck Raiders, and In the Hall of the Mountain King. Unfortunately the Endeavor: Age of Expansion campaign was delayed in some regions of the world due to Covid-19. We found ourselves just entering into our fulfillment phase when the world shut down. Although the fulfillment didn't go exactly as planned, we have been open and honest about the process, updating backers often.
 • Wide praise for production quality and gameplay development, as quality products is of the utmost importance to us. 
• Our designers and artists come to In Too Deep with many years of experience.
• Customer service is key to creating a positive backer experience. We are here for you!

OUR REFUND POLICY

We will refund your pledge within 7 days of the campaign’s end, including all fees associated with the campaign. After that period, we will refund your pledge, no questions asked, minus all of the fees associated with the Kickstarter, payment processing, and our pledge manager. These fees cannot be recovered from Kickstarter/our pledge manager after two weeks of the campaign ending. This project is in CAD, therefore, refunds will be processed in CAD.

We want you to be happy! We promise to keep you in the loop every step of the way. If you have any questions, send us a direct message, email us at info@burntislandgames.com or simply comment on the campaign. We will get back to you as soon as we can.

TERMS AND CONDITIONS

Your pledge must be confirmed within 6 weeks of our pledge manager email to you. If you do not confirm your pledge at this time, you agree that Burnt Island Games has fulfilled its obligation to you, and your pledge will become a donation. After the 8 week window, it might still be possible to get your game shipped, based on availability. It is so difficult for us to confirm shipping to different regions of the world when our numbers are in constant flux.

It is the backer's responsibility to provide us with the correct shipping address and to ensure it is deliverable by typical methods of shipping. Unfortunately we do not ship to PO Boxes. Backers who have provided an expired address, or incorrect addresses will be charged shipping a second time to get their game to them. There is always the possibility of a refund, although the Kickstarter and pledge manager fees are non-refundable.

We reserve the right to sell our games, for the purpose of keeping our company going, at any point through the production and fulfilment process. We always endeavour to get our games to you on time and before they get to retail.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
We produce high quality products that have been proven to last. Your game will stay intact for years to come.
Reusability and recyclability
Because our games are made with incredibly high quality materials, they will last a very long time. We expect our games to be reused over and over. But at times, game shelves need to evolve. Please hand this game down to a friend, sell it on the secondary market, or donate it to a cause that is near and dear to your heart.
Sustainable Distribution
We choose to use fulfillment partners from all over the world. Rest assured that your game will come from the closest region to you. The less fuel we use to get your game there, the better we feel about sending it to you.
Something else
Burnt Island Games has made a commitment to create the smallest possible carbon footprint we can. We are committed to making the most of this by using a factory that promotes efficiency when printing, only producing materials that are necessary for this game, fulfilling games from your region, and replacing only parts that are absolutely necessary for a complete and flawless game. We don't include rules in multiple languages, instead we ask you to use our digital downloads. We ask that if you need replacement parts, you consider whether or not that part is a necessity to make your game play experience a good one.

campaign.story:
Leaves whispering, chickens clucking, tractors rumbling, the sounds of a bustling farm are everywhere. The countryside is blossoming and you are in charge of it all. The last team of planners couldn’t cut it, so the farmers turned to your team, the best of the best. If anyone can turn this little farm into a flourishing ranching community, it’s you!
Agropolis is a standalone Sprawlopolis game. What does that mean? Well it's more of what we built with Sprawlopolis, but instead of more cities, it's farms. It adds a few new twists (livestock and feed fees), and can be played on its own or combined with Sprawlopolis in a fun new way. 
Agropolis will be the 66th game to join our growing line of Wallet Games
A quick note on Sprawlopolis
We've made over 60 Wallet Games by now and it's safe to say that there's something really special about Sprawlopolis. It has been nominated for the Golden Geek Awards for Best Card Game and Best Solo Game, was voted #31 in the 1-Player Guild's People Choice Top 200 Solo Games, and has received the Dice Tower's Seal of Excellence.
It's been a wild ride.
It's gone on to have multiple sold out printings, and is currently available in many languages from our publishing partners from all over the world. Once again, a very special game and we are really excited to expand on it. 
And now, a look at Agropolis
In Agropolis, 1-4 players work together to build a new farm from the ground up. Using only 18 cards and a variable scoring system, the game is never the same twice. 
First, players will randomly flip over 3 cards to see the scoring rules for the game.

In this game, you will try to keep Pig Pens adjacent to your longest road, align your Orchards into specific polyomino shapes, and keep your Cornfields on the corners of the map.
But  not only do these 3 cards determine how you will score this game, they  also determine how you win. Total up the values of all three cards, and that number is the score that you need to reach in order to win.

The example above is just one of many, many combinations (816 to be  exact!). Each game has drastically different scoring rules in unique  combinations, and a new score to beat, ranging from 6 to 51 points.

A look at half of the scoring conditions in Agropolis
Each turn, players will play one card from their hand to the growing countryside, trying to score as many points as possible.
Players will have to communicate and plan without revealing their own cards in order to most efficiently develop large areas in each of the 4 zone types.
Watch out though, road maintenance isn't cheap and each road will cost you points in the end.
New to Agropolis are the three types of livestock pens, each in two different configurations.
And finally there's the Feed Fee: a fun (and optional) new way to raise the goal just a little bit, making for a tougher game.
When all cards have been placed, the game ends and players see if they have met the dynamically generated minimum score for their game.
Can you meet the demands of the farmers, work with your fellow planners and build the ultimate agricultural wonder? It’s time to find out!

Download the preview PNP today at PNPArcade.com!
https://www.pnparcade.com/collections/new-games/products/agropolis
We'll start with a little coverage of the original game, Sprawlopolis. It's been out for 2 years now and has slowly built up a stable of great reviews and video content. Here are a few of note:
And now for Agropolis. 
https://whatsericplaying.com/2020/09/28/agropolis/
https://www.dastardlydesignco.com/post/agropolis-dastardly-review-135
http://www.purplephoenixgames.com/agropolis-preview/

In previous campaigns we created expansion material and used it as stretch goals. Since 2018, we've just given it away from the start.  So no worries on whether we'll hit it or not, you are getting bonus content if you pledge here. The free expansion for this campaign is Combopolis. 

Use this expansion to create the perfect mix of city and farm zones in a single game. It adds 6 cards with scoring conditions relying on both Sprawlopolis and Agropolis, along with a few really interesting new rules (you'll draw one card from each game, choose one to play, and then discard the other). It unlocks an exciting world of new combinations!
For a look at the Combo game in action, here's How Lou Sees It, starting at 13:44. Feel free to watch the whole video as well. :)
Here are the rewards available during this campaign.
We usually handle add-ons exclusively through our website, buttonshygames.com, but since Kickstarter has implemented a new add-on system, we are trying it out. 
If you want to add any of the following to your rewards here, you can do it right in your Kickstarter pledge. It will ask you when checking out if you would like to add any items. Note: This is all new, so we're really just trying it for the first time.
