If you want to add more wallet games from our library (and we have a whole bunch!), we will do that in a different way. 
To add more games to your order, you can do one of a few things:
 US Backers only - to order games that ship now - go to our website http://www.buttonshygames.com and place an order using the coupon code "0920impatient" to get 15% off   of your order. Your website order will ship now, as long as you don't  order any pre-order items, otherwise the entire order will ship as soon  as  everything comes in. As always, if you reach $25.00, you will also  receive free shipping.
 US Backers only - to order games that ship along with your rewards - go to our website http://www.buttonshygames.com and place an order using the coupon code "0920us" to get free shipping   on your extra games. These games will all ship together with your  Kickstarter rewards.
 International Backers only - go to our website http://www.buttonshygames.com and place an order using the coupon code "0920international" to get free  shipping on your extra game(s). Note: The limit on this offer is 3  wallet games (and up to 3 expansions) total, including anything that you  order at Kickstarter. Anything above 3 wallet games (and 3 expansions)  will end up bumping into the next shipping tier, which can be as much as  $10 on international orders. These games will all ship together with  your Kickstarter rewards.
There are many notable games and we'll be featuring those throughout the campaign.
We have an awesome following of repeat customers. As a result, we've built the Board Game of the Month Club.
It's a subscription service where you receive unreleased microgames, promo cards, expansion content, and Kickstarter discounts ... every month! Supporters also receive from $1 to $10 off EVERY WALLET GAME that we make. (Members back our Kickstarter projects at the $1 pledge level above.)
Our 2020 $5 packages include an episode of Personal Space, a solo game that has multiplayer interactions. It's part roll and write, part campaign, part digital, part real life, part fantasy. There are stickers and everyone receives some unique cards and unique combinations of cards. It's been live for a few months now, and it's our most ambitious project yet and it will emerge throughout the year.
It also includes Trolling For Trouble by Mike Mullins. In your first month you'll get the 6 card starter kit and then each month after you'll receive a card to expand the game. Trolling For Trouble is a 3+ player bluffing and negotiation game where you play the monsters luring the heroes into battle.
Our $10 packages include all of the above and something  extra. Generally it's a tiny game (up to 9 cards), or some expansion / promo cards for our existing games.
And our $20 package includes all of the above and a copy of  the featured wallet game (or the wallet game of your choice). The featured wallet games also come with any expansion material that is given away in the Kickstarter campaigns (like the combo expansion here).

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
With our method of publishing and using multiple manufacturers, there's always a chance that one part of the game could come in with an error, leading to delays. We've been able to minimize these errors in recent years, but they can happen from time to time. We've also upped our pre-press staff internally to make sure we can hit intended deadlines.

With COVID-19 some of our suppliers have been delayed, so we've been allowing additional time in our estimations and setting up backup suppliers as well. Our local staff is working while socially distancing, so we are allowing additional time for a smaller staff to assemble and ship games. 

Our two unfulfilled projects are moving along according to our updated schedule. Our Food Chain Island project is starting to ship this week. Our Game Haul Bag Campaign is still over a month away from fulfillment, but is on track as planned.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

We are down to the very very end here. As of right now, I can count 37 packages that Marty is working on shipping. These were ones that had address issues or other issues that needed to be resolved. After that we have another 15 that are in the process of resolving the issues. Aside from that, I need to do a final check on addresses that errored - sometimes they are too long, or have characters that the mail program doesn't recognize. updates.update_userinfo: Missed last week's update, but we're 88% shipped!
updates.update_content: Sorry for missing last week's update. It was quite a week here. We were getting the shipping team into place in the main office and realizing the difficulty of the assembly team being in the other office. This just meant I was driving games between offices all day, carrying them up and down stairs and questioning whether it would be faster just to assemble them myself (the answer is that it's not, but all of that back and forth can get to your head). Then after that physical and logistical nightmare, I had a technological nightmare to deal with.

Last week was week 3 of shipping. By now we expected to be at 37.5% shipped, but we hit 55% shipped, breaking that crucial halfway point. We currently have 3595 out the door as we're heading into week 4. This week we are shifting gears and working on some of the more complex and slower packages as we wait for a new batch of Sprawlopolis Interstate rules to arrive. Once those arrive on Friday, I'll cut them all, assign the team to start sleeving them and week 5 will be a huge wave of All-opolis again. 
There isn't much else to report at this time, but as we hit the middle, I am beat! So many trips from office to office, and back and forth to the post office. But we have some great news about both of those. First we were able to move our shipping team into the main office as they are both vaccinated (the assembly team is still in another building in the next town over). Second, because there is now someone working out of our main office all the time, we were able to FINALLY arrange for daily post office pick-ups. No more fighting for a parking space then paying to park, then hauling 9 bins just to stand in line at the post office.

campaign.story:
Cascadia is a beautiful strategy board game for 1-4 players that plays in 30-45 minutes.
In Cascadia, players compete to create the most harmonious ecosystem by selecting and adding habitats and wildlife to their environment. The goal in placing habitat tiles is to create contiguous corridors by matching rivers, prairies, wetlands, forests, and mountains. Once habitats are placed, players populate them with the wildlife species that each habitat supports. Each species has their own spatial requirements and connections to one another and their ecosystem! 
Cascadia is a modular, dual-layer puzzle, with variable scoring conditions that is simple to learn, but challenging to master!
Cascadia comes with a variety of spatial wildlife goals allowing you to mix and match new challenges each and every time you play! There are hundreds of unique puzzles to explore! Create stunningly beautiful terrain maps as you build your own personal environment, while competing with others for the habitats and wildlife you desire!
Kickstarter backers of Cascadia receive a set of 5 Tarot-sized Promo Wildlife Scoring Cards FREE! With the addition of these cards, players will be able to mix and match even more goals. These promo cards are a special THANK YOU to all backers for being early supporters, and will not be included with future copies of the game!
Want to learn about Cascadia in just 1 minute? Check out Board Games In A Minute's quick overview!
Check out this How-to-play video by AnnaMaria of Girl's Game Shelf!
Learn all about Cascadia with Theo from Geeky Gaymer Guy in this game overview!
Solo Mode
Cascadia can be played solo! The solo mode elegantly simulates a 2-player game experience by turning the tile and token drafting into a cascading market. Players must make difficult decisions about which tiles and tokens to take, as each turn brings changes to what is available. The solo mode is a quick and relaxing experience that is simple to learn, and does not require the upkeep of an AI player, while still offering interesting puzzly choices and challenging thresholds to overcome.
Gavin McGruddy of MyAutoma has uploaded a great browser-based demo of the Cascadia Solo Mode, so that you can try it out for yourself! This demo will let you play the recommended starting group of Wildlife Scoring Cards! Challenge your friends to see who can get the highest score! Try it out here!
Cascadia also has a Family Variant! If you are playing with children, those new to gaming, or you just want to make the puzzle a little simpler, you can play with the included Family Variant Wildlife Scoring Card. This streamlines the wildlife scoring so that each animal scores in a similar way, reducing the number of different scoring conditions to learn, while still offering challenging puzzly gameplay. In addition to the Family Variant, the Wildlife Scoring Card features a flip side with an Intermediate Variant. This mode increases the challenge of the spatial puzzle a bit, without adding more complex scoring conditions. 
With this range of gameplay modes, Cascadia can be tuned to offer different game experiences to different players, depending on experience level.
Cascadia provides a fantastic mix of approachable game play with strategic depth. It is a natural follow-up to our wildly successful first publication, Calico! We wanted to provide fans of gorgeous puzzly games another easy-to-teach, yet challenging-to-master game. Our collaborative team has worked hard to make Cascadia an accessible and exciting game for a range of audiences.
While it can be a fun gateway experience for new gamers, it provides more experienced players with variable goals, tension of managing habitats and wildlife simultaneously, and a great mix of long-term strategy and short-term tactics. This makes the challenge and reward of each puzzle extremely satisfying! We are very proud of the gameplay and quality of the product.
We know that gamers love sharing the hobby with their friends and family and Cascadia is the perfect game to do just that!
The members of our team have years of experience working on a number of successful projects, from Point Salad to Overlord! What we think these games all have in common is their attention to detail and focus on great gameplay and amazing product quality.
Last year, 6,724 backers joined us on the journey that made Calico possible. Since then, the game has received various accolades - from being one of the most anticipated abstract games of 2020 on Boardgamegeek.com, to praise from countless reviewers.
The Dice Tower gave our first game, Calico, their prestigious Seal of Approval!
Since this is only our second published game, Cascadia does not currently have access to broad distribution in order to be available in retail stores. This means Kickstarter is your first and best opportunity to bring Cascadia home! The Kickstarter Edition comes with free promo cards that will not be part of a standard retail edition, even if the game does make it into distribution.
Our philosophy is that our backers are major contributors to our passion and our business. We do not take this lightly, and we know there is always risk in backing a crowdfunding campaign. Because of this, we want to make sure that our backers get the best possible experience and we show our appreciation for their early support. The pledge levels you are backing this product at are set to give you the greatest possible value, as well as subsidized shipping, as our way of saying thank you for your support. You are all special, and have a big hand in the success of the game - we can’t do this without all of you, and we appreciate that! 
We also look forward to chatting with you about the process and the game overall. We are focused on you and anything we can do to improve the backer experience!
Retailers
Certified brick-and-mortar retailers interested in backing can reach out through our website form (www.flatout.games/cascadia-retailer). Interested retailers will be invited to our pledge manager after the campaign has ended. Retailers are encouraged to back the project for any amount in order to stay up-to-date with the project.

As we get funding, we’ll be going on a trek together! As our numbers grow, we will be reinvesting extra money into upgrading the quality of the game components and finding fun bonuses along the trail!
The more funding we can achieve as a team, the better everyone’s copy of the game will be, so please share this project so that we can get the game ‘to the peak’!

Every project has its risks - there are plenty of circumstances within and outside of our control that could come up. We have also done our homework and been actively engaged in reaching out to others who have been successful. We are Superbackers ourselves, proving our commitment to the amazing community on Kickstarter, and we have followed along on many other campaigns. In addition, the members of our CoLab have been involved with a number of successful campaigns in the past, so we feel we have positioned ourselves with the knowledge and experience required to make sure things go as smoothly as possible.

We have already done a considerable amount of the legwork involved in getting this game made and getting it into your hands. We have completed design and development, nearly completed artwork, and lined up manufacturing and logistics. We have a plan to get the game completed to the highest degree of quality and get it in your hands as soon as possible.

We are also committed to being open and transparent about our process and the challenges and triumphs associated with it. We want you along for the ride and will keep you up-to-date as new developments emerge. If any challenges arise, we will keep you informed every step of the way.

Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
At Flatout Games we are committed to making games that you and your family will love for a long time. We strive to build our products to last - so that you can rest assured that you won't need to replace your game over time, with many uses. We take great pride in the quality of our games, since we know that a well-made game is one that will stay on your shelf and provide many hours of enjoyment without becoming dated and ending up as waste.
Reusability and recyclability
At Flatout Games, we strive to use reusable and recyclable materials whenever possible. This production of Cascadia uses cardboard and wooden components that not only look and feel great, but are easier to recycle. We also try to avoid the use of plastics in packaging and shipping materials in order to reduce our impact.
Sustainable materials
For the production of Cascadia we chose to go with simple materials (cardboard and wood) because they are relatively easy to source and they can be produced with very little waste byproduct. Avoiding using plastics that consume fossil fuels and focusing on renewable resources like forestry products helps us to reduce our impact.
Sustainable Distribution
The shipping and fulfillment of this project will be carried out by multiple regional fulfillment centers around the world to reduce the overall energy expended to get games to backers. In addition, we plan to avoid the use of plastic in packing materials wherever feasible in order to reduce impact.

campaign.story:
Designed and illustrated by Haakon Hoel Gaarder (Villagers), Streets is an easy to learn tile laying game for 1-5 players where you build new streets in a growing city. Through careful planning and placement, the aim is to make the most money from selling your buildings.
The city is populated by increasing numbers of people (wooden meeples), each with their own preferences. These hipsters, tourists, shoppers, and parents increase the value of any buildings they occupy, and they move from street to street as they are scored. You'll need to locate your buildings carefully and attract the right crowd to earn more than your opponents!
Lay tiles and influence people!
Some of the building tiles found in Streets.

You can download the draft rules here. The final rules will look much nicer!
Streets is really easy to teach! If one person knows the rules, you can open the box and be playing in less than 5 minutes. Here's the basics:
1. On your turn, place a building into the city.
Add meeples according to the colour and number of icons at the bottom of the tile you played. You'll also add an Ownership Token in your player colour.
2. When a Street is Enclosed, all buildings in it are sold for money.
Calculate how much each building is worth based on the Valuation in the top right corner, adding $1 for every meeple.
3. Meeples move to new buildings.
The player who enclosed the street moves the meeples on it to new buildings of matching colours on unenclosed streets. Meeples who can't move stand up and get FOMO (fear of missing out), and they'll move immediately to matching buildings when new ones are built.
4. Earn the most money to win!
There are lots of opportunities to create scoring combos, and to profit from other players' buildings. The number of meeples in play increases as the game goes on, raising the stakes and the tension! Though the game is suitable for new gamers, these dynamic mechanics create a lot of depth that seasoned gamers will enjoy.
 The Business expansion makes use of the icons on the top left of every building tile. Each building has one or more Home, Shop, Restaurant, Recreation, or Wild icon on it.  
Business tokens and some of the tiles that generate them.
Whenever a street is scored, every player with a building in that street gets to take a business token matching the icon on one of their buildings. At the end of the game there's a $10 bonus for the player with the most tokens of each type, and $10 for every set of all four tokens.  
A simple addition to the game, but a big change to the way you'll play! Included in every copy of the game are seven Consultant cards (70x120mm tarot size) which give each player a really powerful and unique special ability. Deal one Consultant card out at random to each player during setup and you're good to go! 
Six of the seven Consultants that come with the game.
Both of the expansions are optional, and we recommend playing without either of them the first time you play, or if you're playing with a group that prefers simpler games. The expansions add extra crunch to the decisions you'll make as you play!
Rahdo's reaction to playing with the expansions.
A game of Streets in progress.
Streets can be played by one player versus an AI opponent called The Grifter, using a simple set of rules and no extra components. You can find more information on this in the draft rulebook.
You can watch a full solo mode playthrough video on our YouTube channel.

More building tiles - they're the same in standard and deluxe editions.
We've taken great care to ensure that Streets offers excellent value for money right out of the box, and we've come up with a number of cosmetic and usability upgrades to both editions of the game that we can include even at the minimum funding goal. Rather than throw everything at you at once, we'll reveal these additions as the campaign goes on. Since we've already budgeted for them, they won't be tied to the overall funding level, but we will make you work for them :D
New artwork will be revealed below...
The more copies of the game we order from the factory, the cheaper they become. We can use those savings to add some cool new content for backers at no extra charge. The more backers who join us, the more extras we can include for everyone.
In short, more backers means more free stuff for everyone! The free promo pack is our way of saying thankyou to backers for supporting this campaign. After the campaign it will only be available direct from Sinister Fish Games at an appropriate price plus shipping.*
* The deluxe edition and promo pack will be available in limited numbers from retailers who back this campaign, but it will not go into general distribution, and there will be no restocks.
There are two versions of Streets; standard and deluxe. They both contain exactly the same gameplay content, but the deluxe edition has some upgraded components.
Screen printed wooden ownership tokens (same in deluxe and standard editions).

Deluxe wooden money tokens.
Deluxe meeples.
Deluxe business tokens.
The creators of these videos were paid to showcase the rules and components of Streets. These are not reviews of the game.
If we reach our funding goal, all pledge information will be passed over to our partners at BackerKit after the Kickstarter campaign ends. Their pledge management system allows backers to pay for shipping, to confirm or update their shipping address, upgrade or downgrade their pledge, and add extra items.
It is necessary for every backer to confirm their details in the pledge manager in order to receive their rewards. We'll give clear instructions on how to do this when the time comes. It's quite simple, you'll just need to keep an eye on our updates after the campaign ends.
 We are making the previous game from Sinister Fish and Haakon Gaarder - the Golden Geek Award nominated Villagers - available as part of this campaign. You can pledge for it (and the Kickstarter Expansion Pack) alongside the standard or deluxe copy of Streets by selecting the relevant pledge level here on Kickstarter. Villagers will also be available as an add-on item in the pledge manager.
Villagers was a nominee in the Golden Geek Awards for Best Card Game of 2019
Backers in the United Kingdom will receive their copy of Villagers and the Kickstarter Expansion Pack in October / November 2020 as we have stock in our UK warehouse (aka Dave & Carly's garage). Shipping is free for this.
Backers outside the UK will have their copy of Villagers and Expansion shipped at the same time as Streets, with shipping charged separately in the pledge manager. See below for shipping cost estimates.
We are not reprinting the Villagers playmat or Coin Chest at this time.
We will charge backers for shipping after the campaign ends, closer to the time we actually ship. We'll do this via BackerKit, our pledge manager.
International shipping prices are currently volatile because of the pandemic, and there are surcharges applying to many destinations. We want to minimise the chance of the final price we pay being significantly different to the price we quote now. By doing this we'll be able to give backers the best possible shipping price. On top of that, we will subsidise shipping by £3 (about $4 / €3.50) for every backer, and UK shipping will be free. Wherever practical, we will pay local taxes and import costs. See the table below for more information.
To help us offer the best prices to our backers, we will send rewards from various shipping hubs around the world. Everything is subject to change, but our current plan is this:
 Sinister Fish Games (that's us!) will ship to the UK.

We will deliver the game as soon as is practical for each region. Not everyone will receive their pledges at the same time. We will delay the retail release until pledges have been shipped, but we can't guarantee that everyone will have received their pledge before the game appears in stores. 
If your reward is lost or returned to us we will send a one-time replacement free of charge. If your reward is returned to us due to you submitting an incorrect shipping address, we will ask you to cover the cost of reshipping it. Lost rewards (that are not returned to us) with incorrect shipping information cannot be reshipped or refunded. The best way to get help is to read the FAQ to see if your question has already been asked. Failing that, please contact us via our website contact page: https://www.sinisterfish.com/contact-us/
We're here because we all love games, and I'm sure we'll have some laughs in the comments section as we did on our last campaign. As long as we remember that there's a real person behind every username, and treat each other with respect, then it's all good.
Streets has been a labour of love for the following humans:
Haakon Hoel Gaarder is the game designer, artist and graphic designer behind Streets and Villagers. He has a background as an animator, specialising in character design and infographics, using animation to communicate complex subjects in a fun and simple way. Haakon lives in Oslo Norway, and loves exploring large cities. This love of urban life inspired him to make Streets.

Dave is the owner of Sinister Fish Games, publisher of Streets and Villagers. He has had various careers, more recently in print & signmaking, graphic & web design, and making leather armour & props for film & cosplay. He has been running Sinister Fish full time since 2017. Once an age, a mystical wind lifts the veil that separates the spiritual realm from our physical world. Whimsical seraphs, drawn to the vigor of an ancient forest, descend through the clouds, once again, to play their centennial game. This time, however, the moonlight beams reflecting on the foliage will draw the seraphs deep inside the forest, to get a glimpse of the unseen. Join the Thundergryph family! Interact with us to earn Thunders and redeem them for rewards while planting trees. We are excited about this opportunity to engage more with you and we are looking forward to reveal everything we have planned for the future!

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
TIMELINE IS EVERYTHING.

Shaping the games together with our backers is one of the most interesting things of being a Kickstarter creator, but all of this additional content needs to be meticulously calculated before the campaign starts to add enough buffer time to the communicated timeline, while still being unaware of how successful a project will be.

Revising the timeline affects your perception towards us and affects the company stability by postponing future releases. We commit to do our best to fulfill as previously calculated.

Unforeseen problems like the current Pandemic can happen and we commit to be transparent and thorough with our progress.

MAKING A GAME TOGETHER.

When you back one of our campaigns, you are not pre-ordering a product, you are really helping us make the game happen. This is a feeling we don’t want to lose, but we also understand that a game needs to be fulfilled at the right pace.

For Spirits of the Forest: Moonlight, we segmented the potential success of the project into four different outcomes and we have decided to establish the proper buffer based on the best-case scenario. This gives us room to listen to our community without compromising what we love the most about launching on Kickstarter: shaping a game together.

WE LEARN. WE HEAR YOU.

Starting 2019, we decided to split our team into groups. We would be working at the same time on different projects and we would request help from freelancers if needed, without compromising our main tasks as a team.

Today, after 7 campaigns under our belt, we are much more solid as a team, having a greater confidence on facing the challenges that the future holds, and we owe all of this to you and your support towards our projects.
We will always be grateful and we will always be prepared to listen and learn from your advice.

campaign.story:
Roll Player Adventures is a cooperative storytelling board game for 1-4 players set in the world of the critically acclaimed dice manipulation game, Roll Player. Players take the role of fantasy heroes: facing challenges, adventuring through the realm of Ulos, and making decisions that change the story — and the kingdom — forever.
After a thousand years of peace, Dragul armies raided from the north, prompting you and every other loyal citizen of Nalos to sign up as soldiers of the King’s Guard. The armies of Nalos fought long and hard against the North’s monstrous generals and their minions, finally turning the tide of the Dragul Invasion.
In each of the game's 12 storybooks, you’ll be asked to make choices, complete skill checks, and fight battles that will permanently alter the world of Ulos for that adventure and in future adventures. You’ll find new allies, make enemies, and uncover secrets that will change the world around you.
Whatever choices you make, someone will remember — and respond.
Choose from one of 21 pregenerated characters, or import a favorite Roll Player character and take them on a heroic journey. Each character brings unique attributes, starting cards, class abilities, and backstories to your adventure.
Pregenerated Characters
Importing Characters from Roll Player
Roll Player Adventures does NOT require the Roll Player base game or any of its expansions to play, though it’s possible to import characters generated in Roll Player using any number of its expansions. Do you have a favorite Obnoxious Saurian Fighter who grew up as a Street Urchin from your last game of Roll Player? Bring them along
Each of the 17 races and 36 classes have unique portraits and class abilities in Adventures!
Convert your attribute scores and use them to build dice pools during your adventure!
Every market card from Roll Player has a new dice-manipulating counterpart in Roll Player Adventures!
 Note: Roll Player products will be available individually in the pledge manager.
Roll Player Adventures has 11 adventure books that form a continuous campaign, and 1 infinitely replayable sidequest that can be played at any time. In a session of Roll Player Adventures, you’ll explore a new area of the world of Ulos, represented by a unique adventure map. As your party travels around the map, you’ll read aloud from that adventure’s storybook and choose how you’ll approach each encounter.
During your adventure, you'll encounter strange creatures, solve puzzles and mysteries, and discover new areas of the map to explore.
Roll Player Adventures blends an immersive branching narrative with cooperative skill checks and combat encounters. These dice placement puzzles echo the satisfying, puzzle-solving features of other Thunderworks Games hits such as Roll Player and Cartographers: A Roll Player Tale. In each combat or skill check, players manage their resources to fill dice slots with dice of specific colors and numbers. With clever play and the players can attempt to overcome the obstacles on the path of adventure.

Spend stamina from your character’s attributes to add specific colors of dice to the dice pool: 
Then play cards from your hand to manipulate the dice and solve the puzzle:
If you lose a combat or fail a skill check, there’s no replaying a scenario or rolling up new characters. You now need to deal with the consequences of your failure, and see how the world changes in response. Even death is a new adventure — with its own 10-encounter storyline.
Roll Player Adventures has several systems dedicated to remembering the results of your actions. Together, they represent an incredible amount of responsiveness from the game world to player choices. Importantly, these systems also can interact with each other, giving nuance to relationships — you may choose to gain a temporary ally in an adventure, but be regarded by them differently because you’ve offended their faction in the past.
At the end of each adventure, you’ll spend your earned gold and experience points to advance your characters, improving your party for the next adventure. There are 100's of unique abilities to discover and many ways to specialize.
Want to try Roll Player Adventures for yourself? You can play through a draft of Adventure 1: Battle at Blacklake on both Tabletopia (Free!) and Tabletop Simulator. 
 Rahdo Runs Through - Runthrough
The Nefras's Judgement expansion is available as part of the Immortal Knight and World of Ulos pledge levels. In this expansion, Nefras, the Snake of Years, will judge each character in your party as they make personal choices that are woven through the storyline of your campaign. Uncover your backstory and choose your alignment in Roll Player Adventures: Nefras’s Judgement.
During a campaign including Nefras's Judgement, each character in your party plays through one unique backstory quest that spans across multiple adventure books.
For example, if a character in your party had a “Detective” Backstory, you might slowly uncover clues about a murder, scattered through the adventures in the main campaign, finally either solving the mystery or sending an innocent insectoid to Kulbak prison in the storyline's climax.
When setting up the Nefras’s Judgement expansion at the start of a Roll Player Adventures campaign, players can use the backstory provided with a pregenerated character, or they can import the backstory and alignment from a character built using Roll Player.

The Thunderworks team has been working on this project for over three years. The scope is bigger and more ambitious than any project we've done in the past. campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Every project has risks. I've outlined some common areas of risk in boardgame projects and how I've done my best to address them.

> Artwork: All the artwork for the game is complete, with the exception of any images added due to achieving stretch goals or any last minute tweaks before sending the final files off to the manufacturer.

>Development: All twelve books of Roll Player Adventures are complete and have been extensively playtested. We are currently playtesting the full campaign with final art and most of its graphic design to make sure everything is just right before we send the game into final layout for manufacturing.

> Component Quality: I've worked with and built a great relationship with one of the best game manufacturers around, Panda Game Manufacturing (www.pandagm.com). Their proven track record on games like Eclipse, Terra Mystica, Pandemic, Belfort, and Mice & Mystics, proves they make great games with a high standard to quality. They've printed all Thunderworks titles to date.

> Delivery Timeline: Unexpected delays out of my control can always occur (i.e. component shortage, manufacturer issues, customs delays, etc...). For the production schedule of Roll Player Adventures, I've used conservative estimates to account for unknowns and bumps in the road.

> Fulfillment: I have received multiple estimates and will be working with established fulfillment companies that have proven track records for delivering quickly and efficiently all over the world.

> Eighth Project: Even though this is my eighth Kickstarter project, I have continued to spend endless hours researching Kickstarter as well as participating in many Kickstarters. I have done my best to foresee and minimize any obstacles or stumbling blocks.

In addition, in my life outside of this campaign, I have over a decade of project management experience on large-scale software projects. I will continue to leverage that experience and apply it to this project by anticipating issues and sidestepping hurdles that may arise.

campaign.story:
Your goal in In Too Deep is to personally gather the most Intel on Syndicate operations, but also to gather Evidence of different types. Evidence can be put towards individual success by investigating the three Chapters that make up the game's timeline, or towards a shared pool of Evidence dedicated to foiling the Final Plot itself and preventing the Syndicate from dominating New Dawn City for good. 
Evidence is filed into the Chapter for personal gain, or into the Final Plot to foil the Syndicate's plans as a group!
Each turn, you'll hook into the mind of a criminal, then you'll gain Grip with every criminal you control. As your Grip increases with criminals, you'll gain access to their unique skills, and develop the stamina to extend your turn and accomplish more. 
A player hooks into the Smuggler, and gains enough Grip to activate its unique Skill!
Next you'll put your hooked criminals into motion in the zones of New Dawn City. You can move criminals about, transport crucial items, activate the unique zone powers if the coast is clear, trigger powerful criminal skills if you have enough Grip, manipulate the unsuspecting local security forces, and engage in other activities designed to bring you ever closer to the heart of the Syndicate. 
There are lots of possibilities... the game provides a deep toolkit for achieving your goals!
You'll need to put everything in place for the Syndicate's criminals to carry out their nefarious deeds. When everything has been arranged and a crime is committed, you'll earn Intel and Evidence, and unlock more serious crimes in that storyline. Your presence in the minds of the criminals lets you influence their approach... dangerous behaviour will earn you more Intel on the Syndicate's operations, but it also destroys Evidence and earns you more Dilemmas. 
Side Crimes are simpler but less rewarding. Story Crimes get more complex and more rewarding the further into a storyline the group pushes!
Dilemmas are tricky; they come with tempting rewards, but also dangerous Corruption. At the end of each Chapter you'll be forced to choose half of your dilemmas to keep as Permanent Corruption... the ones you keep could be richly rewarding, but the best rewards come with the most corruption! Losing control could drive you over to the Syndicate's side if you're not careful... and it's hard to know for sure if you are the most corrupt agent!  
You want big rewards but can you risk the corruption? That's the dilemma!
 At the end of the game, the least-corrupt player earns a bonus. The most-corrupt player has gone in too deep, and will suffer a massive penalty... if the plot was foiled! If enough of the needed Evidence has been filed, the plot is foiled and the In Too Deep player suffers the price of their corrupt ways. If the plot wasn't foiled however, that player reaps the benefits of their troubling tactics with no penalty at all. All players cash in their Dilemmas, and when the dust settles, the player with the most Intel wins the game! 
Ready for more? Watch this detailed tutorial video by the inimitable Jon Gets Games!
 Take a look at the writeups and rundowns below from our wide variety of previewers and playtesters!

Prisma Arena is a fast-paced game of over-the-top arena combat set in an all-new universe. Beginning as novices recruited for your ability to channel Prisma - your inner light - you will train in the martial art of Prismakata. Each fighter is joined in the arena by Mo’kon, creatures that embody individual emotions, and will learn to blast and strike, pulling off powerful combos as you attempt to bounce your opponents out of the Arena. With approachable rules and accessible gameplay, players can choose a one-off game or grow to become a Guardian of Hope over multiple battles. Whatever you decide - train hard and fight well! The future is in your hands!   
  ______________________________________________________________
Hub Games prides itself on making our games approachable, and Prisma Arena carries on that tradition. Watch our official How to Play video here, and don't forget to check out the rulebook by clicking the button below!  
You can also play the two player version of the game right now on Tabletop Simulator! Hit the button below to be taken to the game's Workshop page. Please note that you will need to own a copy of Tabletop Simulator in order to download and play. 
_______________________________________________________________
In the world of Prisma Arena, every hero - like every player - is unique. We've worked hard to ensure that you'll be able to see yourself in the characters you can create, so before your first game of Prisma Arena, you will personalise your Hero’s appearance. Using removable stickers, you'll have a variety of options open to you such as new faces, haristyles and much more. While all Heroes start out with the same ability, as you train in the Arena and rise through the ranks, you will unlock new uniforms and incredible Prisma Powers that you can mix and match to suit to your personal preference and playstyle. We can't wait to see who you bring to the table!
_______________________________________________________________
We've worked with some of our favourite content creators to see what their thoughts are on Prisma Arena!  
PLAY

At Hub Games, we are determined to always offer the very best product from the start. We’re also very aware that games are luxury items, so want to ensure the widest audience possible by offering our range at the best price possible. Everything you find inside the Prisma Arena box is the best that it can be, meaning that we’ve got no need for Stretch Goals or Kickstarter Exclusives. Narsehole is a water powered tiny butt shower (bidet), attachment for your existing toilet with a dual nozzle spray and pressure control for a maximum clean.  Never have an itchy or irritated butthole again from improper cleaning with toilet paper.  
Yes there’s other bidet attachements out there, but we spent hundreds of hours watering our butts to fine tune the angle, stream and pressure of the Narsehole for your tender areas.   
If Your Butt Could Talk -  ”Imagine a life where im never irritated. You rarely see me, but you can feel me when I’m upset.  Please start using water, it’ll make me happy and when I’m happy, you’re happy.” 
 How does Narsehole connect? It attaches in-between the seat and bowl and connects to the fresh water supply coming out of the wall via an included hose splitter.

Trust us, all sprays are not created equal, we spent hundreds of research hours watering our butts to fine tune the Narsehole’s stream in order to take the best possible care of your tender areas! We’re four dudes that used water to clean our butts for the first time in our mid 30’s. It was amazing, faster, more efficient and it left us feeling clean and fresh! We were shocked.

3. How do I use the Narsehole? Poop, play on your phone for a while to make sure it’s all out, turn the direction knob to the “starfish” and the water pressure knob to desired spray, go back to playing on your phone while moving your butt around a little bit to be thorough, turn water off, pat dry with a few squares of toilet paper or hand towel, and you’re done.
4. Is it sanitary for multiple people to use the same Narsehole? Yes. Narsehole is designed to be clean and hygienic with a self-cleaning, auto-retracting nozzle and full-length nozzle guard. i.e. it’s a million times more sanitary then using toilet paper.
5. What’s the “Clam” for? If you happen to find yourself in ownership of a vagina on your frontside…set the directional knob to the “Clam”, turn the water on low:) Water is an effective way to remove bacteria and prevent UTIs.
6. Does the Narsehole require electricity? Nope. It’s powered entirely by your fresh water supply. This also makes it easier to install.
7. What is the temperature of the water? It’s cool/room temperature water. It’s kinda like splashing your face with water in the morning...a nice little wake me up :)
8. What’s the difference between the Narsehole and the less expensive options on Amazon?  The cheaper ones have one nozzle (not worth your time) and 90% of dual nozzles are $70-$150.  We tested all the (direct from China) Amazon models and the truth is, you get what you pay for — if you’re used to boxed wine, you’ll still think it’s good — but the Narsehole is for people who like that fine wine! We’re not judging, but ask yourself, which person are you?
Design/Prototype - Our main focus on design was finding the perfect spray for both the starfish and clam.  Testing hundreds of different angles and hole patterns, we finally found the perfect spray and are excited to bring it to a butt near you coming this July:)!!

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
There's always a risk in delays when manufacturing as there is a lot of hand work. Things that could go wrong include: too many seconds quality pins, slow shipment, manufacturer errors, etc. However, I've worked with my manufacturer for years of designs and they are very prompt and produce great pins! I don't see many things happening that would delay the production for too long and if there are any errors they have always promptly remedied with a fixed batch.

There may be minor differences in the actual pin vs what you see in my mockups due to hand enamel filled precision, color matching. These should just be small changes though and the pins will be close to what you see here as much as possible!

Packages may get lost without the right address, so please double check your address to be sure that it's correct! If packages do not arrive over 2 weeks past estimation, I will ensure I correctly make a solution to get the product to you.

campaign.story:
Check out more screenshots in the update
Try out Black Book: Prologue now! It's Free, featuring over 20 spells, and the entire Day 1 from the final game! Available for Windows and Mac. 
A young girl named Vasilisa, destined to become a witch, decides to throw her fate away and marry her beloved - but that dream is shattered when her betrothed dies under mysterious circumstances. 
Aching for her lost love, Vasilisa seeks out Black Book - a demonic artifact, said to be powerful enough to grant any wish to the one who uncovers all 7 of its seals.
Step into the shoes of a devil-fighting sorceress, and travel the province of Cherdyn to unseal the Black Book - and solve the plights of people in need.
The game takes place in a setting unlike any other - a 19th century countryside, where Slavic myth neighbors reality.
Fantastical creatures, elemental spirits and demons exist alongside ordinary folk. Some of them are evil, some are not. Yet, only a select few are able to perceive, let alone communicate with the otherworldly beings. 
Vodyanoy - a male water spirit
Black Book features a wide variety of mythological creatures: from some that you may recognize, like Chorts and Drowners - to other, more obscure ones.
We took extra effort to achieve authenticity in our portrayal of these creatures - using old texts of classical myths, illustrations from folk tale books, and every other source we could find as reference. 
Left: Vasilisa the Beautiful, 1899 by Ivan Bilibin
Black Book is a unique opportunity to get acquainted with the world of Northern Slavic mythology, shaped by its history and tradition. The game was developed by the people who grew up with these folk tales, and consulted with historians and anthropologists to make sure the game’s narrative accurately represents the beliefs of their ancestors.
Every Chapter's main goal is for Vasilisa to unlock a Seal of the Black Book - and to do so, she will have to challenge the mysteries of the otherworld.
Battle demons and other mythological beings, help ordinary townsfolk with their troubles, and solve the mystery of the all-powerful Black Book! 
Battle otherworldly forces using a unique card-based combat system. Each turn, Vasilisa has to compose a spell by putting together multiple cards - each with their own special effect. 
Some cards work better together - so be sure to create a perfect combo for maximum damage!
Throughout the game, you'll always be adding new cards to your arsenal. There are multiple ways to obtain new cards - from buying them at the shop and getting them as rewards for quest completion, to getting them as drops from enemy encounters.
Collect different cards and build decks that fit specific situations! 
On her journey, Vasilisa will meet some people (and not just people), who wish to aid her in her cause - each with their unique backstory and ability, that will definitely be helpful in battle. 
To grow stronger, Vasilisa sometimes relies on the aid of Demons, whom she sends out to do her bidding. Recruit demons, and pick out ones with the right abilities to get the job done properly.      
In Black Book, we do our best to emphasize the dark atmosphere of mythological stories with the help of music and sound effects. In the game we combine electronic music and folk musical instruments. We studied authentic recordings of folk songs - some tunes were recorded hundreds of years ago, and will now be reborn in our game.
Mikhail Shvachko is the composer of the game, breathing life into the world of Black Book with his music. Previously, he did the music for our previous game, The Mooseman - which can be found here: https://soundcloud.com/mikhail-shvachko/sets/themoosemanost
If you want to get a taste of what to expect when it comes to the unique sound of Black Book, you can find some of his latest work here: 
Aside from Mikhail's work, in Black Book you'll hear live choral music, performed by the student choir of the Perm Regional College of Arts and Culture.
In Black Book, you'll unlock new songs as you explore additional locations and do side quests. You will be able to listen to them in a special section in the game menu.
Thanks to reaching the first stretch goal we’ll be doing an english voice over for Black Book — this was made possible through the support of each backer! 
Here’s the list of voice-over actors we confirmed: 
 Sarah Anne Williams as Vasilisa (Jinx “League of Legends”, Chihaya Mifune “Persona 5”)
 Kyle Hebert as Egor (Ryu “Street Fighter”, Kamina “Gurren Lagann”)
 Daman Mills as Nikolai (Frieza “Dragon Ball Super”, Kai “Beastars”) 
 Ben Diskin as Proshka (Mega Man “Mega Man 11”, Aida “Beastars”)
If you feel like helping us grow the community around Black Book, we’ll be happy to reveal some content as milestones are reached. Join us on Discord to enjoy content reveals!
Black Book supporters, who commit to a pledge in relevant tiers, will see themselves in the game - or help us design unique in-game content!
Throughout the world of Black Book, multiple gravestones will be scattered. These are not your regular gravestones - these are a token of our eternal gratitude, in remembrance of those who pitched in to make our dream game a reality!
Everyone's name from Adept pledge (or limited Backer Relief Plus) and forward will be immortalized in the game in those gravestones, so don't miss out on the exclusive chance to find yourself among the beautiful backdrops of Cherdyn!
One of the core features of the game that we're really proud of is the unique visual style of the Black Book. That includes every visual aspect: the locations, character and enemy models and animation, and last, but not least - the character portraits!
Included in the Occultist pledge, you'll get the chance to see your own appearance, drawn in Black Book's artstyle, in the game itself! The development team will contact you and ask for a photo, which the artist will use to commission a portrait (which is also available on its own in the Herald pledge) - and then we'll pick out a place to include it in the world of the game!
The entire Black Book's combat system revolves around cards. Each card has a unique property - and if combined with others in the right way, can deal massive damage to the unholy creatures that roam the land. With the Hexer pledge, you'll get to design the look, name and in-game properties of a combat card that Vasilisa will use in her demonic encounters. Still, remember - setting and game balance restrictions do apply, and the development team does have the final creative control over cards included in the final game. 
Throughout her journey, Vasilisa will find herself in many uncommon situations - from solving domestic disputes to confronting demonic creatures, who are known to terrorize human folk. Black Book will be filled with lots of unique in-game events - and with the Sorcerer pledge, we'll include your own scenario in the game as well!
Later on in the development cycle we will contact you, and ask you to submit a short scenario - which we will then discuss and edit with you, and include it in the main game. But please keep in mind that setting restrictions do apply, and the development team does have the final creative control over the events included in the game.
Want to leave a bigger impact on the events transpiring in Black Book? Then the Warlock pledge is the way to go!
A side-quest consists of several in-game events, usually ranging from two to three - and tell a bigger, more developed story. As with the previous reward, we'll contact you later on, and after edits and approval from the development team, we will include an entire side-quest of your making in the final product! Be warned, setting restrictions still apply, and the development team still has the final say over in-game content of this calibre.    
After finishing our latest project, The Mooseman, we’ve wanted to return to the idea of making a game based on Slavic mythos - but this time, something much bigger in scale.
We’ve been working on Black Book for quite some time. During that time, we’ve accomplished a lot - from refining the game’s visual style and character design, to writing the story and developing the proper combat system.. The result of our work so far can be seen in the demo - but there’s still a lot left to be done until the game is ready for release.
With the extra budget acquired from Kickstarter backers, we aim to add many new features to the game: some of them planned, but scrapped due to time and money constraints, and others completely new.
Aside from gathering the funding required for development, crowdfunding would allow us to directly engage with the gamers all across the world - and, with their help and feedback, make The Black Book the best game it could be.
We're aware that the current gaming landscape is about to undergo major changes. With that in mind, we want to make sure that Black Book will be available on PC, as well as current and future consoles - so that all of our audience gets to enjoy the game, no matter what their main gaming destination is.
We intend on supporting all current generation platforms: PS4, Xbox One, Nintendo Switch. 
One of Black Book's core features is its rich, text-based narrative - and we believe that we owe it to the players to make sure this narrative is to you in full. We are already working with a professional editor, making sure that the English version of the game meets the high standards that our audience has. And currently, we expect the game to be available in the following languages upon release:
Morteshka - The Developer
Our projects are mythology and ethnic-based with the narrative and worlds supported by historical facts and folklore. Our first project, The Mooseman, was released in 2017 on Steam, and in 2018 on AppStore, Google Play, and modern consoles.
The name of the studio comes from wordplay of "Mort", which is French for "dead" and Komi for "a man", and "Matryoshka", the famous Russian doll.
HypeTrain Digital - The Publisher
Black Book is being published by HypeTrain Digital, an indie game publisher for PC and consoles. They provide initial funding for developing the game and porting it to consoles and helping us with the Kickstarter campaign.
HypeTrain Digital work side by side with independent teams to successfully ship their masterpieces to a worldwide audience. Their titles include: The Wild Eight, Stoneshard, DESOLATE, Police Stories, 12 is Better Than 6.
-
This project is promoted by Jellop, the ad tech power behind the best Kickstarters with 1,100+ successful Kickstarter projects with over $460M raised between them.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The Mooseman was our first project as a team - and during its development, we learned a lot about what it takes to make a game from start to finish. While we are confident in our ability to deliver the game on time, Black Book is a project of a bigger scale, compared to Mooseman - and so, there is a chance that the release date would be changed further down the line. 

However, as we've said before — making Black Book as great as it can be is our priority number one. Throughout development, we will keep you informed about all updates and issues. 

We thank you for your faith and support!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
A Civilization game that fits in your pocket! 
Age of Civilization is a streamlined Euro-style civilization game with unique mechanics for 1-4 players. Instead of playing as only 1 civilization in 3 hours, each player could now play as 3 civilizations in 30 minutes!
With the help of the unique gaming mechanism, the set-up for every game is greatly different, providing a high replay-ability to players. During the game, players will rise civilization to collect resources, research technologies, build wonders, and prepare for war. Eventually, every civilization may become less powerful as the population may drop in different ways, or simply because the era is changing. (Not all civilization can adapt to a new era, as we know it from history.) It will be time for you to raise another kingdom! The new kingdom can inherit the advantages of the former civilization to continue the legend in the game. As the rise and fall of 3 empires, a unique set of the civilizations of yours will finally arise! 
PLAY

At the beginning of a game, 8 action cards are shuffled to form a time track in random order, then place the permanent action card at the upper left of the time track.
In each player turn, the player take actions by assigning worker tokens to the action slots. Only the 3 actions on the permanent action card AND the 3 actions right under the permanent action card are available to choose.
When all players have finished their turn, the current round ends. Move the permanent action card to the right by 1 card slot when a round ends. As a result, 1 action card of the previous round will become unavailable, and 1 new action card will be available for the next round, creating a new era!
Besides taking actions to develop empire, each player could rise civilization card to gain more powerful abilities and reset population(number of workers). Civilization cards you own are stacked to show your current civilization with its main ability, and the legacy ability of your previous civilizations.
Rising new civilization is very powerful, but the number of civil. card each player could own is limited to 3. So the timing of "Rise and Fall" is a critical decision to make.
After 6 rounds, whoever has the most points wins! 
For detail rules, please check out the following links:
Download / Game Trial

Regola v1.5 (Italian) PDF

Risks and challenges
This campaign is our second campaign, and through our first one(Samurai Vassal), our team learns a lot about managing a Kickstarter project. We are taking all of those lessons to heart and we are prepared in successfully fulfilling the project.

- We have the illustration and graphic art over 90% complete. 
- We are working with a manufacturer with rich experiences in board game production, which is a reliable company we have worked with several times before. 
- We are collaborating with a solution house to make sure we don't get mistakes with the tax and customs.

With all the above and more preparation works we have done, chance of mistakes and delays are reduced as much as possible. Moreover, we will regular updates the progress, read every comment and be present to answer any questions from our backers. Thank you for your amazing support!

The ICE Makes Team

campaign.story:
The Earth as you know it today no longer exists!
  Dominated by machines, the remaining humans have only two solutions: Stay on Earth and be enslaved OR flee to new horizons: the MOON and MARS. 
In Tramways: The Dystopian Expansions, you are one of those intrepid engineers who decided to survive and face these two hostile worlds! 
Since 2016, Tramways has been nominated for several awards around the world such as Jogo de anon 2017, Goblin magnifico 2017, -and the Heavy cardboard People's Choice Golden Elephant Award 2016. 
All stretch goals funded during the first campaign are included in the rewards for this campaign. 
Heavy Cardboard will make a Teach & Play on Thursday April 25th 1900 EDT, 2300 GMT, 0100 CEST
Here the Rules explanations in 5 minutes
Here the final thoughts from Rahdo about Tramways: The base game.
A dystopia is a story about a futuristic society where individuals can not achieve happiness. In Tramways (required to play these two expansions), the aim of the game is to finish the game with the most happiness.
In Tramways: The Moon and Tramways: Mars, you will first build the board by arranging a number of modules (depending on the number of players).
  In these two expansions, the outer edges are linked by Roman numerals. As you would expect on a planetary map, you can build off one edge of the board and continue on the other side!
 You will also play these two expansions with a new special development card.
Cards with two icons in ONE slot
 The Tramways Dystopian box can fit all other expansions already released in 2017&2018...
In addition to the build-around-the-board mechanism, you will need to manage night & day.
  During each turn, one of the modules are found in the night and no more deliveries can be made, making all buildings "black". On the next turn, the night moves on and it is the next modular board that sinks into the night. All these changes will need to be taken into account as you plan your actions.
In this expansion, the Martians become a new type of passengers. The green discs of the Tramways base game are used as Martians and you will need to move them as many times as possible.
However, Martians will only travel to buildings already containing a Martian.
In order to move a Martian, you must play a magnetic strip, as usual, but you must also discard a rail worker.
The network will also have to stay connected and you will have to start the game by building from one of your parcels. 
You can find the English rules HERE.
TRAMWAYS is a game for 2–5 players, lasting about 30 minutes per player. It is set in the same world as Small City, also published by Alban Viard in 2015. Fans of this universe will recognize the city theme and challenging yet intellectually rewarding mechanisms.
TRAMWAYS is a pure pick-up-and-deliver game — OK, with a twist of card management, but no randomness — in which players are trying to build their networks into a full-blown transit map. 
If you want to know more about the original campaign click HERE 
The goal of the game is to have the most Happiness points at the end of the game. 
You earn Happiness points by moving passengers, building new railways, and constructing new buildings. You take on the role of investors in the early 1920s who are trying to develop the most efficient rail network. You collect tickets (cards) throughout the game and use symbols on them to take actions.
The more efficiently you use your cards, the more you can do with them, but the more you must increase your stress level, as well. Stress is tracked on your personal board, and counts as negative Happiness points at the end of the game. 
You can add to your pledge any add-ons you like, just add the total to your pledge. I will send you the survey after the campaign for confirmation. There will be no pledge manager later, you need to increase your pledge by the amount.
Example: One copy of Tramways: The dystopian Expansions + One copy of Tramways Engineer's Workbook = $24 + $25 + $5 (SC) = $54 (no additional SC)
We'd love for you to try Tramways before you back the campaign! The game has been implemented on Tabletopia, and you can play for free here:
I have designed and developed several boardgames during the last 9 years such as Tramways, Small City, CliniC, Card City XL, Town Center and many expansions for these games. 
For this project, I have worked with 2 awesome graphic designers
Sampo Sikiö is the graphic designer of Eclipse and Tramways. I like working with S because he is a genius to sump up complexe ideas with one minimalistic icon. 
Todd Sanders lives in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, where he works as a graphic designer, publisher and furniture maker. He has a great renown as a solo board game designer.
Many of his games have already been published: Pulp Detective, Mr. Cabbagehead's Garden,  IUNU and They Who Were 8
Because you are helping me finance my project, I will help you finance your shipping: I will pay part of the cost, so you only have to pay $5 for shipping a game of this size. It is the least I can do. 
Also there won't be additional shipping costs for any adds on you will purchase during the campaign !
Like our past campaigns for games such as Tramways, the Tramways expansions, Card City XL, and the Tramways Engineer's Workbook, we have respected the delivery time, and in some case, boxes were even delivered earlier than expected (depending on how complex production of the game has been).
For example, for the Card City XL campaign or Pulp Detective campaign, thanks to very rigorous management of the files, and great contacts at the manufacturers, we managed to deliver the game 2 months early! 
Thanks to Ludicreations for their help during the campaign.
Follow my projects on Twitter : https://twitter.com/AlbanVIARD?lang=en 
Become a fan on BoardGameGeek : https://www.boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/233149/pulp-detective
