campaign.story:
At least the paper is recycled isn’t it? Well, maybe a tincy bit. Currently 99% ends up in landfill. And the precious little that makes it to the recycling plants usually gets remade into napkins or newspapers - not cups.
Like us, you probably already have a selection of reusable cups gathering dust in the kitchen cupboard. We’re just not using them. Why is that? To our way of thinking they are usually too big, too small, too heavy, too unstable, too leaky and too easy to forget. All we wanted was a reusable cup that you … errr … actually reuse!
Take it out of the dishwasher in the morning. Spick and span.
Fill up at home 
 or wait until you reach your local café.
Enjoy on the go!
Scrunch up and put it in your bag
 or pocket.
What is pokito made of?  In the development phase we trialled a variety of materials including silicone but our beta testers questioned its feel, heaviness and slight odour.  We eventually decided on TPE (thermoplastic elastomer) for the soft component and PP (polypropylene) for the hard bands. Both materials are:
How much do you want to drink today?  Depends?  No problem. Adjust your pokito to suit. Pop it open to grande size 475ml (or 16oz), medio 350ml (or 12oz) or espresso 230ml (or 8oz). Simple!
We don't want you burning your fingers when you grab a coffee first thing.  Or have to wrestle with those pesky slip-on/slip-down sleeves or the dreaded ‘double cupping’.  So, we sensibly designed pokito with built-in insulation that's always in place to protect you from the hot stuff. And, the middle is firm to grip too - we don't want you ‘squishing’ your drink skywards either!
What’s in a lid you might ask? Well, quite a lot actually. pokito's raised lip delivers just the right amount of drink minus any drips. It's spill-proof and snaps down with a reassuring click so you know it’s sealed shut. 
Seeing the sights.
On the tube.
In the gym.
In the car.
Andrew Brooks - inventor of pokito - is passionate about serving up a practical reusable alternative to the terrible waste produced by disposable cups. He had his light bulb moment while fishing off the west coast of Canada in the summer of 2006. He saw a whole mountain stripped of its pine forest destined for the nearby paper mills. Later on he discovered that most of this paper wasn't even recycled and began to wonder if there was a better way. 
It took a while and more than a little ingenuity before pokito was born. Andrew sketched out his ideas in late 2012 before taking them to a team of industrial designers who gradually evolved the technical drawings. Eureka came a few months later when a paper ‘proof of concept’ 3D model was printed - which lasted 5 minutes before it crumbled to pieces! 
Over the next three years many aspects of the pokito were refined to make it - not only practical - but safe too. British production engineers tested countless prototypes, experimented with numerous types of materials and made many minor adjustments to get it right. Fine tuning the lid stopper, for example, took precision engineering to micron level (10ths of a millimetre). We had to pause a couple of times too to 'revisit' parts of the cup. The centre band needed more insulation and the lid wasn't quite up to scratch. We weren't looking for perfection but we did want pokito to be the best it could be even if that meant delaying it for a while!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The development of the pokito has taken nearly four years and we’ve been careful to ensure that most eventualities have been considered as we come to launch. We’re now ready to put the cup into production and this is why we need your backing! We have first rate manufacturing facilities in the UK that will produce the cup in carefully monitored conditions and in sufficient volumes. We have negotiated delivery terms with our material suppliers in the EU which should minimise delays. Finally, we have partnered with a UK-based fulfillment company - GamesQuest - who have significant experience delivering successful Kickstarter campaigns worldwide. 

We have a limited number of cups ready to ship before the holidays in the four primary flavours; Cherry, Blueberry, Lime and Blackberry. We're going to get these to all you Early Birds as soon as the campaign is over. We're confident that we'll be able to deliver the remaining pokitos by March 2017. In the unlikely event of any delays, part of our pledge to you is that we will keep you informed. We truly appreciate your backing and know that we will get your pokitos into your pockets soon!

campaign.story:
Deep in the Pocket Universe, the balance of power is shifting. Seventeen newly discovered planets are being colonized and tapped for crucial resources. Shifting alliances and stacks of galactic credits influence battles for control. Can you claim Universal Rule in this 4x wallet game from Button Shy?
     In Universal Rule, players battle for control of the universe in this pocket sized 4X style game. You can colonize new planets, improve upon those planets, gain credits based off of the resources that the planet produces, or attempt to destroy other planets that threaten your existence. Other players can follow, but at a cost. The first player to show their true dominance through victory points will win the game.
Universal Rule is a 3-5 player game designed by Chip Beauvais with art by Sara Beauvais and layout by Jason Washburn (of Talon Strikes Studios). Gameplay lasts 30-45 minutes and is recommended for ages 12 and up.
The game consists of:
-17 Planet Cards
-1 Rule Card
-Fold Out Full Color Rules
-Wallet Packaging
NOTE: Players will need to provide coins or tokens for tracking (25 cents in coins per player is suggested), or check out our bonus pack for trackers.
This is part of our Wallet Line and will be packaged in a small vinyl wallet, perfect for taking it on the go. It's pocket-sized, portable and protective... and has proven itself with our growing line of wallet games.
  We normally offer a bonus pack with each game, but here we have TWO! Choose one, the other or both. One is straight up game utility, the other is a lot of new content. Check it out. 
BONUS PACK 1: TRACKERS - $3
Instead of using coins to track your credits, you will receive 5 Tracker Cards (one for each player) each with 2 clips to track your credits and your attack contributions. The Tracker also includes the rule changes that are implemented when using Trackers instead of coins.
BONUS PACK 2: ALIEN HOMEWORLDS - $3
You will receive 6 Alien Homeworld cards. These are placed in the center of the table and represent the aliens that are currently in place on specific planets. If a player tried to inhabit one of those locations, they must either align with the alien and take a special power for the rest of the game -OR- vanquish the alien to gain additional stars.
(more aliens will be revealed as we go!) 
 How to play video coming ASAP!
You can print the full game right here. It's only 2 pages long with just black ink. The rules are just another few pages, and you can even make it work by just viewing them online. NOTE: The PnP and rules are early versions. We will be updating the files as the campaign goes.

Chip Beauvais started designing games in 2006, and hasn’t been able to stop. He has a Masters degree in Mathematics from Tufts University. He lives in Maynard, MA with his wife, daughter and a bunny. This is Chip's second Button Shy Wallet Game, his first was Smoke & Mirrors. You can contact Chip on Twitter @the_FlyingSheep.
Button Shy is the little guy in the big competitive board game world. Instead of trying to compete with the many great publishers out there, we decided to do things our own way. We order Wallet Games in parts and assemble them here in the US. It's an old fashioned mom and pop style operation, releasing high quality, yet personal little games.
We release a new game each month and have a great following of repeat customers. As a result, we've built the Board Game of the Month Club, a subscription service where you receive unreleased microgames, promo cards, a newsletter with interviews and game-related comics, and big Kickstarter discounts.... every month.

campaign.story:
Pixel Tactics is a 2-player card game that captures the tactical strategy of a classic SRPG (Strategy Role Playing Game). Battles take about 30 minutes to play, and each game is vastly different due to the powerful influence of Leaders over game play! 
Pixel Tactics has been around for almost 4 years with 9 different games and expansions under its belt. Jasco Games is very excited to partner with Level 99 Games, the publisher of the original Pixel Tactics line, to bring you this new edition of the game.
Learn more about the existing Pixel Tactics Games here!
  Check out a complete tutorial of Pixel Tactics!
  Each box comes with over 25 different characters, including Mega Man himself and his many allies and villains throughout the classic series. Both boxes are complete games, and you can play a complete 2-player game with just one box.
The cards in these boxes are completely new, and are fully compatible with other Pixel Tactics Games!
        Check out more reviews and comments on Board Game Geek!
"If you’ve missed out on previous PT releases, I cannot stress this enough: this game is amazing. It might come in a tiny box, but it’s overflowing with great ideas, emergent tactics, and “Ha, suck it!” moments. If you haven’t already, this is the time to pick it up." - Dan Thurot, Space Biff
"A very good 2-player game, one I plan on playing a lot more, and one I'm glad to have in my collection." - Ryan Metzler, the Dice Tower
"I'm a huge fan of Pixel Tactics. If you want a fast, 2-player card game, Pixel Tactics is one of the best." - Tom Vasel, the Dice Tower
"Whether you play this as a filler or as an all-nighter, it will provide a good amount of enjoyment for all ages and all types. Obviously the "retro" gamers will greatly appreciate the theme as well too." - Scott Morris, Crits Happen
"An easy to learn, highly tactical game that has immense replay value. Gamers who like lots of options and enjoy games where cards interact with each other will love this one." - Tony Mastrangeli, Board Game Quest
"If you are looking for some classic NES nostalgia, your anime fix, and a fun 20-30 minute strategy game, then this is the game you’re looking for!" - Edward Kabara, RPG.net review
             
Other Pixel Tactics games are available directly from Level 99 Games! Discover over 150 more heroes and leaders!

 Mega Man: The Board Game is available NOW directly from Jasco Games! 
Capcom has APPROVED the use of Stardroids in Mega Man Pixel Tactics! To get this expansion with an additional 11 characters and 22 cards, please add $8.00 to your pledge and we will send you the Stardroids expansion pack with your pledge!
  Each Stretch Goal unlocks one more promotional card for all backers at the Mega Buster, Stage Select, Super Fighting Robot and Mega Fan pledge levels! These bonus cards include characters from Mega Man's latest adventures! If we unlock them all, there may be an even bigger surprise in store...
   Social Stretch Goals
Like us on Facebook and unlock more goodies!
  Social Stretch Goals below are unlocked!
   About Us
Jasco Games is a premiere game publisher based out of Las Vegas, Nevada. In 1998, Jasco Games started as a local table top game retailer in the Dallas area. In 2010, Jasco Games began publishing the Universal Fighting System (UFS) Collectible Card Game. 
Since then, Jasco Games has published several sets for UFS including properties from The King of Fighters XIII, Darkstalkers, Mega Man, Red Horizon, The World of Indines and releasing soon: Street Fighter, Mortal Kombat X and Cowboy Bebop. 
Jasco Games is also involved in Board Game and Miniatures Game production, having produced Mega Man: The Board Game and Albion's Legacy (A cooperative Arthurian Legends Game) and will be releasing Buffy The Vampire Slayer: The Board Game, Top Gun: The Plot Twist Party Game, The Universal Tactics System Miniatures Combat Line, including Dragon Ball Z, Mortal Kombat X and Street Fighter Miniatures, and, of course, Mega Man: Pixel Tactics. 
D. Brad Talton Jr. is the creator of the original Pixel Tactics series (published by Level 99 Games), and has designed all the cards that appear in these new editions. 
     Backer Badge
    Shipping will be applied to the pledge level you selected based on your country. For this campaign we are only shipping to the USA and Canada. We have licencing for North America for Mega Man classic. If you are in other North American territories we can make arrangements if you contact us directly by E-mail: ron@jascogames.com
If you are located outside of North America, it is likely we will still be fulfilling your territory in the future, however it will not be managed through this campaign. We will either host a separate campaign for all licensed territories at a later time, or go through normal distribution and retail with options for the same products offered here. Our licensing agreement with Capcom is for North America only. We do have plans to open international territories through further licensing agreements at a later date, but it will not be possible for this campaign. We apologize for your inconvenience.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Mega Man Pixel Tactics is our second major Kickstarter Project at Jasco Games. We previously produced Mega Man: The Board Game, which successfully shipped after a few delays (mostly due to over-ambitious stretch goals and some snafus in miniature production).

Building and fulfilling a Kickstarter project for a licensed game comes with its own unique set of challenges. Even though delays and difficulties are bound to come up, we are confident in our ability to deliver the game, as we have in the past, regardless of what happens.

This time around, we have taken precautions to make sure that things will run much more smoothly. We've pre-approved all of our artwork and cards with Capcom, designed our stretch goals from the ground up, and worked out the logistics of USA and international delivery ahead of time. 

Furthermore, Jasco Games has been in the business of producing card games for over six years now. While our first board game effort forced us to learn a few things we weren't fully prepared for, we know card production inside and out.

Thanks so much for your help in making Mega Man Pixel Tactics a reality!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Tiny Epic Quest is the classic story of a fairy tale world overrun by evil and in need of heroes... that's where you come in!
Tiny Epic Quest is a competitive game, where each player controls a band of three heroes and will travel a vast world fighting goblins, learning spells, completing quests and acquiring powerful magic items!
The world is made up of 17 map cards, each offering two locations, a left side, and a right side, for a total of 34 locations.
The layout of the world and the locations of the player castles are the same each game, however the locations of the temples, spells and goblins are unique each game.
Travel is handled by a limited-action-selection system offering five distinct forms of grid-movement of which only four will be used each round, during the day phase. 
During the day phase, players are also competing to complete puzzles as shown on three public quest cards. The first player to complete the puzzle by positioning their heroes accordingly collect the quest card and its benefits. 
  Each round is broken down into two phases, the day phase and the night phase.
  In the night phase, players will roll adventure dice in a communal press-your-luck fashion to try to accomplish the tasks at the locations they ended at during the day phase. This could be fighting a goblin, learning a spell, or delving into a temple. But be careful, if you take too much damage you may exhaust and lose all that round's progress and more! 
Players keep track of their heroes' collective health, power and progress on personal adventure logs.
And when you acquire powerful items, you equip them right to your ITEMeeples™! 
Players keep track of their spell progress, and the rounds magic level on a community magic mat. As the round's magic increases, goblins become more threatening and even your own power turns from good to bad!
After five rounds, the game is over. While you may not have single handedly saved the world, did you accomplish more than the other players? Whoever has the most points in the end from goblins killed, spells learned, quests accomplished, and legendary items acquired, wins the game!

Risks and challenges
The publication of a board game is a highly involved process. It can be prone to many mistakes and delays, even for experienced publishers.

We're proud to say that we are prepared for the task at hand and have years of experience in successfully producing board games and fulfilling Kickstarter projects.

Here are the steps we take to prepare and reduce the likelihood of mistakes and delays:

1. We have done significant pre-production. This includes having all the illustrations for the game complete and the graphic art over 75% complete. The production quote is in hand and ready to be initiated.

2. We are working with our long time partners Panda Game Manufacturing. Who we've worked with on over 10 separate projects and have a great relationship with. We are familiar with their production requirements, timelines, payment schedules, communication methods and Chinese freight arrangements and costs for when it comes time for shipping. We will provide tracking information for the boat when the games leave China.

3. We are working with Ship Naked again for project fulfillment. Having worked with them for over 4 years, we are confident that they can handle any amount of work we send their way. Above all, I am 100% dedicated to backer communication. I will be transparent with our process and involve our backers as much as possible. I will be present daily during the project to answer any questions and I read every comment. I will provide regular updates and supply photos of the progress.

campaign.story:
Wordsy is a tabletop word game for 1-6 players. It takes only 20 minutes to play, but when you finish, you'll want to play it again. That's because Wordsy is unlike most other word games.
In Wordsy, you get 8 letters dealt out on the table. All players simultaneously try to come up with the best word on the board.
Here's the thing: you don't need all the letters in your word to be on the board. You can add as many letters as you want! So you're never just one letter away, like in most word games. 
This means Wordsy rewards longer words. Those 2- and 3-letter words you have to memorize for other word games won't help you here!
Here's a sample board. What word do you see? Remember that you can use any word you want, other than words with capital letters, hyphens, or apostrophes. You can skip both vowels and consonants; you're just trying to use as many letters on the board as you can.
To figure out your word's score, add together the value of the column each letter is in. You only score each letter once, even if the letter is in your word more than once. The Z is worth 2 bonus points, and the K is worth 1 bonus point.
...
I'll give you a few seconds...
...
...a few more seconds...
...
Did you see the word CATS, for 14 points?
How about SCRATCHING, for 21 points?
Kudos if you found BACKSCATTERING, for 27 points!
  Play is simultaneous. All players try to come up with the single best word on the board at the same time. There's a 30-second sand timer within easy reach, but it's not running yet.
The first player to write down their word takes the 30-second sand timer and flips it on their scoresheet. They're now the fastest player, and they cannot change their word.
All other players have 30 seconds to write down their words. After 30 seconds, it's pencils down and time to score.
In addition to scoring your word's bonus, you get bonus points if your word scores more points than the fastest player's word, or if you're the fastest player and your word is better than half the other players' words.
After 7 rounds, each player adds the scores of their best 5 words plus all their bonus points. The player with the most points wins!
Want to learn more about the game? Read the rulebook draft, or try it yourself with a free, no-art print-and-play version of the game!
And if you're on Twitter, check out @WordsyBot, which tweets out a different board of letters every 30 minutes!
Wordsy is a re-implementation of my first published game Prolix, which Z-Man Games released in 2010. While I'm proud of Prolix and its accomplishments (like making the Games 100), I've learned a lot about game design in the past six years, and I've always wanted to return to my first game to see what lessons I could apply to it.
Wordsy takes half the time to play that Prolix does. Its rules are much easier to learn and follow. It is smoother to play. And it scales to 6 players better than its predecessor.
I'm really happy with how Wordsy came out. It's become a very important game to me. I feel like it's doing the things that I really wanted to do with Prolix.
So many games have optimistic player counts, but when you actually play them, it turns out that the 2-player game was just marketing, or the 6-player game is intolerably long.
Wordsy scales smoothly and effortlessly from 1-6 players. Really. I've played dozens of games at each player count, and I put a lot of work into making sure the 1-player game is just as good as the 6-player game.
No. Wordsy is a real-time game, but it's not a twitch game. You're eligible to get bonus points if you're the fastest player and your word is good, but if you come up with a lousy word just to run the timer, everyone will score bonus points off you. 30 seconds is long enough to think of something!
But don't take my word for it...
               "Wordsy is truly a unique word building game that fosters creativity and clever thought over simple mastery of the English language. With its focus clearly on allowing its players to create words of their choosing over making them use all the letters revealed from round to round, Wordsy become incredibly approachable and enjoyable for a variety of gamers." - Man Vs. Meeple
"After several plays through the game, this is going to be one I get to the table as often as possible. It’s quick, anyone can play, and the myriad letter recombinations means near-infinite replayability." - GeekDad
"So here's the final word: if you enjoy speedy games that tax your nerves as well as your creative thinking skills, Wordsy is certainly one game to check out." - Cardboard Republic
"Wordsy gives me the freedom to dream big. The outlay provided by the cards is only a starting point. It’s an invitation to search my memory banks for words that fit the pattern of the letters on the board. It is definitely a step up in fun and challenge from Boggle and Scrabble and other games that limit your choices, and the addition of the timed bonuses really adds some punch to the experience." - Board Game Gumbo
"Wordsy is so smart in so many ways. The puzzle it presents is simple – open your word-hoard and release the most potent salvo you can. And yet, because of the timing element, each round has this really awesome arc of tension; you start slow and before you know it, someone decides that ‘quell’ is good enough and you’ve got 30 incredibly short seconds to decide between ‘loquacious’ and ‘qualifications’ and damn it, why did they have to start with such a short, obvious word?!?" - Gameosity
"Wordsy is a game that takes the standard word game mechanics and flips them into something completely new and interesting. Not only does it shake things up, but it makes you have to think in different and unique ways, which is a blast!" - Meeple Mountain

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Board games are hard to make! Anyone who's used Kickstarter to back a tabletop game can tell you about projects that funded but delivered late... if at all.

I've been designing games for a long time, and I now have two successful Kickstarter projects under my belt: The Networks and Bad Medicine. And by "successful," I don't just mean that they funded. Both projects shipped to backers all around the world within a month of the estimated ship date.

I've backed enough projects to know what tends to go wrong with a tabletop campaign. Here is what I'm doing to make sure Wordsy will not be delayed.

First: Game design and graphic design are done. This game is ready to be sent to the printer. In fact, I am already in pre-production with the printer, so once the game funds, we will be ready to proof a physical copy of the game.

Second: I got a lot of feedback about production quality in my last Kickstarter project, so I've made a change. Wordsy will be printed by Panda Games, one of the biggest and best-known hobby game printers in the world. 

Third: I will be using Funagain Games to deliver Wordsy to the US and most of the world, instead of trying to handle things myself. That leaves shipping in the hands of people who can send packages safely and quickly, and who understand that tabletop games require more packaging than other products. I'm also using a separate fulfillment service based in the EU to handle EU fulfillment, which will relieve a lot of logistical and tax-related headaches.

Fourth: I am using a company called OTX to handle the logistics of transporting the manufactured games from the plant in China to the warehouse in the US. This is an intricate process, but OTX is quite used to it, and they specialize in board game logistics.

Fifth: I've backed plenty of Kickstarter projects, some which delivered on time, some which delivered late, and some that never delivered at all. I learned a lot from each of them.

At this point, I'm familiar with just about everything that can go wrong in a Kickstarter. Believe me, failing to fund is not even close to the worst-case scenario! I've heard many stories, from artists never delivering their art, to pallets stolen at the port, to mold in the game boxes and snails in the shipping container.

But I've built a great team around me. I feel that I am prepared to deliver this product to you close to my estimate of July 2017.

updates.update_content:
So, here we are! it's been almost a year since this Kickstarter went live, and despite some last-second drama, you should have your copy of Wordsy now!
Most importantly: if you don't have your copy of Wordsy yet, please message me! Everyone's copy should have arrived by now.
If you've played Wordsy, and you use BoardGameGeek, please take a moment to give the game a rating and a comment! Every rating, high or low, is a good thing for me. All I ask is for honest feedback.

updates.update_userinfo: More information on the RETURN TO SENDER issue
updates.update_content:
As you've most likely noticed by now, we've had a shipping setback. Funagain, my fulfiller, had a data-import error that mangled all non-EU addresses. So all my backers in North America and outside Europe got an email that their package was going out... followed soon by another email that said their package was being returned to sender because of an incorrect address.
Like I said in my last update, this was not part of the shipping plan! I'm really sad that so many of you were looking forward to getting your copy of Wordsy this week. I just got off the phone with Funagain, and they are hugely apologetic. They don't normally make mistakes like this.

I'm getting notifications that there have been at least a few Wordsy packages that have not been delivered successfully within North America; they're getting marked Return to Sender.
Obviously, this was NOT part of the shipping plan! I'm checking it out with my fulfiller, Funagain, now.
I hope to have an answer - and your game - within the next few days. In the meantime, if you got a Return to Sender message, please email formalferret@funagain.com. They will help you out.

updates.update_userinfo: Out of customs, and on the way to the warehouse!

updates.update_content:
We're getting really close! The ship with our games is scheduled to arrive in port in less than two weeks. Assuming no customs inspections or other delays, we should have the games in our warehouse by the end of the month. So we remain on target for mid-July delivery!
This is a really good time to double-check your BackerKit survey response, especially if you're in the process of moving. And if you haven't entered your survey at all, you really need to now; otherwise, you risk not receiving your game!

I should have mentioned in the previous update: I will lock down BackerKit survey responses on May 24!
if you haven't filled out your BackerKit survey yet, NOW'S THE TIME.
You'll still be able to modify your address after May 24, but you won't be able to purchase add-ons, like extra copies of the game. I will lock down addresses about two days before the games get sent out from the fulfillment center to you. That should be in late June or early July. You'll get an email from BackerKit when that happens.

updates.update_userinfo: Time to head across the sea!
updates.update_content:
After months of waiting, your copy of Wordsy is on its way! The games have all been manufactured, are leaving the factory, and making their long journey to the fulfillment centers. I'd estimate they'll arrive in mid- to late-June. Assuming no logistical delays, like customs inspections, you should receive them from the fulfillment centers in July, as I originally estimated. (Fingers crossed for no last-second surprises!)
Want your copy a bit earlier? If you're attending Geekway to the West, UK Games Expo, or Origins, I'm offering convention pickup at my booth! Just fill out this form to let me know to bring a copy for you.

Hooray, the PPC for Wordsy has finally arrived!
The PPC is the "Pre-Production Copy" (at least, that's what I assume it stands for). It's one of two proof copies I'm getting. As the name implies, this is a copy the plant puts together that simulates what the final copy will look like. There are slight differences in material and cut quality, but it's a great way to preview the look of a game before the manufacturing process begins.

Risks and challenges
As with any manufacturer, if we are hugely successful then the 
problem is keeping up with the demand for our product. 

1. We have made the necessary preparations so we will be able to meet any scale of manufacturing needs.

2. Our product dies and molds have been tested and are ready for production, reducing lead time by 75% on product delivery. The manufacturing lines are in place and are ready to start assembling units immediately after this kickstarter campaign ends. 

3. We have over 25 years of design and manufacturing experience making the highest quality of parts for companies in electronics, 
automotive and green energy industries. 

4. We are proud to manufacture this product in the USA. Creating new jobs and keeping them in the USA.

5. All prototypes were made by Transforming Designs Inc 
manufactured in Chicago IL. This is where we plan to have all 
the sub assemblies delivered, and where the final QC and assembly will take place.

updates.update_content:
Hello Backers,
We are very proud to show all the new beautifully crafted Game Anywhere Wood accessories which are now available. These accessories, with built-in magnets stay in place for all types of game play. The accessories come in four colors, Winter White, Midnight, Dark Walnut and Natural stains. Now we need your help, we are looking at adding two more colors to the accessories. Based on all of the great input we have received from our backers we have been able to design and build one of the greatest gaming tables on the market today. Now we have one more thing to decide on, two more colors for the accessories. Please let us know what colors you would like to see them in. We are also giving you a reward for all your patience and help with the Game Anywhere project. The great news for all our backers is that even though these accessories cost a lot more to make than the plastic or aluminum ones did, and will be sold at a much higher price. All of the backers here our grandfathered in at the Kickstarter plastic accessories price and we are also extending the special price of the accessories to you through the end of the year. This will allow you to receive your table and then decide if you would like more accessories. This is one way we wanted to show our appreciation for backing this project. We realize the accessories took longer than projected. The reason for this was we were not satisfied with the materials and the way they looked on the tables. We continued to improve the design while working with various materials to improve the overall look and durability. Now, I am very happy to say the new wooden accessories look and feel fantastic and go with the tables perfectly. By the end of next week we will total up all the color votes and let you know the two new colors with the most votes, these will then be added to the color choices in the accessory line. Your current accessories in your order will come in the same color of your rail system. Attached below are photos of the new wood accessories, shown in the stained colors available now. Thank you for all of your support, we are looking forward to your input for the stain colors.

I would just like to put this out there for all! We will not be making weekly updates. 
As we have information to share with EVERYONE - we will make an update. 
Special Thank you to all of you backers who have been so patient and understanding as we work on making sure the accessories are the best possible quality. If you prefer to not receive the wooden accessories, just let me know and I will get you the plastic pieces we have made.

On Tuesday afternoon I met with our Rep from DHL and received great news! We will finally be able to get the overseas shipments out to our Service men and women when their tables are ready. The only issue is, we will need physical address instead of APO address. I will be reaching out to those of you who I have not already received these details from. We at TDI thank you all for your service!
Best Regards!

On July 3rd the production of the next 213 tables was started. These will be going out to KS1 backers who upgraded to the mod and then on to KS2 mod backers. I am putting together the list of who will be receiving tables from this batch and personally reaching out to each backer. I hope to have a better feel of delivery times once the tables have been approved by Quality Control. As of today, we do not have an exact date of when we will start shipping. Each backer will be contacted with a tracking number and the additional shipping fees as their table is assigned pick up.

Hello Backers,
We are excited to show the finished LED tables.  The systems are controlled wirelessly via a remote control included with the LED Lighting System.  
The White LED setup includes 5 dimmable settings and on-off control via wireless remote control.

campaign.story:
Valeria: Card Kingdoms - Flames & Frost
The Kingdom of Valeria is expanding to the fiery peaks of volcanoes and the cold ridges of glacial mountains! Valeria: Card Kingdoms - Flames & Frost brings in a whole new set of Citizens, Monsters, Domains, and Dukes that you can play stand-alone using components from the base game, or mix with card stacks from the base game for all new experiences. 
In Flames & Frost, we introduce the powerful "Wild" icon that allows you to gain any resource you want–Gold, Strength, or Magic. You can even mix and match - no need to be restricted to one type with this new ability. 
We also introduce the concept of Banish - allowing you to remove cards from the game. Want to get rid of a Monster your opponent just killed? Now, you can!
You've probably experienced the Event cards if you've played with one of the Expansion Packs that are already out in retail - well, we have a few of them planned as Stretch Goals for Flames & Frost. Some will be helpful, some will be harmful, but all will be memorable!
Valeria: Card Kingdoms - Expansion Pack #3: Agents
In Expansion Pack #3: Agents, you'll discover a whole new mechanic that will amplify your progress in the game. 
Shuffle up the Agent cards and place them above the left-most Monster stack, then deal one Agent card face-up above each of the other 4 Monster stacks. 
As an action, you can Hire one of the face-up Agents and use the power shown. Once you've completed the action, place the Agent face-down at the bottom of the Agent deck and refill the empty space from the deck. Agents will eventually reappear in the line for you to Hire, so you can plan some of your strategy around them coming back up! 
Game Setup with New Content - Including the Agents!
  Valeria: Card Kingdoms is a fast-paced card and dice game that will have you and your friends slaying monsters, recruiting citizens, and expanding your domain.
In Valeria: Card Kingdoms, 1 to 5 players compete to build the greatest kingdoms in about 30-45 minutes.
Monster Card Anatomy
Vile monsters plague the kingdom of Valeria. Use Strength to slay minions like pesky Mummies... and titans like the mighty Salamander... to earn rewards. Then, defeat the boss in each area to clear the land and earn rewards based on the amount of monsters you've killed in that area. 
Citizen Card Anatomy
Players start with 1 Peasant and 1 Knight. Throughout the game you and your friends will use Gold to recruit a tableau of loyal citizens like the hard-working Baker... the magical Summoner... or Valeria's own fixer, the Condottiere. In a single game, there are 10 different citizens to choose from, and with the Flames & Frost expansion, you'll have a total of two-dozen alternate citizen types to create nearly endless combinations and challenges. No two games will be alike.
Domain Card Anatomy
Once you've recruited the right combination of citizens, you can buy powerful domains like Sunder Bay - that allows you to banish another player's citizen, or Rime Temple - that allows you to convert Gold into Victory Points.
Duke Card Anatomy
Each player drafts a Duke or Duchess card at the start of the game, giving you secret ways to score bonus Victory Points. Follow the wishes of your patron and you may find yourself basking in the glory of victory. 
Agent Card Anatomy - New Mechanic!
Over the course of your adventures in Valeria, you will make contact with the high and mighty, like the Prefect - who turns your Magic into Victory Points, and the dregs of society, like the Assassin - who you can pay to disable and opponent's citizen for the rest of the game. 
  30 New Monster Cards (5 new monster areas)
  48 New Citizen Cards (8 stacks of 6 cards each)
  18 New Domain Cards
  6 New Duke Cards
  9 Double-Sided Multiplier Tokens (5x on one side, 10x on the other)
All of the content above will be in the retail version of Valeria: Card Kingdoms - Flames & Frost along with all necessary divider cards to merge everything into your original Valeria: Card Kingdoms box.
14 Agent Cards + 1 Rules Card
For backers, The Agents expansion pack will be included inside of your box of Valeria: Card Kingdoms - Flames & Frost. The expansion pack will include a divider card. 
Duke Mico + 10 Alternate Art Starter Cards
Backers will also receive these Kickstarter Limited Exclusive* cards inside of your box of Valeria: Card Kingdoms - Flames & Frost. 
*Will not be in retail distribution. The Duke Mico card will be available at conventions we attend and through other promotional avenues. 
Add Wood Tokens in the "Plus" Pledge Levels
For those that do not want to use the resource multipliers, the two "PLUS" pledge levels include a bagged set of wood tokens to supplement the tokens included in the original Valeria: Card Kingdoms game. The original tokens with these new wood tokens combined will fit in the token wells of the plastic insert - yes, we checked! :)

PLEASE NOTE: All Valeria: Card Kingdoms base games and Expansion Packs will be shipped along with the Flames & Frost expansion and cannot be shipped earlier. If you would like the base game sooner, we suggest that you contact your local retailer. 
We like to support game stores around the world by offering the Kickstarter versions of the game to retailers during the campaign. We treat retailer backers just like other backers in that they receive their rewards before we release regular retail games into distribution.
We have a $165.00 pledge level set aside just for retailers that includes 12 copies of Flames & Frost Deluxe, 11 for re-sale and 1 for your store's demo library. We will cover the shipping costs to your store but we will ship only to stores in the US, or to foreign stores with a freight forwarder with a US address. If you would like to order more than 12, please contact David and david@dailymagicgames.com.
Every game we create is a discrete project with its own development schedule and it's own budget of production and marketing expenses. We bring each project to Kickstarter when it's ready to give you, our fans and supporters, the opportunity to help us put the final touches on the game and to reserve your copies at the time it will do the game the most good, both financially and creatively. 
Some say that a creator should not launch a new project until their previous project is completed and delivered. That system might work for a designer who is self-publishing a game, but for an up-and-coming company like Daily Magic Games, that system is not viable. At any point in time we are working on a dozen projects in various stages of completion. 

Right now, for example:
Villages of Valeria is leaving China soon.  
Quests of Valeria is being assembled at the printer.  
Merchants of Araby pre-press files being checked at the printer.  
Go Nuts for Donuts is in final file prep.  
Kitten Klash is at the printer.  
10 Minute Heist pre-press files are being compiled.  
VCK Flames & Frost is on Kickstarter now!  
Food Truck Champion is in the art pipeline.  
Horizons is in the art pipeline.  
Sailing Towards Osiris: Dawn of Araby is in the art pipeline.
Spaceways is in beta-testing.  
Alchemists of Araby is in beta-testing.
Thrones of Valeria is in alpha-testing.  
Knights of Valeria is in alpha-testing.  
In order to plan releases for the summer of 2017, we have to run the Kickstarter projects on a specific schedule and be sure all of the final files are to the printer ASAP. To accomplish that, our crowdfunding and release plans for the rest of 2016 looks something like this...
Merchants of Araby: Funded on Kickstarter, Release June 2017
Go Nuts for Donuts: Funded on Kickstarter, Release July 2017
10 Minute Heist: Funded on Kickstarter, Release July 2017
Flames & Frost: On Kickstarter Now, Release August 2017
To some, this looks like a crazy schedule and we know there are backers from previous campaigns that will avoid these new projects because they think it's a risky schedule. We're hoping, however, that our track record for successfully completing and delivering previous projects will give you the confidence to support these new projects we have lined up for the rest of 2016, and that the forthright communications we present when projects do hit snags will assuage any fears that we're going to screw it all up.
Swinging Jivecat Voodoo Lounge delivered one month late in December 2015 and is nearly sold out.
Valeria: Card Kingdoms delivered on time in January 2016. The first print run sold out and the second print run was delivered to our warehouse in June 2016.
ManaSurge delivered one month late in June 2016.
Villages of Valeria is leaving China soon and is expected to reach the fulfillment hubs by Nov 30th and be delivered to backers by Dec 31st.
Quests of Valeria is being assembled at the printer and looks to be on-track for delivery as-scheduled in February 2017.
Merchants of Araby's files are in final prep and will be delivered to the printer by October 31st.
Go Nuts for Donuts files are in final prep and will be delivered to the printer by October 31st.
10 Minute Heist: The Wizard's Tower is awaiting 16 pieces of new art unlocked during the campaign. We expect to deliver the final files to the printer by November 15th.
For us, our end-of-2016 schedule is a well-planned and necessary path to assure that our games are brought to market as soon as possible so that gamers like you can enjoy them.
Daily Magic Games is a designer-friendly and customer-focused publisher specializing in casual tabletop games that are easy to learn and play, yet layered with strategy and depth.  
Isaias Vallejo, Wizard-in-Chief, Game Designer, and Developer
David MacKenzie, Conjurer and Game Developer
Levi Mote, Alchemist, Game Designer, and Developer
Sarah Sharp, Enchantress and Convention Event Planner
Dylan Pharaoh-Whitney, Sorcerer and Graphic Designer
Claire Donaldson, Illusionist, Illustrator, and Graphic Designer
We are focused on listening to what our customers have to say and making sure that we are producing the type of games you want at the high quality you demand. We are actively involved in the Comments section of each Kickstarter and keep backers up to date with plenty of updates post-Kickstarter. We like to make casual and gateway games in an effort to get more people to the table. Our games are easy to learn to help new players get in to the game faster, but they're also layered with strategy for the more seasoned players. We're based out of Seattle, Washington and like to focus on the growth and promotion of game design in the Pacific Northwest. We've even started a playtesting event network called playtestNW to help local designers meet each other and engage with playtesters on a regular basis. Our hope is that we're helping designers build better games.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Daily Magic Games is committed to delivering quality products on time. We realize that the publication of a board game can be complicated and, no matter how experienced the project creators and mangers are, some problems may occur. In an effort to reduce the likelihood of delays and mistakes, we have taken several steps to prepare for success:

1. This game project, as well as the Kickstarter campaign itself, are in the hands of two well-seasoned professionals. David MacKenzie has been running Kickstarter projects since 2010 (Alien Frontiers, Sunrise City, King's Forge, Swinging Jivecat Voodoo Lounge, Valeria: Card Kingdoms, ManaSurge, Villages of Valeria, Quests of Valeria, Merchants of Araby, Go Nuts For Donuts, 10 Minute Heist), and Isaias Vallejo comes from a digital games background as production and studio director at Big Fish Games and has designed several successful board games: Sunrise City, Valeria: Card Kingdoms, Villages of Valeria, and Quests of Valeria.

2. We are dedicated to backer communication and feedback. Throughout every campaign, we are as transparent about the process and as open to feedback as possible without jeopardizing production and delivery timelines.

3. We have done significant pre-production. All the art and graphic design for Flames & Frost are completed with the exception of the stretch goals content. The art and design for the stretch goals content has been sketched out and is ready to push forward as soon as each goal is achieved.

4. We have our manufacturer lined up and ready to begin the pre-press process as soon as the the files are delived. We hope that everything goes as planned, but if something falls through the cracks, we are ready and willing to employ every tool at our disposal to get the project back on track and running smoothly.

Thank you for your support!

campaign.story:
100 Swords is an easy to learn tactical deck building game that's played with a poker-sized deck of cards. What you see here is everything you need to play!
Each turn presents a new puzzle as you navigate the varying cards in your hand and the ever changing cards secreted away in the dungeon!
There are two decks and the Multi-User Dungeon expansion pack available through this Kickstarter. Each dungeon deck offers a unique set of cards to adventure in. Both dungeons are also compatible with the Season 1 Dungeon Builder Sets! More on the multiplayer expansion pack below!
Additionally, everyone who backs for a dungeon or more receives the Season 2 Promo Cards! 
  At 600 backers we added new tiers that will allow you to get the first two all-new Dungeon Builder Sets. And at 700 we unlocked the last two!
The 100 Swords Dungeon Builder Sets are 15 cards each (items, monsters, an obstacle, and a boss) that you can use to get the most out of 100 Swords. They're only $7 each, $1 off for this campaign, and we designed our Dungeon Builder Sets to be used in two ways:
The first is easy: choose your favorite dungeon, slap on the Dungeon Builder Set's cards, choose which boss you want to play with, and get to it! Now your dungeon is longer, and has new cards that change up gameplay. Adding a Dungeon Builder Set to a dungeon will lengthen playtime up to 10 minutes. If you have both decks and both sets, you'll have a lot of variants to play with!
The second way you can use a Dungeon Builder Set is to make your own dungeon from scratch! Take cards from the two dungeons and the two sets, construct your own dungeon dive, and compete with friends!
Each week during the campaign we'll run polls for nouns and adjectives. Backers will be able to suggest and vote for them. At the end, you'll vote for the favorites to determine what the new promo cards will be! Last season they inspired Awkward Narwhalman and Behemoth Atom which were pretty rad cards. We're excited to see what happens this time!
While working on Season 1, we designed a lot of cards and learned a lot about what makes swords and monsters and fun dungeons tick. We've put that experience to work:
2 New Dungeons - If you've played 100 Swords, you know you can't have too many dungeons. We've designed two all new standalone dungeons with awesome new cards!
Support for 3-4 Players - We have official support for more players with the all-new Multi-User-Dungeon Expansion Pack for 3-4 player games! All you need are two decks and the expansion to get delving!
2 New Backer-Selected Promo Cards - Voted on by you, the backers!
4 New Dungeon Builder Sets - We've unlocked all four awesome new dungeon builder set expansions!
New Solo Rules - A challenging new solo game mode with a special card included in the promo pack!
New Multiplayer Castle Playmat - This new playmat is ideal for 3-4 player games!
Back this campaign and receive an all-new unique Kickstarter promo card per deck and save $1 off the retail price on everything!
Did you miss the original campaign? We have added tiers with limited quantities that include Season 1 cards for those that are looking for them later in the campaign. We have limited supply of cards from Season 1! We will do our best to make sure cards are available. 
The current plan is to allow people who want all of the cards to acquire them via Season 1 and Season 2 combination tiers. Because Kickstarter doesn't officially support add-ons, we may have to resort to a post-campaign manager for piecemeal requests for Decks and Dungeon Builder Sets from Season 1.
Let us know what you'd be interested in getting in the comments!
Small Footprint - Ever want to play a deck-builder but not have to lug around a giant box? 100 Swords is the same size as a traditional poker deck, both in terms of card count and box size. Those 54 cards include everything you need to play - 18 starter cards, 3 rentals, and 33 cards in the dungeon (including items, monsters, and its infamous boss).
Easy to Learn - There are only 3 types of cards in 100 Swords; items, monsters, and obstacles. Learning the game only takes minutes, and once you know it, teaching it takes half as long. The rules of the game are a straightforward take on classic deck-builders with some interesting quirks thrown in that mix the genre up in new and interesting ways.
Tactical Gameplay - Each turn in 100 Swords is a puzzle where you do your best to use every card as optimally as possible. You'll have to use every bit of info you have to not waste any resources and play the best possible turn, every turn.
Hidden Information - When you first step into the dungeon, every card you'll be interacting with will be face-down. As the game progresses, cards will change from hidden to revealed and back again. As the dungeon shifts from players defeating monsters and acquiring items, you'll be wracking your brain to remember if that card you're moving to is that awesome sword, or a powerful monster. 
  "Having to literally explore the marketplace of cards....gives you a surprising amount to think about!.... Incredibly thematic." 
Richard Ham - Rhado Runs Through
"The art, humor, and gameplay in 100 Swords comes together to form a delightful dungeon delve. Elements like item rental and using your equipment as energy are clever, and the deck building makes me feel like I'm improving my bag of tricks to tackle the dungeon. I recommend this for anyone looking for a light hearted deck builder that plays quickly."
Suzanne - Dice Tower Contributor
"I think this would be an excellent game to teach somebody the ropes of how to play a deck building game.... A whole lot of puzzle solving greatness in one tiny box!.... The possibilities of expansions are literally limitless." 
Undead Viking
"100 Swords is a great balance between luck and light strategy. I love when a turn comes together and you get more equipment room after room. Of course, finding a big baddie and taking him down or sneaking by him and getting more stuff is fun too, as long as my opponent isn't able to get by the monster!" 
Ken - Geek-craft.com
"100 Swords is a satisfying and fun romp through a dungeon without the tediousness of a classic dungeon crawl."
Across the Board Games 
Curious about the specifics? Check out our video below! You can view the online rules here (1.2 - just updated at launch!), and you can download the rules here (1.0 - release).
Each turn, you'll be playing cards to move into, and interact with the dungeon. A lot can happen on a given turn, maybe you'll find some cool items? Or maybe you'll run into some tough monsters?
You'll also be using the cards in your hand to defeat those monsters, acquire items, and clear obstacles. Acquired items will end up in your deck, which in turn will make you more powerful and more able to defeat stronger monsters! Many items also have effects that are important to consider.
Deciding when and how to use the cards in your hand and which cards in the dungeon to acquire or defeat is the key to winning 100 Swords!
When the dungeon deck has too few cards to refresh the dungeon, or when you defeat the boss, the game is over! And remember, it's all about the gold! At the end of the game, the player whose cards are worth the most gold wins!
Check out this official walkthrough to see the game in action:
Here's a quick video rundown with BoardGameGeek from Gen Con 2016: 
Check out the official online rulebook:
  We learned a lot from our previous 100 Swords campaign. We have streamlined our process to make this project turn around super-fast:
We've designed our stretch goal content in advance.
We've got a simplified reward tier system.
Our shipping partner now has better support for post-campaign managers for those who need to make changes once the campaign is over.
Art work for any stretch goals will begin immediately when and if they are funded.
You've asked, and we're delivering: In addition to the two new dungeons, we're also offering the all-new Multi-User Dungeon Expansion Pack which adds support for one or two more players! The expansion features all new items, monsters, and obstacles and a new Mini-Boss. All you need are two dungeons and the the expansion, and you're ready to crawl the dungeons with 3 and 4 players! It's also $1 off during this campaign!
More info on Multiplayer in Update #10! 
 NEW! At 750 backers, we’ll add a new multiplayer Castle Playmat! This new mat will be designed for multiplayer and will be bigger than the season 1 Dungeon Playmat. We’ll also add a new tiers that include EVERYTHING for Season 2 and Season 1. If we reach this goal, we will also unlock a new promo card for EVERYONE!
At 800 backers, we unlocked a whole new set of solo rules. For Season 1, we released "Gold Greed" which is a simple way to have a have a way to compete with the dungeon. It's a great clean way to do it! I've been excited about this goal for a while now. These new rules are pretty great! With this version, the opponent is the Weary Warrior, and she actually has her own of cards which you use on her turn. Really happy with how this work, so we're super excited to share these with you! In addition, we're providing a new promo card to support this new solo mode which will be added to the promo pack!
We're estimating a April delivery. 
Why so quick? We've chosen to do our manufacturing in the US for Shift, Province, Shadow of the Elder Gods, and the last season of 100 Swords. We've been very happy with the communication, quick manufacturing timelines, and production quality, and so we're continuing in that tradition. While it can be slightly more expensive, at the end of the day you're getting high-quality, ethically produced games with crazy-fast turnaround times! No waiting on slow trans-pacific cargo ships.
All rewards will ship from the US. Other solutions would make our game cost prohibitive. You want 100 Swords, and we're committed to getting you the game! Thanks for your understanding. It's also worth noting that shipping costs are even lower than our previous campaign!
  Shipping is expensive, but it's a cost we can all share. To respectfully account for this cost, everyone receives a small discount on shipping without offering free shipping.
Customs Notice: Because this is very small and inexpensive game with a low declaration value, most international backers looking to get in on this Kickstarter will not have any customs expenses with any of the launch rewards.
  Laboratory is a game publisher based in Seattle, WA, USA. We made everything you see here!
In 2013 we designed, developed, and published our very first microgame with the help of backers like you! Shift is a dueling card game that boils down Japanese-style CCG's into a single card. All you need is a friend, two cards, and some coins to throw-down in an epic anime inspired battle! It was even published in Brazil by our friends at Funbox Jogos!
In Spring 2014, we Kickstarted the original Province, which has over 10,000 copies to date. It was also our first game to reach stores. Province tackled the challenge of making a competitive two-player micro eurogame. We think it's pretty swell. Other people seem to agree!
In Fall 2015, we brought our micro ameritrash game, Shadow of the Elder Gods, to Kickstarter. In it, 1-4 players work together to stop a deck of eldritch threats from bringing about the end of all things. Shadow of the Elder Gods is a big game in a small box, and it's now in stores thanks to backers like you!
We also successfully delivered the first season of 100 Swords! ;)
With your help 100 Swords: Season 2 will bring bring a bunch of awesome new cards out into the world!

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This will be our fifth time working with our manufacturing partners at Delano Service. If there are drastic manufacturing issues, there will be problems delivering the rewards. However, by choosing a printer in the US, we have the additional benefit of easier accountability if the product fails to meet our expectations. We've handled the manufacturing of over 16,000 games with our previous projects, and we've learned from that experience.

In addition, we will also continue to partner with Ship Naked for our fulfilment needs. They've handled four of our previous campaigns as well as our direct fulfilment needs, and they've always excelled in pricing, reliability, and respectful customer service.

Every project introduces new challenges. If you look at our updates for 100 Swords, Shadows of the Elder Gods, Province, and Shift, you will see that we try to balance update spam with important news. We make great efforts to keep you informed of exactly where the project is in the production pipeline, and we're always happy to answer questions here on Kickstarter or via email.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Cobras are overrunning the village! To encourage people to get rid of the pests, the authorities have put out a bounty. Seizing the opportunity, you have come up with a clever plan: Breed more cobras! It’s a great and profitable scheme, but be careful: When the authorities find out and cancel the program, you might get more than you bargained for... 
The historical anecdote that inspired this game is known among economists as the “Cobra Effect," referring to a solution to a problem that backfires spectacularly and actually makes things worse.
Cobras is a trick-taking game for 1-5 players where knowing when to win a trick is key to winning. Players must lose tricks to collect cobras, then win a trick to exchange them for points. Timing things just right is the game's core challenge, and if you push your luck too far, you might get bit!
Each trick, the losing players divvy up the cobras shown on the cards played that trick and place cobra tokens on their basket. The winning player empties their basket for points, according to a scale that rewards more points for more cobras—then drops off steeply if you've pushed your luck too far!
Cobras also features a King Cobra card that allows players to either share the win or share the loss for one trick each hand. Use it wisely!
Of special note, Cobras is a rarity among trick-taking games in that it comes with a one-player mode for solo gaming. Check out the rulebook and print-and-play file to find out more.
  52 cards (4 suits of 13) 
5 King Cobra cards 
5 Basket cards 
42 Cobra tokens
5 Scoring cards with scoring rings
1 Solo token
Rules
Cobras will have a suggested retail price of $20, so our Kickstarter backers will receive a 20% discount. 
Also, every Kickstarter backer will receive $3 off their shipping charge! For international backers, Cobras is customs-friendly!
                                                                    We're supporting local game stores by offering the Kickstarter version of Cobras to retailers during the campaign. Just like other backers, retailer backers will receive their rewards before we release the game into distribution. Email cardboardedison@gmail.com if you’re a retailer with a U.S. address or a U.S. freight forwarder and you’re interested in getting Cobras at wholesale pricing for your store.
To ensure maximum success, we have invested money out of our pocket to complete all of the necessary graphics and illustrations to immediately print this game as soon as it is funded. 
By backing Cobras on Kickstarter, you're ensuring that we'll have the money to manufacture the game and bring it to players around the world.
We appreciate your time and investment. Thank you!

campaign.story:
You are an apprentice wizard doing your first steps on the amazing realm of magic, eager to find more and more secrets. Luckily a lot of treasures from the past remain hidden and you managed to encounter an ancient library in the woods filled with magic secrets. Finally your dream can come true but... you are not the only one. Three more magicians have discovered the same library. 
Do you have what it takes to win them in this battle of magic?
Do you have what it takes to gather all this magic knowledge?
Do you have what it takes to win the 
Mystic ScROLLS ?
Mystic ScROLLS uses a real time mechanic with a unique way making a fun dice game for 2-4 players lasting around 20 minutes. You can get the rules and start playing within 2 minutes this tense and fun game where every decision matters.
In Mystic ScROLLS, each player is a wizard, with his own spells trying to capture as many Scrolls as possible.
Each round, a card from the middle pile is drawn and when everyone is ready, each player grabs 5 magic dice and starts rolling to perform as many spells as possible.
  Every time a player has rolled the correct combination, he/she can place the dice on the spell (activating it) and grab more dice from the common dice pool.
    When the dice pool is depleted or a player plays the combination of the middle scroll the round is over and all the spells are activated. If a player claimed the middle scroll he takes it in his spell area (expanding his magic knowledge).  
 The game round continues until only one player is left, who gains the knowledge from all the scrolls of the library.
Tag a friend who likes dice games and spread the word.

campaign.story:
As a skilled artisan, you will use tools-of-the-trade and careful planning to construct a stained glass window masterpiece in the Sagrada Familia.
Players will take turns drafting glass pieces, represented by dice; carefully choosing where to place each one in their window. Windows have unique color and shade requirements, and similar dice may never be adjacent so placing each die is more challenging than the last. Fortunately, you’ll have just the right tools to help you through. Gain prestige by adapting to the preferences of your fickle admirers, and of course, by adding your own artistic flair while completing your glass masterpiece in Sagrada.
Sagrada - A Game of Dice Drafting and Window Crafting for 1 to 4 players that plays in about 30 minutes. Carefully designed by Daryl Andrews & Adrian Adamescu with graphic artistry by Peter Wocken.

Dice (90) - 6-sided, 12mm, 5 colors 
Player Boards (4) - diecut grid holds dice in place while you play
Window Pattern Cards (8) - Double-sided, two difficulties per card, harder windows give more Favor Tokens
Public Objective Cards (8) - Unique goals to strive for, each game is played with three selected at random
Private Objective Cards (5) - Gain bonus points for each pip of your color
Tool Cards (8) - Spend Favor Tokens to break the rules, each game is played with three selected at random
Favor Tokens (24) 
Round & Scoring Track - Keep track of the ten Rounds on front, flip it over to score at the end of the game
Dice Bag - Draft your dice from here. Material TBD
Rulebook - Learn to play quickly with plenty of visual examples
Sagrada comes with 90 6-sided dice (12mm in 5 colors)

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
When it comes to publishing a tabletop game, manufacturing and shipping logistics are easily the biggest challenges. I've had several smooth campaigns, and some rough ones and learned a ton along the way!

We've already started working closely with our manufacturer on this to be sure everything will flow smoothly. As always, there's the chance of production problems, shipping delays, national holidays, but I'm prepared to do my best to deliver a great game in a timely manner. We're working with a new manufacturer with this project who will help us maintain higher control over quality and timelines than previous projects.

All of the illustration and graphic design work is complete. I'm planning to start the pre-press process before the project closes to help give us a head start on getting Sagrada on your table even faster!

As always, I appreciate your support and patience as I'm sure despite our best efforts there are bound to be unforeseen complications... either way, I'm looking forward to keeping you well informed the whole way!

As the company has been around for just over 2 years and this being our second Kickstarter project, we will be carefully managing any risks and challenges that comes with running a Kickstarter campaign and post campaign manufacturing and logistics.

  Please Read:
Tiny Epic Galaxies Beyond the Black is a full-box expansion to Tiny Epic Galaxies and requires Tiny Epic Galaxies to play. It is not a stand-alone game.
For your convenience the original Tiny Epic Galaxies is available on this project and will ship with Tiny Epic Galaxies Beyond the Black. It is also available for immediate purchase and delivery HERE, if you'd rather not wait. If you're a retailer and would like to carry Tiny Epic Galaxies please inquire HERE.
                    Deluxe content features the Drones mini-expansion, which integrates with the pilots, and four additional pilot cards. Additional pilots to include TWO very special cameo appearances by Andy Weir and Tim Schafer!! See them compete in Tiny Epic Galaxies on TableTop Season 4 (coming soon)!
  ***Kickstarter-Limited Exclusivity - Deluxe content will not enter regular distribution. However, it will be available in limited supply at conventions, through contests, online at the BGG promo store, and directly from Gamelyn Games on our website or through our Amazon store.
If you are wanting to learn more about Tiny Epic Galaxies, please visit the original Kickstarter page HERE. 
TEG Beyond the Black expands Tiny Epic Galaxies in a few ways:
1. Pilots (Variable Powers)! Now players compete to hire the best pilots, with powerful abilities, in addition to competing over the best planets.
Pilots are hired by activating 2, or 3, like dice. You activate 2 like dice if the pilot you're hiring is trained to fly the ship you're assigning them to, or you activate 3 like dice if you need to assign the pilot to a ship they are not trained to fly.
2. Exploration (Press-Your-Luck)! Now you can send your ships into unexplored space on a hunt for resources or exploration badges! But beware, you may end up in the orbit of a black hole or being forced to lose resources of your own. To explore, you simply move a ship onto the exploration card. Then, if there are any exploration cards face up, you may take one. OR, you can flip over the top card of the deck, if it's red, you must take it and stop exploring. If it's green, you can take it, or go again until 3 exploration cards are face up, at which point you would have to take the next card you flip.
3. Badges (Set-Collection)! Thought you had a handle on everyone's scores in Tiny Epic Galaxies?? Now you'll have to think again. Players will be collecting exploration badges from pilots they hire and exploration cards they acquire. After the game is over, players are rewarded bonus victory points for each badge type they have the most of. These points can stack up fast and provide opportunities for come-from-behind victories! 
  Since Tiny Epic Galaxies Beyond the Black is an expansion to Tiny Epic Galaxies, we will grandfather the component qualities from TEG into TEGBTB.
FREE COMPONENT UPGRADES
2mm Box Thickness
Spot UV Box Logos
Box Interior Printing (using the hangar image at the top of the page)
310 gsm Ivory Core Linen Cardstock
Cards with Rounded Corners

Our number one goal, and responsibility, is to deliver your rewards. We simply cannot commit to shipping methods or discounts that would price us out of fulfilling our responsibilities to you. Thank you for your patience and understanding regarding this.  
Shipping Costs
Every backer is important to us, regardless of location, but the reality is that shipping is very expensive and is a cost we all need to share. To offset this, while remaining fiscally responsible, we have included a small discount for ALL shipping, but no shipping is free.

      The 6 design goals of a Tiny Epic game!
"Tiny Epic" is an exclusive series of small box games produced by Gamelyn Games and designed by Scott Almes.  
Each game in the series is entirely unique but strictly adheres to TWO core values: TINY and EPIC!  
• TINY referring to the small box used for each game AND the simple, easy to understand, set of rules each possess.  
• EPIC referring to their surprisingly gratifying gameplay. Each are packed with meaningful decisions, layered strategy, and high replayability. Traits not typically found in games this size.

If you missed out on Pentaquark visit http://buttonshygames.com/products/pentaquark-preorder to pre-order today!
    Some of the biggest questions in the world of science may be answered by studying quarks, the smallest of particles. The problem with trying to study quarks is that you can’t find just one quark; you need to find them in groups called hadrons, or some other exotic particles, like the Pentaquark.
  In Pentaquark, you are trying to give science a helping hand by collecting the 5 quarks that form this particle at the detector of a massive particle collider. Move cards you need to the detector, discard others so they may come back as anti-quarks, and try to minimize the number of quarks scattered and lost. If too many cards are removed from the game, the Pentaquark has slipped through undetected once again!
Pentaquark is a single player game designed by Mike Mullins with art by Fabrice Weiss. Gameplay lasts 15-30 minutes (you will immediately want to play again) and recommended for ages 12 and up.
The game consists of:
-18 Cards
-Fold Out Full Color Rules-Wallet Packaging
This is part of our Wallet Line and will be packaged in a small vinyl wallet, perfect for taking it on the go. It's pocket-sized, portable and protective... and has proven itself with our growing line of wallet games.
  The $3 Six-Card Bonus Pack is available in the Game and Bonus Pack pledge level or by adding $3 to any pledge. Here's some info:
Gluons come in each of the 3 quark colors. When one comes into play, you must attach it to a free quark, thereby changing it's color. A blue gluon might change a green up quark to blue and win you the game, or it could turn your red down quark blue and upend your careful planning.
Bosons are very interesting particles emitted when quarks change from one flavor to another. In the game, a boson will have two icons on it, such as up and down. If that boson were to come into play, you must attach it to an up or a down, changing it into the other flavor.
This 6-card expansion can have a dramatic effect on the game. At first everything feels a bit chaotic, but with some due diligence, new strategies will begin to reveal themselves. 
Rules for Gluons, Bosons and Top Cards:
https://www.dropbox.com/s/czf767ctrecfr8t/PQ-QCDPacks.pdf?dl=0
Mike has put together a wonderful video detailing the ins and outs of Pentaquark, from how to play to some strategy for beginners. Check it out below:
  You can print the full game right here. It's only 4 pages long with just black ink (you can get a feel for it without color since the colors are written on the cards, but it's a game about color so the color will REALLY help later). The rules are just another few pages, and you can even make it work by just viewing them online.
Black and white Print and Play with rules included. (but for the most up to date rules only, go to this link):
https://www.dropbox.com/s/bfn8oimbddq9fyv/PQ-PNP-BW-090816.pdf?dl=0
Please note: The rules are NOT final. They still need to go through editing and graphic design, but any notes that you have at this point are incredibly appreciated.
  "The gameplay for Pentaquark is so easy, but the longer-lasting effects of those choices make this 18 card game something quite a bit more than what you initially think. Mike Mullins has put together a quick, fun, but rather thinky, game about perfect information, hand management, and of course science! This falls in line with other great solitaire card games, an instant back for me!" - Donny, Shawn, Travis - Low Player Count Podcast
"There's a certain charm to this strange little game. Whether you're a fan of solo games or quantum physicists, you'll find Pentaquark frustratingly fun." - Mike Wokasch / The Indie Game Report
