Meeple Source makes amazing Character Meeples, and many other sweet resource bits and tokens, to upgrade some of your favorite board games.
Our partnership with Gamelyn Games has allowed us to create Character Meeples for all of the factions in Tiny Epic Kingdoms, Tiny Epic Defenders, and now Tiny Epic Kingdoms Heroes' Call.
Option A (The Hero Upgrade):
If you already own 1-of-each of the original TEK factions, acquired during our first Kickstarter project or since, then what you may want to do is complete your set with the 16-piece set of TEK Heroes' Call meeples by pledging at the $24 level for this campaign. If you do not already have the original meeples, the $48 pledge level would give you 1-of-each of all 32 factions from the original game and the Heroes' Call expansion.
You could then use the standard meeples that come with the game, just as you normally would, and then use our lovely Character Meeples (which match the art for each faction) to represent your 32 heroes.
Option B (The Complete Upgrade):
You may already be playing your copy of Tiny Epic Kingdoms with our fabulous 112-piece Character Set. Your love of everything Tiny Epic is unparalleled! You are ready to complete your set with another 112-piece set of Character Meeples for the 16 new factions of Heroes' Call! The complete sets of Character Meeples are 7-piece sets of each faction, with two pledge levels to pick from, depending on whether or not you already have the original 112-piece set or not.
By choosing this option, you are completely replacing the stock meeples with Meeple Source Character Meeples. This expansion incorporates heroes though, which are currently being represented by a larger solid color meeple. We wanted to come up with a way to distinguish your hero as such, without compromising the Character Meeple art that perfectly matches the game itself. Understanding the importance of being able to identify a hero as such at just a glance, we have decided to include 32 gold-colored wooden pedestals (for free) with your complete set of meeples, for your heroes to stand on. In testing this concept, we simply used a single drop of super glue under each foot of the meeple, which did the trick. Another option that some of you may choose would be to hand paint the base color (the sides/edge of the meeple) another color, such as gold or silver, to differentiate your hero from the others. In any case, we will not be painting or gluing your hero meeples for you, but allowing you to choose how to give your distinguished heroes the recognition they deserve!
As of July 14th, we do currently have a limited number of the 16-piece sets of original TEK Character Meeples and the 112-piece complete sets of original TEK Character Meeples, available for immediate shipping (separate from your Kickstarter pledge) at MeepleSource.com.
All orders are quality-controlled, packaged, and shipped with care from the Meeple Source lair in Orlando, FL. We not use any outside fulfillment centers, here in the US or internationally.
Cynthia Landon and Chris Landon are the sibling duo that started MeepleSource shortly after discovering euro gaming. campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We started making full-color, detailed Character Meeples in 2011. In 2014, we ran three successfully funded Kickstarter projects to create many more Character Meeples. Earlier this year we ran another successful Kickstarter project to create a number of complete upgrade kits for popular games. 

One variable that is sometimes hard to predict is how close the final meeple printing looks to the vector-based concept art you see here. Although we are happy with all of the Character Meeples we have made to date, the colors and level of detail achieved do vary. 

Printing delays are still always possible, though we feel confident that we will not encounter any trouble in this area. We learned all about this in our first Kickstarter project, since there were 150 different Character Meeples all being manufactured, quality-controlled, and shipped at the same time. Although we have recently been able to speed up our meeple creation process a bit, all while achieving the highest possible quality, the risk of production delay is present in all manufacturing.

Finally, we personally perform all of the necessary quality control, package and ship all orders, and manage customer service inquiries. If we do encounter any delays (or other problems), we will certainly let you know. We are very proud of our customer service reputation, to which our past backers and website customers can attest!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Gamelyn Games brings years of experience to this project and has overseen all of our planning and arrangements to ensure Darkrock Ventures will be delivered to all backers in a timely manner just like all of their previous projects.
Every backer is important to us, regardless of location, just as much every pledge makes a difference, regardless of amount. Unfortunately shipping costs are something we all have to face, but that does not mean we cannot be transparent about this challenge and tackle it responsibly. The learning experiences Gamelyn Games has overcome with shipping have come to this campaign in full, and we aim to manage our (and your) risk in a responsible and professional manner.
Shipping costs are a very real factor. They can be volatile and are never trivial. Further, I do not feel that claiming to offer "Free Shipping" only to hide that very real & significant cost somewhere else is the best way of doing things and our backers deserve better. We have decided to offer affordable FLAT-RATE shipping to various regions, but at the same time offer CUSTOMS-FRIENDLY shipping available to ANYWHERE IN THE WORLD through our friends at Ship Naked to offer the best overall value we can for your pledge.
We will always endeavor to keep shipping charges as low as possible by offering discounts on pledges for more than one copy at a time through campaign rewards and add-ons made available through Pledge Manager. The best way to get the game for the lowest cost possible is to split a multi-pack with some friends or family members, everyone can share the cost benefit and more copies ordered means Darkrock Ventures itself will become a better game.
Regarding Customs: Our shipping partner, Ship Naked, offers what they call "Customs-Friendly Worldwide Shipping" meaning they coordinate all transport, customs clearance, and brokerage from the factory to the destination using shipping depots all around the world. They have already laid the groundwork to ensure all packages will make it to backers in every country as smoothly and inexpensively as possible. While we cannot personally guarantee that no single person will have any customs difficulties on an individual level, we are confident in Ship Naked's ability to mitigate any potential issues and keep surprise costs far away from our backers and their ability to make it right should any such problems arise. Historically, Gamelyn Games has had very few individual cases of customs difficulties and the processes have improved even more since those challenges have occurred. Pledge with Confidence!
International Backers Please Keep in Mind: While the shipping costs outside the USA are greater, every base copy of the game will be sold $11 below MSRP through this campaign, with discounts even greater when multiple copies are ordered. Plus, you are guaranteed to get the game before general retailers AND with all bonus content which may never be available at retail at all. Making you pledge in this campaign your BEST VALUE for the complete Darkrock Ventures experience! Get some friends together to split a multi-pack to maximize the value for your pledge!

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The publication of a board game like Darkrock Ventures is a complicated, time consuming, and expensive process. It is prone to many mistakes and that does not exclude experienced publishers.

We at Magic Meeple Games are new to publishing, but not to the industry; and with Gamelyn games are our publishing partner, we're proud to say that we are prepared for the task at hand and have years of experience in our corner with successful fulfillment of board game projects.

Here are the steps we are taking to prepare and reduce the likelihood of mistakes and delays:

1. We have done significant pre-production. This includes having all the art for the game completed and the graphic design over 75% completed. The production quote is in hand and ready to be initiated. All we need now is your pledges to make it happen!

2. We are proud to be working with Panda Game Manufacturing again, the same manufacturer Gamelyn Games has used to create all of their previous projects. Gamelyn Games and Magic Meeple Games both have a great relationship with their team, we are very familiar with their production requirements, timelines, payment schedules, communication methods and Chinese freight arrangements. Together, we have created some great games and products and we hope that Darkrock Ventures will be our next!

3. Professional distribution is already in place, and we are proud to say it will be handled by Ship Naked. They have been responsible for the fulfillment of previous Gamelyn Games titles. All of which were delivered on schedule reliably and professionally. Ship Naked has proven to be communicative, punctual and customer service minded when dealing with Gamelyn Games' customers and they have extended the same level of service and expertise to Magic Meeple Games' publications as well. 

Again, this isn't to say that this project is immune to the possible mishap, they can happen to anyone but we want to show that this road is familiar to all parties involved and we are confident in our ability to deliver our products to our backers and fans. Thank you for your confidence and support!

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Above all, We are 100% dedicated to backer communication. We will be transparent with our process, and involve our backers as much as possible. 

We will be present daily during the project to answer any questions or read any comments and we will provide regular updates and supply photos of the progress when possible.

Thank you for your trust in us! We couldn't do it without you! Let's bring Darkrock Ventures to the gaming world!

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Tiny Epic Kingdoms: Heroes Call just finished its campaign, but with Magic Meeple Games on the case, TEK:HC will cause no delays or have any negative impact whatsoever on the production and fulfillment of Darkrock Ventures. We plan for backers of BOTH campaigns to receive their shipments on schedule.

All Gamelyn Games projects have completed fulfillment successfully. Some backers even received their games and figures early! Backers have since written in with elation about the games, the figures and the management of the projects.

Our backers make these games possible! THANK YOU for your support!!

"It's all about the draft!"
        "4th and Goal, no time outs left and The Backers have one last play to win this game and take home the championship. The crowd support has been the biggest factor so far and The Backers know it. The audience is on their feet screaming! This is an electric crowd all chanting to see a big upset here. We go down to the line of scrimmage to count down the final seconds of this game. Can they do it???"
      Pigskin takes everything you love about the game of Football and condenses it into a 10-15 minute game of strategic drafting and clever play making. Go head to head in this card drafting game for any Football fan!
      The fast action and excitement last 4 rounds as players draft teams and then go toe to toe to test just who is the better play caller. Score touch downs and complete Special Plays all in an attempt to score points. Out think your opponent on your way to victory, oh and by the way ... trash talking is highly suggested!
Click here!
You've made the team!
Recently updated! Includes 3-4 Player expansion and prinatble tokens!
     Football is a team sport and this campaign completely evokes the team spirit as every pledge gets us one yard closer to victory! Pledging today makes you an official member of "Team Pigskin" and you will be there in the celebration after the last moments before the big win. Better start practicing your victory dance now!
ADD ON'S":
$18 - Custom name/number on 1 player in the Pigskin deck.
Multiple copies can be bought by adding the appropriate amount to your current pledge.
     Please note that I made a mistake while making the PNP pledge level! My deepest apologies, but the PNP will include files for 3-4 player games as well. So a PNP will cover all tokens and cards for a 1-4 player game. Sorry about that over sight.
     All copies will be shipped at the same time and assembled in the USA. Shipping dates are all estimated.
    Pigskin is an exclusive Kickstarter game, the ONLY way to get your copy is to pledge to the campaign. Be sure to pick up a copy for your friends as well or for your "Super" Party ;)
More bang for your buck!
       Pigskin...From Beyond is a FREE expansion added to Pigskin that will add a few extra game changing cards to the base game. These cards will be silly and REALLY broken! Be warned that these are optional and will have a big effect on game play! By example...
1 of the 9 From Beyond cards
       The base game ($18 Pledge) will include only one of these cards which will be up to a vote based on what the backers would like most. The other 8 will be included apart of the 3-4 Player Expansion ($24 Pledge). The PNP will include all of these :)
      As the artwork gets completed I will be posting the whole line up which will include Abe Lincoln (who will Score 4 TD's), a Pro Wrestling Dinosaur, an Inquisitive Meeple, Hairy Houdini, a Shark and more!
      If you have any fun ideas for a From Beyond player please let me know!
The rules of the game
      Pigskin is a light filler card game that plays in 10-15 minutes. The main deck consist of 40 "Players" (10 types in 4 colors) and while drafting you're looking to make color combos amongst the available cards for that round. Cards are played simultaneously as you and your opponent score "Touchdowns", prevent "Touchdowns" and pull off Special Plays.
Bonus Cards are scored at the end of the game
      The Pigskin experience is in the cards themselves and the synergy of building a good team (hand of cards) each round. Draft the best team and win the most points because let's face it Football is all about the draft! #AllAboutTheDraft
Draft, Play and Score; it's as easy as 1,2 and 3.

      There are 3 Social Media Stretch Goals

We did it!!!!

Each time you use the hashtag be sure to add @RoarArtGames so I know who you are. An example would be: "It cost nothing to support #PigskinStretchGoals and you could win a prize from @RoarArtGames." If we can reach 250 hashtags then each color will have their own unique Offensive Player drawing!       The total hash tag count was 380+! There will be more artwork for the offense player cards! YAY!!!!
These may seem difficult to reach but if we all work together we can get it done! If you're willing to get the extra yardage for the team then I'm willing to add more flavor to the game art! Now any combination of these may get unlock and have no effect on game play but it'll be great to see if we can make this a reality!
One line at a time
       I am both game designer and artist on Pigskin, I tend to be more of an artist over a designer though. I've always enjoyed creating my own art and am a big fan or cartoons. My style of artwork tends to be very cartoony and over the top. For Pigskin I went through several different design ideas before settling on what is now in the game.
      Graphic design and user friendly design was always at the forefront from very early so as the game developed mechanically it also developed artistically. I have been drawing my entire life and enjoy making games with my artwork. The artwork is practically completed with minor changes to make. The stretch goals for the campaign may unlock more artwork as well.
Details about the artistic process
Took a little more than a season...
The evolution of a Quarterback
       Pigskin started in development about 2 years ago as a game looking to mix poker and Football. Mechanically it was very basic and ultimately was okay just not dynamic enough. Throughout 2013 I would make minor changes and play test it here and there just to get a feel for what were the major problems with the game. In that same time I also was playing a lot more games especially card games.
       2014 was a big year for me personally as that is when my daughter was born. I worked on a ton of different game designs and would still tinker with Pigskin from time to time. The main idea of a deck of players and Touchdown tokens was always at the core but creating good synergy between the cards was very difficult. It went from being a clunky 2 on 2 game, to a deckbuilder and even an expansive idea with a tournament style game play until finally getting into the groove that it's at now.
      2015 has been an improvement process for Pigskin as each play test helped refine it more and more until finally getting to it's current streamlined, user friendly state. Throughout all the changes though it's been a passion for me from day one and I am so proud to have put in all the work to finally bring it to you.
      I also want to take this time to give a big shout out to The St. Louis Board Game Designer MeetUp group who have been amazing for the community and continue to push game design. Thank you!
      Click here to read an fantastic interview I did with The Inquisitive Meeple to get a better idea of the design process and who I am!
More than just a Kickstarter campaign
      I have always been an overweight person and although comfortable with my body size I had a stark discovery one night. I was getting ready to go out to a board game night and had 2 shirts not fit me! It was a real eye opener for how I had been eating/living and I needed to make a change. So part of doing this Kickstarter campaign I've decided to challenge myself by committing to losing 18 lbs through out the duration of the Kickstarter campaign.
      I welcome everyone else to do the same if they so choose. Please post any updates or tips you have in the comments. I will be posting results as well. :)
      I'm starting this campaign at 270 lbs so by the end of it I'm working to be 252 lbs. It will certainly be a challenge but one I am looking forward to as we march towards victory.
       I am a proud father to a lovely little girl and proud husband to a very fantastic hard working woman. I've been playing hobby games for 4-5 years now and regularly attend both a Board Game MeetUp group and a Board Game Designer MeetUp group. I live in the great city of St. Louis, MO which is quickly becoming a creative hub for game design in America.
      I spent 10 years of my life playing in punk rock bands in Texas and fully embrace the D.I.T (Do It Together) lifestyle. I carry that spirit with me into game design as I look to produce games that have "cross over" themes and fun artwork. It's been 10+ years in the making and I'm looking forward to working together to make fantastic games for you and your family.

            In this section I'll be clearing up any questions you may be wondering as far as the "nuts and bolts" of this campaign is concerned.
How is the game being manufactured?
The cards/rules/tokens are being printed in the US. The Touchdown Tokens are per-manufactured and are available at wholesale. The game will be produced by hand and shipped out. Don't be too surprised if I write a personal thank you letter as well :) 
I don't like/understand the game of Football, could I still play this game?
Pigskin uses Football as a theme but the game play is not simulating a real Football game. You don't need to know anything about Football to enjoy this game. I would heavily suggest you read the rules first and then decide for yourself if it's something you'd want to back. The game mechanics are light-euro mechanics wrapped up in a Football package. :)
Why is this a US only game?
Short and simple: Shipping. I'd like for Pigskin to have as large an audience as possible and am fully aware that American Football is vastly gaining popularity in other countries BUT from a logistical point of view it can be very messy to ship to other countries. If you are interested in this game please look into the Print and Play because it's honestly much cheaper than for me to charge ($20-$40) for shipping. Once you have the Print and Play make as many copies as you want. :)
Card/Token quality?
305gsm black-core matte card stock - Same as Magic: The Gathering cards
60 point (0.06 inches) thick chipboard for the tokens
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The risk involved are at a minimum. 80-85% of Table Top Kickstarter campaigns end up costing more than what was raised which means the creator either has to fail to deliver or pay the rest out of pocket. Neither of those scenarios sit well with me so I took a very simple approach to this campaign. I am working only with printers I have worked with before and am ordering from within the US. I am planning on a small production run and am only printing what is backed. There's no freight charges or shipping containers to factor in.

 I've spent 10+ years making albums, T-shirts, promo cd's, flyers and posters in this same way so I am over qualified to bring you a game you're going to enjoy for years. My name is Royce Banuelos and you'll always have a direct way to reach me. I look forward to getting to know everyone who's willing to pledge their money towards my very humble dream and promise to deliver exactly as I've presented.

Be sure to check out our new pledge level with a Full Color Custom Playmat! You can be the king of the ring with this thing! 10" x 15" with 1/8" rubber backing!
In JurassAttack!, two players face-off in an epic head-to-head dinosaur battle!
In this quick card game, each player chooses a dinosaur or pack of dinosaurs from their hand, then reveals them simultaneously to compare Ferocity values to see who has the highest. Each of these prehistoric pugilists have their own special abilities, combo possibilities and varying score values to add to the tide of battle! After resolving the special abilities of each dino, the winner adds their rival's dinosaurs to their score pile while the loser gets to draw new cards. A well-placed bluff or an intentional loss may provide an edge to victory in this game of subtle strategy and prehistoric pounding!
Some dinos hunt alone while others may pack (be played in sets) with dinos of different types. Some dinos have acid spit that blinds the other player for a turn while others take a swing on the way to their opponent's score pile. And sometimes, players may be able to sneak some of their precious eggs into their own score pile to protect the future generation.

3. It's a small game at it's core so we want to keep it that way. Risks and challenges
My experience with our last campaigns, Fidelitas and Best Treehouse Ever, provided quite the learning curve. And so far I have been able to avoid delays and common pitfalls by paying special attention to the following areas and building on previous experience:

Art and Design. The art and design for the game is complete so we'll be ready to print shortly after the close of the campaign. I always like to show you I mean business by paying for the art and design upfront!

Playtesting and Reviewing. JurassAttack! has been tested by many different playtesters and even a bunch of game designers. I have sent a bunch of prototypes to a variety of reviewers. I want to earn your trust by providing you with a solid product that has been thoroughly tested and reviewed by folks from varying backgrounds and perspectives.

Past Experience. This is only the third Kickstarter project I've run for Green Couch Games but I have helped with several other successful campaigns. Also, having spent many years working in retail and customer service, I understand the importance of treating backers with respect and following through with projects.

Of course, there are always unexpected circumstances that pop up, but I PROMISE to communicate every step of the way and do my best to use creative problem solving meet the challenges head on.

Thank you so much for giving Green Couch Games a chance. As a small company, I truly can't do this without you. I will do my best to thank you by creating great little games that you love to play.

Sincerely, 
Jason Kotarski, founder of Green Couch Games

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Risks and challenges

What are the risks and challenges that come with completing your project, and how are you qualified to overcome them?

For a project like ours, the risks and challenges fall into three categories: 
1) Overall Non-completion 
2) Delays in meeting our estimated delivery dates 
3) We do not produce a specific model or change a specific model.

Concerning the risk of Overall Non-completion: we've already completed two massive Kickstarters and are fully aware of the pitfalls. Two things that could cause the non-completion of this Kickstarter are either the loss of our inbound shipments (due to an act of God, pirates or war), or a massive disaster (fire, flood) that levels our facility. Either of those events might be disastrous, however we carry full insurance on our facility and insure every shipment, no matter the size, against loss and damage.

Obviously either of the above tragic events would create delays in meeting our estimated delivery dates, and that brings us to the second category: delays. We learned a lot during our two Kickstarters. However, delays are simply part of the cycle of business and it is our wisdom, training, and experience that would help us mitigate and work through any delay. Some delays are easy to solve, such as replacing a printer that is creating barcodes that a particular USPS hub is having a problem reading. Other delays are out of our hands, such as the 2014-2015 longshoreman west coast work slow down that delayed all of our overseas containers. We have even intentionally created delays when we chose to change models already in production to make them better.

Lastly there is the risk we will not produce a specific model shown. This will only occur if there is not enough interest in a specific model measured by the number of backers that actually pledge for to buy it verses the cost to produce it. This event did not occur in either of our previous Kickstarters, but is nonetheless still a risk. In the event this situation develops we will issue a refund or credit depending on your desire for the buy in pledge amount of the model.

We reserve the right to modify pieces shown to meet production requirements.

In summary we have the knowledge, wisdom and know how to prevent, solve, and work through just about any problem that we will face and will do everything possible to make this an exciting and enjoyable event.

The way the Artists are discovered, the way we buy, exhibit and sell the artworks all makes sense, has it's always the case with games by Vital Lacerda. We can also do marketing actions to promote the artist fame and reputation making their works more expensive for the players to get and more valuable when you sell them. There's also a mechanic of area control and bidding, it's not bidding like in an auction game but rather you pay certain amounts of money to get into a specific space on the Foreign Market so you can be one of the Gallerist to get one of the Artworks in display at the end of the game, and there aren't enough for all players, so the one that spends the less leaves without a work for the Gallery.

Hello everyone. I'm Vital Lacerda, the designer of The Gallerist. I was born in Lisbon 48 years ago, a city I adore and still live in with Sandra, my wife, and my two lovely daughters. I have a masters degree in Marketing and Advertising, and after working in advertising agencies for almost 15 years as an art director, I decided to try my luck as a freelance graphic designer. I've been working like this since 2007. At that same time I also began designing board games, my true and great passion.
Most of all, I consider myself a gamer and still a wannabe designer who had the luck of having a few publishers who believe in my games. I published Vinhos in 2010, and CO2 two years later. Last year was Kanban. Fortunately, all my games were well accepted by enough gamers that they were "successful". The Gallerist will be my 4th game.
I have a tendency to design "thinking" games because those are the types of games I love to play. A big box game takes a lot of time to design, play test and develop. So when I begin such an endeavor, I always look for a few characteristics that are fun for me in those type of games. They need to be challenging; they need to require deep thinking and difficult decision-making; they must allow great control; and to involve intense competition and heavy strategy. Those are the games I love to play and design. I usually start to look for a theme to be the foundation of the game. Strategic thinking inside a game that is supported by a strong theme must always be present. That it is the most challenging thing when designing such a game. The Gallerist is not an exception to any of this.
I like interconnected mechanisms a lot — pursuing strategies, different complex paths — but I also love to adapt, make tactical moves, and have some randomness in games. I try to avoid luck in longer games. I believe luck should be delivered not by the system, but by player decisions.
I also love to move pieces on a board. That is precisely one of the things I most care about in games. I love moving wood and cardboard over the board, I like to touch, to feel. For me, it makes the game much more dynamic, colorful, and fun. Because of that my games always deliver to the players loads of great components inside a big heavy box. And you may expect the same in The Gallerist. I hope you enjoy The Gallerist as much as I enjoyed designing it.  I really still love playing it! Go to the rules section above, read the rules and take a look the video.  I sincerely hope this is a game for you!

MULTIPLE COPY purchases of The Gallerist Game count towards FREE shipping in the US and in the EU, Canada and Australia!
As we have said above, if you are in the EU (outside our partner companies' countries); or Australia or Canada; and you pledge $220 or more (including Add-On games) then your shipping is FREE.  If we are shipping to you at a US address and your pledge is over $100 (including Add-Ons) then your shipping is FREE as well. NOTE that this applies to multiple purchases of the Gallerist Game itself (for instance 4 times $59 - $236 and FREE shipping in the EU countries, Canada and Australia) and does not require the purchase of add-on games (though you should consider those as well!)
Canadian shipping is $18 for one game, Australian shipping is $18 for one game. The Netherlands is $14 shipping. The UK is $21. EU shipping varies a lot by country, as does the rest of the world!
It has been our experience that many people (including sophisticated international Kickstarter Backers) frequently confuse "shipping" expense and "postage" expense. What we try to cover with the above fees (in part) is shipping expenses, not just postage. Postage is the actual charge your country's postal service (or UPS, FedEx, etc) charges us to deliver a package within that country.
Shipping is far more comprehensive and includes: getting the container shipped to the US, or the EU, or Australia; the Customs and VAT (or equivalent) and other import fees and taxes; the drayage from the port to the warehouse (not cheap!); the warehouse fees to unload and sort out and prepare packages; the materials and labor involved in the last item; fees to the warehouse for their service to us, and only after all of that, the postage! We need to cover all of those costs--and they really add up. Frequently they cost as much or more than the game(s) did to produce.
When we combine a low margin price (such as this one we are offering on The Gallerist) with this shipping expense, we do not make any profit if we are not very careful. The shipping we are charging for this project is as low as we can make it and still stay in business.
Internationally, for two or more games, get in touch with us and tell us the total of how many games you want and which ones; and where you would like them shipped. To get in touch with us, please send us a Message (not a Comment please) using the "Contact Me" button at the top.
We will not ship to Russia, the Ukraine and select other places except for specially-made arrangements wherein the Backer takes the risk involved in receiving the package.

"Tiny Epic" is a series of games designed by Scott Almes and published by Gamelyn Games. Each game in this series must strictly adhere to TWO core values: Tiny and Epic! Tiny meaning small (pocket-sized) box with simple and easy to understand rules. Epic meaning gratifying gameplay with lots of strategy and replay-ability. Over the course of numerous games, the series will explore many unique genres and themes. 
Currently the line features a 4X/Civ game Tiny Epic Kingdoms, a cooperative Tower Defense game Tiny Epic Defenders and a intergalactic dice driven/engine building game Tiny Epic Galaxies.
The "Tiny Epic" series began January of 2013 on Kickstarter with its flagship game Tiny Epic Kingdoms! Which has sold a collective total of over 20,000 copies.

Risks and challenges
Risks and challenges

The publication of a board game is a complicated process. It is prone to many opportunities for mistakes and that does not exclude experienced publishers.

We're proud to say that we are prepared for the task at hand and have years of experience in successfully fulfilling board game projects from Kickstarter.

Here are the steps we are taking to prepare and reduce the likelihood of mistakes and delays:

1. We have done significant pre-production. This includes having all the art for the game completed and the graphic art over 75% completed. The production quote is in hand and ready to be initiated.

2. We are proud to be working with Panda Game Manufacturing again, the same manufacturer we have used to create Dungeon Heroes, Fantasy Frontier, the Fantasy Gaming Figures, the GIANT Meeples, Tiny Epic Kingdoms, Tiny Epic Defenders, and Tiny Epic Galaxies. We have a great relationship with their entire team. We are familiar with their production requirements, timelines, payment schedules, communication methods and Chinese freight arrangements. Together we have created some great games and products and we hope that Tiny Epic Kingdoms Heroes' Call and Tiny Epic Kingdoms 2nd Edition will be our next!

3. Professional fulfillment is already in place, and we are proud to say it will be handled by Ship Naked. They were responsible for having fulfilled the shipments of Rise!, Dungeon Heroes, Fantasy Frontier, Tiny Epic Kingdoms, Tiny Epic Defenders and, the soon to be shipped, Tiny Epic Galaxies. All were delivered on schedule with professionalism and reliability. Ship Naked has proven to be communicative, punctual and customer service minded when dealing with Gamelyn Games' customers.

Again, this isn't to say that this project won't experience mistakes, they happen to everyone but it does show that this road is familiar to all parties involved.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Above all, I am 100% dedicated to backer communication. I will be transparent with our process, as to involve our backers as much as possible.

I will be present daily during the project to answer any questions or read any comments and I will provide regular updates and supply photos of the progress when possible.

Thank you for your trust in us! Lets bring Tiny Epic Kingdoms Heroes' Call and Tiny Epic Kingdoms 2nd Edition to the gaming world!

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Tiny Epic Galaxies is currently in production and within 1 month of its estimated delivery date.

Tiny Epic Defenders, Tiny Epic Kingdoms, Fantasy Frontier, Dungeon Heroes, the Fantasy Gaming Figures and the Mini GIANT Meeple Project have all completed fulfillment successfully. Some backers even received their games and figures early! Backers have since written in with elation about the games, the figures and the management of the projects. campaign.story:
Across the land, an invitation has summoned the most clever apprentices: a chance to enter the secret potion society. The cutthroat members, the Apothecaries, have grown too savvy of each other's schemes. They've chosen you to compete in their black market game! Conjuring powerful magic and deception, outwit your adversaries, and you too might join Apotheca.
Apotheca is a 30-minute, potion-crafting strategy game for 2-4 players ages 14 and up. 
Devise your plans by hiding ingredients in the marketplace. Reveal secrets to collect precious gems. Recruit powerful apothecaries to do your bidding. The first apprentice to make three potions becomes a member of the secret potion society!
Only clever folk can navigate this mysterious market. Can you master the world of Apotheca?
Asymmetric Powers – Each of the 15 apothecaries boasts a unique ability to manipulate potions in the market, from familiar movements to innovative brain benders. Combine your powers to set up potion matches your opponents won't anticipate!
Hidden Information – Deduction is key to Apotheca. Only you know the true identity of the secret potions you bring to the market, creating a rich level of strategy when combined with the apothecary powers. But don't worry, this isn't a memory game - the arrows on the back of the potion cards indicate who placed them, so you can peek at your secret potions at any time!
Challenging Choices – Your actions are limited each turn. The tradeoff between hidden information, resource gathering and board control makes it challenging and satisfying to craft the perfect plan. Counter your opponents' powers by starving them of information, build up resources to prepare for the end-game, and bluff your way to victory when your opponent least suspects it.
Easy to Learn, Hard to Master – Apotheca is deceptively simple. Just when you think you've mastered the many apothecary powers and endless board positions, a refreshingly creative move will leave you thirsty for more potion-brewing. We've seen a countless number of Apotheca games, and are still surprised by the strategies of new players and veterans alike.
*Art and components are subject to change.
Shipping fees are added automatically upon backing the project.
Games shipped to backers in the US, Canada and EU are shipped from within those territories. No extra customs charges!

campaign.story:
SUNDAY! SUNDAY! SUNDAY! Monster Truck Mayhem is invading the SuperMegaDome! Brought to you by Ridback Pub, 101 The Animal, and Big Al’s Sound Emporium, this thrill show spectacular will BLOW YOUR MIND! All your favorite trucks and more will be there… AND SO SHOULD YOU! Car crushing, mud sliding, bus jumping, and general mayhem for only $39! Less than FORTY BUCKS gets you the whole seat... but you will only need the edge Edge EDGE!
Monster Truck Mayhem is a real-time dice-rolling racing game, designed by Ben Pinchback & Matt Riddle, creators of the award-winning games Fleet and Eggs & Empires. Players simultaneously roll their dice to race around the SuperMegaDome track, and the winner is the first player to cross the finish line!
Players use custom dice to move 1, 2, or 3 spaces at a time. The numbers, “Tire” and “Boost” die faces are used to navigate course obstacles like the Car Crush, Bus Jump, Death Chasm, and more! Three “Boost” is an instant movement bonus. Three “Tires” causes another player to spin out!
Crush obstacles AND the competition, and be the first monster truck to cross the finish line to take home the SuperMegaTrophy!
Monster Truck Mayhem will offer the same hallmark quality as the other Dice Hate Me titles from Greater Than Games, with fine components, thick punchboard bits, and lots of replay value. The projected MSRP for Monster Truck Mayhem is set at $40.
Here's a list of what you'll find inside the base game box:
6 thick punchboard Monster Trucks, with stands
6 punchboard Monster Truck player boards, with special Mayhem Bonus abilities
6 double-sided, interlocking track boards for variable set-up
15 custom-molded Racing Dice
1 Special Truckdor custom-molded Fire Die
4 Drive Angry! punchboard tokens for Big D
3 Insanity Roll! punchboard tokens for Cthulhu Crusher
8 Sunday! Sunday! Sunday! cards
6 blank Sunday! Sunday! Sunday! cards for adding your own special announcements
2 Sunday! Sunday! Sunday! punchboard pieces for variable set-up
2 1-2-3 Burst Wall punchboard pieces for variable set-up
Full-color rulebook
Monster Truck Mayhem will be the first official title to come in the Dice Hate Me Games "Dragon"-sized box - a box that's almost a foot square and three inches deep, so it's truly monster-sized!  What's this crazy talk about box sizes anyway? Take a look here for more information on our box sizes and game categories!
The Monster Rally expansion pack will be sold separately in retail stores, but will be included for free with every Monster Truck Mayhem pledge (a $15 value). This expansion pack will provide rules and a points system for playing multi-lap races and campaigns where players can purchase awesome upgrades for their trucks! 
Here's what's included in the expansion:
1 custom-molded green Hood Scoop Die 
1 custom-molded purple Sweet Spoiler Die 
2 punchboard Icy Track tokens 
2 punchboard Smokescreen tokens
12 Monster Upgrade cards
2 thick punchboard Monster Trucks, with stands
2 punchboard Monster Truck player boards, with special Mayhem Bonus abilities
Rules sheet for playing rally and campaign races, with points system for purchasing upgrades between races
We'll be revealing more details on the extras included in the Monster Rally expansion as the campaign goes on!
Above is a shot of the prototype base game with beginner track boards in action, which is very close to what the final production copy will look like!
Big D is the flagship truck for the Dice Hate Me Monster Racers team. Four times during a race, Big D can activate the Drive Angry! Mayhem Bonus and move forward three spaces without rolling the dice. As any good Dice Hate Me fan knows, if there's a chance not to rely on the dice for a good result it's probably in their best interest!
Cthulhu Crusher brings a special colour out of space to the SuperMegaDome, filling his opponents' hearts with sheer terror! Cthulhu Crusher can make three other racers go insane during a race, forcing an opponent to roll their dice and move backward double their highest die roll. The Insanity Roll is a great way to keep the race leader in check, and help guarantee that this racer crushes the competition!
This wicked spirit of war from Norse mythology is one of the fastest racers in the SuperMegaDome! Whenever Valkyrie rolls three "Boosts" on her Racing Dice, she can choose to speed forward 5 spaces. The other trucks better watch their rearviews, as just when it seems Valkyrie may be left in the dust she's suddenly a quarter track ahead! 
Truckdor is here to burninate EVERYTHING!!! This fierce dragon uses a special Fire Die with a wild side that can be used as a 1, 2, 3, Tire, or Boost. With Truckdor's flames heating up the SuperMegaDome, the other trucks are TOAST!
The tracks of the SuperMegaDome can often be treacherous, with incredibly muddy slick spots that can keep trucks tied up without traction for a long, long time. Cap'n Crabby only laughs a mighty YAR HAR at the slick spots since he gets traction with only one Tire on his Racing Dice! Full speed ahead!
We have three more trucks to unveil over the course of the campaign (1 in the base game, and 2 in the Monster Rally expansion). We'll be back with more on those in future updates, and we'll have some new art to show off from artist Benjamin Raynal, as well!
The videos shown below were shot at Origins Game Fair 2015. Many of the components are prototypes (albeit close to the final production), and the demo board was built as a mounted, one-sheet poster using the beginning tile set-up. It's important to note that the game will include double-sided, interlocking tiles for variable play instead of one big board.
Everyone should take a moment to note that Ben Pinchback, co-designer of the game, snuck in all quiet-like with Valkyrie for the win in this video. You can also notice him using his veteran skills to calmly count out spaces to make sure he wasn't spun out in the last stretch of the race to take the win. Ben holds the record for wins in Monster Truck Mayhem, so he's kind of a ringer. Then again, he did design the thing.
Yeah, we said it: NO STRETCH GOALS. And we mean it! We decided to unlock all of them for you from the start.
When we first started planning the Kickstarter campaign, we had broken the game down into several stages. The box was initially going to be smaller, the overall components fewer, and the funding goal a bit lower. Our first stretch goal would have been to monster-size the game once we reached a comfortable funding level, then add additional track pieces. We knew we wanted to provide the Rally expansion bits because that would turn an already-great game into an incredibly-awesome game, so those would be next, broken into two stages. Then we'd dig into some extra trucks if the campaign did well.
After all that, we finally took a step back and realized that we wouldn't want to produce a game without any of that awesome stuff, so we decided to just "unlock" all those stretch goals in the beginning, be realistic in our pricing and funding goal, and rev up the engines from the start. Every backer will now automatically get the absolute best of everything in Monster Truck Mayhem without having to wait and see how things progress through the campaign.
One pledge level, no stretch goals, just the biggest, baddest, maddest, monster truck racing game ever. Let's do this!
"Monster Truck Mayhem is a ton of fun in a few minutes. They say the Kentucky Derby is the most exciting sport in under 2 minutes, and if so, Monster Truck Mayhem may be the most exciting game in under 10 minutes." - Richard Launius, designer of Arkham Horror, Defenders of the Realm, Elder Sign & more
"Aside from the fervent yelling and screaming coming from the players, the art from Benjamin Raynal might just be the first thing to grab your attention. Vibrant colors on stylized, chunky cartoon monster trucks make the game feel big and in-your-face. The interlocking, modular track tiles (yep, you heard correctly – modularity = replayability!) have a wonderful amount of detail, from the individual cars waiting to be crushed, to the thick grime of a muddy oil slick that will have you spinning your wheels while your friends catch up. The design of the game makes you feel like you’re there at a monster truck rally." - Matt Halstad, League of Nonsensical Gamers
"You don't have to wait for Sunday Sunday Sunday to enjoy monster truck racing. You can enjoy it any day with Monster Truck Mayhem. This is a frantic dice rolling game that is loads of fun. We won't lie, like many other Kickstarter projects, some Dice Hate Me Games projects have been delayed a couple of months beyond their expected release date. Just to be safe and to project a more realistic timeline for our manufacturing deadlines, we decided it would be best to place delivery of this project about a year out. Our hope, however, is that we will deliver much sooner than this anticipated deadline. Based on previous projects, we feel that this is an extremely safe timeline for production. However, we'd much rather surprise all of you with an earlier delivery than a late one - and we're aiming to race this one out fast!

Art: Trucks and box art by Benjamin Raynal (King of Tokyo), base track art by Jeff Brown (Fallen, Monstrous)

Shipping, in particular international shipping, has been a perpetual headache for us. Amazon and other dedicated online retailers offer free or heavily discounted shipping that we are unable to compete with without enormous losses. As is, we price shipping lower than our actual cost to ship to a given destination, and pledge that your rewards will actually arrive safe and well-protected in shipping, or we will re-send them. For Christmas in 1983, I asked Santa for a motorized Bigfoot® monster truck. It had a key in the truck bed that you turned to make it go go go over anything, and that truck went everywhere with me.
By the time I was 13, I had just about forgotten Bigfoot®. Other things started catching my attention, such as, well... girls. Every Fourth of July week in my youth, my family always vacationed in Myrtle Beach, South Carolina. There was a particularly fetching young woman staying with her family at our motel. I worked up the courage to ask her for a walk on the beach and a grand night at the local arcade, likely spending a romantic evening duking it out on an old copy of Tapper or Karate Champ. Her simple response: "Sorry, but I'm headed to a monster truck rally." 
Believe me, I've never forgotten about Bigfoot® or the other legendary monster trucks from that day forward. 
When Ben & Matt first showed me Monster Truck Mayhem I immediately felt like that nine-year-old turning the key in the bed of my awesome Bigfoot® toy, and I was reminded just how cool - and alluring - monster trucks can be. There's just something about this game that grabs your inner kid. I have witnessed that transformation in so many adult gamers when we've put this game in front of them, and the joy many of them have found in introducing their kids to the fun. I'm so proud to be able to offer this bit of bottled magic to everyone, and I can't wait for each of you to rev up the engines, crush some cars, and feel young again.
All the best,
Chris

Risks and challenges
As with any project that involves the production and manufacture of a good to be delivered, there is certainly a real chance for hiccups, delays and more than one or two gremlins gumming up the works along the way. Many boardgame projects on Kickstarter have been seriously hampered by art production delays, problems with an overseas factory, missing units and one shipping snafu after another.

Luckily, we have a few projects under our belt, and have dealt with many of those snafus and gremlins along the way. We have a good working relationship with our overseas manufacturer and have become accustomed to their protocols, communication styles and general idiosyncrasies. We try to plan for all contingencies, and have worked through - and learned from - kinks we may have encountered in our past projects.

We won't lie - stuff happens. Delays can occur. Sometimes you have to go back and forth on color samples six times just to get the color right, and even then the color isn't perfect. Sometimes even personal life events can blindside you. But what we do promise is that we will hold ourselves to the same high standards we expect from other board game publishers, and we will be completely honest and open with each of you every step of the way.

campaign.story:
Thank you so much, everyone, for supporting Project Dreamscape! The last 30 days have been incredible, and we couldn't have done it without you!
Dr. Reed is the foremost pioneer in connecting the human mind to digital systems. It was his intention to see if people could work together while dreaming, but what he discovered was an untapped source of creativity that brings dreams to life. It doesn’t matter what age, gender, or race a person is--they have the potential for unimaginable ingenuity. Now you too can live your dreams by participating in Project Dreamscape.
Your turn starts by choosing whether or not to take a facedown card, called a Z card--these Z cards are currency in the game, but also count against you when it comes time to tally up the scores. Z cards are used to purchase cards from the Dreamscape, which are then placed in your REM stack. You must choose one of the two abilities on a card to activate when you collect it, but the real fun of the game comes from chaining these abilities together.
Any one of the eight dream abilities in Project Dreamscape, by itself, produces only a minor effect--take a card, flip a card, rearrange some cards, and so on. But with some clever card play, one dream ability can lead to another until you've collected several cards or even cleared the entire Dreamscape. This continues until there are not enough cards to fully refill the Dreamscape after a player’s turn. At that point, the game is over and it's time to score.
Scoring is simple. Just lay out your faceup cards in the order they were stacked, and then find matching abilities that appear on adjacent cards (the orientation of the cards does not affect scoring, but you may wish to rotate the cards to find these chains). Wherever two or more copies of an ability are next to one another, you score points as shown on the score chart. After scoring all of your chains, subtract points equal to the amount of Z cards you have, and that’s your final score.
For some examples of Project Dreamscape's chaining mechanics, check out Richard Ham's wonderful run-through:
Check out the full rules for more information, and the free print-and-play files on BoardGameGeek:
Project Dreamscape: Rules
Project Dreamscape: Print-and-Play files
Project Dreamscape also has a single player variant, although it's currently only available digitally; however, we hope to include the rules in the box over the span of the campaign! You can find the rules for Virtual Dreaming on BoardGameGeek:
Project Dreamscape: Virtual Dreaming
Inside Project Dreamscape, you'll find a sleep deck of 52 cards, two reference cards, five Z shield tokens, a full-color rulebook, a special active player marker, and an expansion deck consisting of 54 cards (three alternate dream types!). The game will come packaged in a sturdy two-piece box that measures approximately 3.5x5.5"--about twice the width of a deck of cards, and still very pocket-sized!
"Small, portable, and challenging, Project Dreamscape engaged each of our players and kept them hooked. Each game provided new insight on new ways to manipulate and organize the Dream cards, mess with opponents, and create killer combos. Project Dreamscape is a game you can learn how to play in 5 minutes and take all afternoon to work out the many different ways to win. Now that’s a good game."
Cyrus Kirby, Father Geek (full preview)
  "It took a couple turns to understand some of the combos and nuances, and then we were off and running! Terrific, clever game!"
Chris Leder, Game Designer, Roll for It!
  "The peaceful artistic style of Project Dreamscape guides you through a quick, combo-making dream you'll want to have over and over again."
Brian Henk, Overworld Games, Designer of Good Cop Bad Cop
  "It's a fun game that I think will only get better with more plays."
Jason Glover, Greygnome Games
  "Deceptively cute, PD is a light, yet deeply strategic card game that keeps you on your toes until the very end."
Chris Chu, play-tester
  "A nice challenge in a small package. I like that I can plan a couple of turns ahead and that my plans are never totally wiped out, but I have to continually respond to changes in the available cards."
Kell Brigan, play-tester
 
"Project Dreamscape might put on a cute, simple facade, but there is deep strategy to be found in this dream world. The ability to rearrange the dreamscape and play powers off of other players' cards is a fresh and ever-changing way to formulate your strategy. Just don't plan too far in advance, because other players' sinister arrangements can plunge your perfect plan into deep sleep!"
John Shulters, play-tester
  Richard Ham, Rahdo Runs Through:

  Dave Taylor, To The Table: Full disclosure: David Taylor is a guy that I believe in and I enjoy his reviews, so I really wanted him to try out Project Dreamscape; however, I do support him on Patreon, so please keep that in mind.
Jeff King, All Us Geeks: Full disclosure: Jeff King is also a good friend of ours, but as he explains in this video, that didn't even need to be considered:

This very limited pledge level will get you a copy of the special edition (See the Dreamer pledge), as well as one of the original water color art pieces from Project Dreamscape’s eight dream types--not a print, but the original painting. Each of these paintings are first-backed, first served. If you back at this level, please send me a private message letting me know which painting you’d like to have.

Painted by Julie Okahara, this completely optional (but totally awesome) roll-up mat depicts a field of dreamers with the cards placed over them representing their dreams. Directly below them are the Z shields from the back of the deck which depict the Z card cost for the card in that space. Above, their collective dream features the sun (the draw pile), and the moon (the discard pile). This mat measures 10x15" and has an 1/8" rubber backing.

These premiums are only applied once. For example, if you order two copies of Project Dreamscape, you will still only pay the $4 one time; however, while Project Dreamscape is naturally import-friendly thanks to its small size and low price point, anything more than the base game may be subject to extra fees.  
We will be holding a local pick up event when the games arrive, at a location in the Sacramento, CA area. The option to attend will be available when surveys go out.
A word from Ben Haskett...
Sarah and Will organize a game designers meeting each month, where local designers can get together and play test each other's games. I was first invited to attend the meet-up about two years ago (where we became good friends), and it was at one of these meetings that I first played Project Dreamscape.
I remember the first couple of turns very well, as I struggled a little bit to find my footing. I understood the basics; you use facedown cards to buy faceup cards, you play one of the two options on each card, you chain them together... but on my third or fourth turn, the game just clicked for me. I realized that these eight dream types, while perhaps a bit mild when played alone, could be combined for a very satisfying "never-ending turn" effect found in games like Dominion. By the end of the first game, I knew we had to take Project Dreamscape to the next level.
Will and Sarah Reed
The two of them already had an artist in mind, Julie Okahara, who created some beautiful watercolor art for the game.  Playful and dreamy, with just a hint of uneasiness, her paintings were a perfect fit for the game's tone.  Her work typically utilizes mixed media, which is in full effect here--if you look closely at the card art, you can see that sections are cut out to reveal all sorts of glittered and textured papers.
The design goal with Project Dreamscape was to create a big experience in a small package--not a micro game, mind you, but simply a small game that packed a lot of compelling decisions into a 30-minutes experience.  The mechanics came first, and the theme was later integrated as Will lay awake at night tying to pair something with the game; when you're asking yourself, "What do people want the most?" late at night, I suppose it's easy to understand why Will settled on sleep as an appropriate theme.
For more insight into Sarah and Will's design process, check out their designer blog posts on Project Dreamscape:
How I Designed Project Dreamscape
Mechanics First
Setting Design Goals
Incorporating Play Styles
Unexpected Group Think
Timing & Number of Players
Expanding Meaningful Choices
Modifying for Production
Incorporating Play-Tester Feedback
Items for the Future
Unconventional Player Interaction
The Finished Look
All of Project Dreamscape's artwork was hand-painted by the talented Julie Okahara. For more information about her wonderful art, check out her website at www.julieokahara.com.
To get a closer look at the artwork that Julie painted, check out our gallery on BoardGameGeek.
Huge thanks to all of our play-testers!

Risks and challenges
This will be the second Kickstarter campaign I’ve run. While my first campaign was very successful, there was still a lot to learn from the experience that I will be able to apply directly to Project Dreamscape. There may be unforeseen circumstances (my first campaign is a testament to them!), but I pride myself on being open and honest about every step of the process; even if it’s bad news, I’ll make sure you’re aware.

I have two personal goals with this campaign, and the first is to deliver on time. Having been through the process now, I feel like I have a better understanding of where delays might occur, and I've taken measures to solve those issues beforehand. Further, Project Dreamscape has the benefit of being a small card game. This will greatly reduce the amount of time required by the manufacturer to produce a proof copy, and mitigate the chance for issues--in other words, Project Dreamscape will be able to begin production very soon after the close of the campaign.

My second goal is to make shipping easier for international backers--there was some behind-the-scenes confusion in my first campaign concerning how EU shipments were to be handled. Project Dreamscape will ship out to backers from the US, but to touch on the game's size once more, it's small enough that one copy of the game will easily ship from the US in a small package and almost certainly not get held for additional customs/broker fees.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Hello, dreamers! It’s been a while, hasn’t it? It has, in fact, been over a year since I closed the book on the Project Dreamscape campaign. updates.update_content:
Greetings, dreamers! I received word yesterday that Project Dreamscape has reached Ship Naked--the fulfillment company that will be shipping you your rewards*.
*If you pledged for a collector's edition or your pledge included original artwork, I'll be shipping your rewards myself. And of course, if you're coming to the local pick up, you'll be picking up your reward yourself. :)
You may be saying, out loud to your monitor, "Hey, didn't you miss a step? I thought the games had to go through customs." It was a whirlwind of a labor this time, starting at 4:15 a.m. and finishing up just three hours later--and little Olivia Grace Haskett was born at a whopping 10.2 pounds! We're all back at home now, sleeping whenever possible, but mostly just staring at a little baby.

updates.update_userinfo: The Games Have Reached U.S. Shores!
updates.update_content:
Greetings, dreamers!  On Friday, October 2, the boat carrying Project Dreamscape reached US shores.  Now we wait for the games to pass through customs and drive to New Hampshire, where they’ll be shipped out to all of you--we’re in the home stretch!  Everything is ready to go--the mats and special edition boxes are all paid for and are in production (Lyris Laser and the company responsible for the mouse pads are both running at full capacity but will be finishing up soon).
Looking at the calendar, an October delivery will be very tight, but still likely.  Worst case scenario, games will start showing up in early November--but I would of course be thrilled to hit my targeted release date.  The local pick-up is still planned, but a firm date won’t be possible until I know when the games will arrive--for those of you attending, please stay tuned!  If it turns out, after a date is set, that some of you can’t make it, I’ll either send it myself or, if practical, hand-deliver it to you.  :)
I want to thank all of you for filling out the survey I sent out recently. As of this writing, only 10 of you have yet to complete it, so I will have to come after you shortly.

campaign.story:
The creators of numerous successful Kickstarters, including Four Tribes, Dig Down Dwarf, and Of Dungeons Deep!, bring you a new and exciting game that uses dice to actually build trains!
In Trainmaker, you will step back in time to the Old West to roll the custom-molded railroad dice and begin building a train to meet the needs of the available Station Cards. Every train has to start with an engine and a train car. Will you take it easy and make a small train, or push your luck and reroll the dice to build a mighty train? Choose carefully, because if you can’t add to your train after rolling or finish the train with a caboose, you derail, and your turn ends! More details in the Overview Section.
Trainmaker is designed by Chris Leder, who is quickly moving up the ranks in the industry with his hit game Roll For It! by Calliope Games and his upcoming City of Gears by Arcane Wonders. 
Why Pledge Now?
Discount - By backing Trainmaker you will get your copy at a nice discount. The MSRP for Trainmaker will be $25, plus you are getting a $7 shipping credit (Free Shipping within the U.S.). That means that by pledging now, you will save more than 35%.  
Backers First - We have made it a priority in the past, and will continue to in the future, to ship games to backers before we open up sales to the public. It is only fair that those that helped make the game happen get their copies first!    
Your Feedback - We value your thoughts and ideas. Honestly it is what keeps us coming back to Kickstarter. Getting customer input before manufacturing is an invaluable asset to us!  
Stretch Rewards - By backing Trainmaker you will actually affect the outcome of the final game. The more we raise, the more that can be approved or added. See the "Stretch Goals" section for more details.  
We Simply Need You - Your continued support will allow us to pay for a large print run of what we feel is a fantastic product and help us ship it all over the world.
Trainmaker will now be manufactured by Panda GM. Panda GM is the industry standard in board game manufacturing. Our choice to use them is a direct reflection of my desire to make Trainmaker the absolute best it can be. 
 If we fund, we promise that Trainmaker will be a thrilling and rewarding experience for you and your family and friends. However, if we overfund, we will be able to expand the game in both quality and quantity. You see, the more we raise, the more units we will be able to manufacture. This equates to a lower unit cost. These savings WILL be added back into the game in the form of additional content and better-quality components. Below are these additional goals and rewards:
All Aboard is a quick solo game designed by Chris Leder. It is played with the train meeples and dice from the game. Chris is known for his one card game designs as he had a successful one released with Roll For It! last year.
Lawmen vs Robbers is a two-player game designed by Jonathan Gilmour, the designer behind the hit Dead of Winter. It plays a bit like Liars Dice, but with each player in the role of either Lawman or Robber. Each having their own distinct powers. Will include 2 all new role cards with all new artwork.
This will include a nice linen finish on the box itself.
Rail Tycoon is a 2-5 player game designed by Stephen Avery, the designer behind the hit Nothing Personal. In Rail Tycoon players will use almost all of the games components in a new way. This is a dice driven and card melding good time! Will include 5 all new tycoon cards with all new artwork.
7 Custom-Molded Dice
40 Station Cards 300gsm Unlocked!
12 Contract Cards 300gsm Unlocked!
6 Custom Train Engine Meeples Unlocked!
2 Reference Cards 300gsm Unlocked!
2 Piece Setup Box
BONUS All Aboard Mini Game designed by Chris Leder!
Instructions 
Trainmaker will mark the second game in our Small Box Series, with the Award-winning Dig Down Dwarf as the first. Our goal is build up a nice library of smaller games with a variety of mechanics and themes that all play big!
Trainmaker is a 2-6 player game that takes roughly 20-30 minutes to play and is enjoyed by players ages 8 and up.
The object of the game is to collect either one of each station type, or to complete your hidden contract. The first player to do so declares victory!
At the beginning of play, each player receives two random Contract Cards. They choose one and then discard the other from the game. This contract is the player's hidden objective for the game and is a separate and secret route to victory.
Then the game begins as players take turns rolling dice in an attempt to secure Station Cards.
Players may go after additional Station Cards on their turn if they are willing to begin a train with two engines instead of one! If they do so, and take a Station Card, they can re-roll all the dice used to create that train and go after another Station Card. It is possible to clear the table of all three available Station Cards on one turn if you are lucky and take a few risks!
Lastly, many of the station cards offer the player "Discard Powers". A player may discard an owned Station Card during their own turn to invoke a special "one time" power like re-rolling all their dice, or setting a die to a particular side. These powers offer the player a way to take further risks and make more choices during play in order to win. 
Print & Play Files and Rules Download Link

Above are some pictures of the prototype of the box from Lyris Laser Studio. As you can see the craftsmanship is very nice! The picture in the bottom-left illustrates one of our "small box series" games fitting perfectly into the box with plenty of room for goodies!
What is the Outlaws Expansion?
The Outlaws expansion introduces 3 bandits to the Station Cards deck. These jerks spend a round robbing players of one of their dice if they happen to roll the train car the outlaw wants to rob! But to counter this, 6 new Station Cards are added and each has the passive U.S. Marshal ability to protect the player from the bandits. The bandits are smart enough to move on to easier prey.

Our goal is to make a quality product and we understand the challenges of doing so. Our focus is to stay engaged with both our manufacturers and backers to keep everyone on the same page and informed. An informed backer is a happy backer.

If challenges arise, we will hit them head on. Sometimes an issue can cause a delay, and while delays are typically avoided, producing the the best product is always our end goal. Again, open communication with our backers is key.

All fulfillment will be done in house via the use of USPS. We have our quotes from manufacturers in hand and all artwork is close to complete.

We also have experience with Kickstarter, having run 7 successful campaigns for Plague The Card Game, Zogar's Gaze, Tasnia, Neptune, Four Tribes, Dig Down Dwarf, and Of Dungeons Deep! We feel that this experience gives us a good advantage if and when any issues arise.

All of our previous projects have been shipped to backers with the exception of Of Dungeons Deep!, which is not due until late spring/early summer. Of the six projects we have delivered, four were early or on time, and only two had a minor delay. Again, we always keep an open line of communication with our backers.

campaign.story:
We all love our boardgames to be pretty. Especially our favourite ones. One of the components that are most used in games are their currency.

By upgrading the components you most use of, you immediately upgrade the games' looks a lot! You can use our metal coins in all kinds of gaming, either tabletop, RPGs LARP, whatever you prefer.
 And for that purpose, here we are, to help you make your favorite games look better than ever. With this campaign we offer you the opportunity to get you these amazing metal coins to make your favorite games shine!
Choose from our huge variety of 11 unique sets, covering different flavors, to make sure YOUR favorite game can use one of these.
 Each contains different designs, in gold, silver and copper plated metal, and of course, each design with have a different "heads" and "tails" side to be more realistic.

Also, in each set a free velvet (100% cotton) pouch is added for free. You can choose from a selection of these 5 lovely colors:
We wanted to make a lot of different kinds so you can choose your favorites, so we introduce you to these Metal Sets:
For all your fantasy games you want to give an elven look. I can cerainly see them used as coins in many LoTR games.
For games set in the Asia, such as Yspahan, or Camel Up
 One of our favorites. I would certainly use them in dwarven-themed games like Caverna, Terra Mystica or any other fantasy game.
 This is our more royal set, the one a king would love to have on his region, or a player on his Caylus or Game of Thrones.
You can't make anything Legendary without a Dragon. And this set would be much less legendary without this Dragon set. You can easilly use them in asy fantasy game or in DnD
 A collection for games set in Asia, or else Far East. Can be used in games such as Takenoko, In the Year of the Dragon and much more.
It was time that these doublons got a level-up. This pirate theme will be great for games like Merchants and Marauders.
 One of our most unique sets. Coins so futuristic can certainly be used in Android:Netrunner or any games set in the future.
 A Steampunk coin set for games like Steam Park or Mission:Red Planet. Let's shine these gears!
We couldn't resist making something from our own history. You can use these goodies in games such as Cyclades or Colloseum.
In the dark medieval times, currency was more functional than pretty. We really tried to keep them simple, but sometimes inspiration cannot wait.
 Orc Coins Unlocked:  The most battered of all! For your Warhammer and other fantasy games! We could not resists another fantasy coin set,
 Wild West Coins unlocked: To live the Wild West the proper way thorugh games such us Carson City or Shadows of Brimstone.
The material used in all coins is Zinc alloy, and the sizes vary from 2.7 to 3.2 mm thick, while the diameter is from 2.9cm to 3.5cm wide.
Yes, that means they are pretty massive.

But, don't take only our word for these. Check out what all these guys think about them in these video presentations:
 Update: New video review from Undead Viking and Geek-Craft!

Also, here you can read a review from Rob from GeekDad.


And here is an image of  the coins of the Dwarven Set and the Greek Set. Can you spot that little on the corner? That is a USD quarter (so you can have a reference for their size). Also, you can see the comparison of the thickness of the coins (both our larger sets like the Dwarven ones and the smaller like the Greek).

Both Images were created from ConnectMoreBoardGames. Many thanks David .

And this is an image demonstrating the different diameters in each Set.


Free International Shipping

And since we are talking about delivery, we are going to start production immediately after the campaign is over, since the only thing missing to start is funding. That means that you are all going to receive your coins by July (or even sooner than that).

Also, our project is EU friendly, so none of our European friends has to worry about customs.
 
You want some of these cool coins for you? Choose the rewards that fits you best:
  Single Set Pledge This is the simplest you can get. Choose one of the 11 sets and get 24 coins of that set.
 Of course, in some games you will need even more coins, or maybe less but don't worry, we've got you covered. You can add more coins, of whatever design you prefer, with 1$ each after you purchuased one of the single sets. Also, you can pick up Two or More Sets, either with the same or different design. The more you add, the better discount you get.

Update: After unlocking many Stretch Goals, each set now cointains 12 copper coins, 9 silver, 7 gold and we may unlock even more coins!

Wooden Chest with metal parts! It can contain 40-50 coins.
